<S>Media baron <PERSON>Rupert Murdoch</PERSON>'s <ORGANIZATION>News Corp Ltd</ORGANIZATION> reported lower than expected 1995/96 profits on Thursday , but forecast that the hit film " Independence Day " would help increase profits by at least 20 percent in 1996/97 .</S>
<S>" From an earnings perspective , the current fiscal year has begun with great promise due to the hit motion picture ' Independence Day , ' " <ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION> said in a statement announcing its results for the year to June 30 , 1996 .</S>
<S>It said moderating paper prices and solid orders for advertising at its <ORGANIZATION>Fox Broadcasting</ORGANIZATION> television network in the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> would also help boost profits in the 1996/97 year . "</S>
<S>A budgeted profit increase of at least 20 percent for the full year currently appears very attainable , " <ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>The bullish comments for the coming year soothed analysts and most shareholders , who were disappointed by the lower than expected profit for 1995/96 .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News</ORGANIZATION> announced pre-abnormals net profit for the year fell six percent to A$ 1.26 billion ( US$ 995 million ) and earnings per share dropped to 40 cents from 46 cents .</S>
<S>Analysts had on average expected a pre-abnormals profit of A$ 1.343 billion .</S>
<S>" The year just gone was disappointing , but the outlook for the current year looks good , " <ORGANIZATION>First Pacific</ORGANIZATION> media analyst <PERSON>Lachlan Drummond</PERSON> said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION> said strong performances in <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> television and British newspapers were offset by lower profits from <ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION>'s magazine and publishing divisions and further hefty losses from its <ORGANIZATION>Asian Star TV</ORGANIZATION> operations .</S>
<S>Higher newsprint prices hit profits hard . "</S>
<S>Throughout the group , higher paper prices increased costs by over US$ 300 million , " it said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION> said British newspaper operating profits rose 10 percent for the year , as higher cover prices at <ORGANIZATION>The Sun</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>The Times</ORGANIZATION> and higher advertising volumes offset increased newsprint costs .</S>
<S>Advertising revenues at <ORGANIZATION>The Times</ORGANIZATION> grew 20 percent .</S>
<S>Analysts said sharply lower earnings from <ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION>'s book publishing division and its <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> magazines had been the major surprises in the results for 1995/96 .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION> said revenue gains at its magazines and inserts division were offset by higher paper prices and lower sales at the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> <ORGANIZATION>TV Guide</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News</ORGANIZATION> said dramatically lower earnings from the British arm of its <ORGANIZATION>Harper-Collins</ORGANIZATION> publishing division more than offset healthy results from its <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> operation .</S>
<S>It said the demise of the Net Book Agreement had hurt the British operations , and weak performances from the <LOCATION>San Francisco</LOCATION> unit of <ORGANIZATION>Harper-Collins</ORGANIZATION> had not helped .</S>
<S>The minimum price setting expired last September when three publishers pulled out .</S>
<S>But it was the bullish profit forecast for 1996/97 that took the spotlight in the market , with some analysts saying 20 percent may even be an understatement .</S>
<S>" If they're saying at least 20 percent , then their internal forecasts are probably saying 25 or 30 percent , " said one <LOCATION>Sydney</LOCATION> media analyst who declined to be named .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>News Corp</ORGANIZATION>'s shares were down eight cents at A$ 6.39 at 2.00 p.m. ( 0400 GMT ) in a soft market .</S>
<S>( A$ 1 = US$ 0.79 )</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>RTRS</ORGANIZATION> - Budget cuts to boost <LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> savings - <ORGANIZATION>RBA</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>CANBERRA</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S>The Australian government's plans to slash its budget deficit should make a useful contribution to national savings , the <ORGANIZATION>Reserve Bank of Australia</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>RBA</ORGANIZATION> ) said in its annual report .</S>
<S>" The government's announced plans to balance the budget , if realised , would make a useful contribution to raising national savings , " the <ORGANIZATION>RBA</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>The bank said there were concerns fiscal consolidation would unduly restrict growth , but evidence was ambiguous .</S>
<S>In its 1996/97 budget announced on Tuesday , the Australian <ORGANIZATION>Coalition</ORGANIZATION> government announced an underlying budget deficit of A$ 5.65 billion , and pledged to return the underlying budget balance to surplus by 1998/99 .</S>
<S>The budget deficit was A$ 10.3 billion in 1995/96 .</S>
<S>-- <ORGANIZATION>Sydney Newsroom</ORGANIZATION> 61-2 9373-1800</S>
<S>" Determined and credible efforts to rein in unsustainable fiscal positions ( are ) often rewarded by rising confidence , giving favourable effects on economic activity even in the short term , " it said .</S>
<S>" More generally , the long-term effects of fiscal consolidation are clearly positive , with higher saving tending to promote economic growth by raising investment and lowering long-term real interest rates , " the <ORGANIZATION>RBA</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> hails peace as marks five-year independence .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rostislav Khotin</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>KIEV</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> celebrates five years of independence from <LOCATION>Kremlin</LOCATION> rule on Saturday , hailing civil and inter-ethnic peace as its main post-Soviet achievement .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION>'s declaration of independence in 1991 , backed nine-to-one by a referendum in December of that year , effectively dealt a death blow to the Soviet empire and ended more than three centuries of rule from <LOCATION>Moscow</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> , with a Russian community of 11 million people -- the world's largest outside <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> -- has avoided conflicts like those in <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Chechnya</LOCATION> , neighbouring <LOCATION>Moldova</LOCATION> , and the former Soviet republics of <LOCATION>Georgia</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Azerbaijan</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Tajikistan</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION>'s biggest achievements for five years are the preservation of civil peace and inter-ethnic harmony , " President <PERSON>Leonid Kuchma</PERSON> said in televised statement this week .</S>
<S>" Unlike many other post-Soviet countries we were able to deal with conflict situations in a peaceful and civilised way . "</S>
<S>But independence was initially accompanied by hyper-inflation and economic collapse , although there are signs of a turnaround .</S>
<S>Inflation -- a hyper-inflationary 10,300 percent a year in 1993 -- was a respectable 0.1 percent a month in June and July and the economy has just begun to grow .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kuchma</PERSON> told a solemn ceremony at the <LOCATION>Ukraina Palace</LOCATION> on Friday that " there was a turning point " in reforms and that he expected a rise in the standard of living in the near future .</S>
<S>" There is no doubt that economic growth has already started , " said <PERSON>Adelbert Knobl</PERSON> , head of the <ORGANIZATION>International Monetary Fund</ORGANIZATION>'s mission in <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> . "</S>
<S>The national bank and the government have every reason to be proud of their efforts . "</S>
<S>Central bank officials said on Thursday that a much-postponed hryvna currency would " definitely " be introduced before the end of this year .</S>
<S>It will replace the interim karbovanets currency , which was introduced at par to the Russian rouble in 1992 but now trades at almost 33 karbovanets per rouble .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> has repeatedly promised to introduce the hryvna but had to postpone the plans because of economic problems .</S>
<S>Proud of its record in promptly joining both the <ORGANIZATION>Council of Europe</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>NATO</ORGANIZATION>'s Partnership for Peace , <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> caused a foreign policy wrangle this week , offending <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> by allowing a Taiwanese minister to appear on a public , if unofficial visit .</S>
<S><LOCATION>China</LOCATION> cancelled a visit by a top-level delegation in protest .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Kiev</LOCATION>'s Foreign Minister <PERSON>Hennady Udovenko</PERSON> said <LOCATION>Beijing</LOCATION> was overreacting .</S>
<S>But <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> , seeing itself as a bridge between <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> and the rapidly Westernising countries of eastern <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> , is looking West as well as East .</S>
<S>" The strategic aim of European integration should not in any way damage <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION>'s interests in post-Soviet areas .</S>
<S>Relations with <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> , which is our main partner , have great importance , " <PERSON>Kuchma</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" But <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> cannot be economically oriented on <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> , even though those in some circles push us to do that . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Kuchma</PERSON> has said <LOCATION>Kiev</LOCATION> wants membership of the <ORGANIZATION>European Union</ORGANIZATION> , associate membership of the <ORGANIZATION>Western European Union</ORGANIZATION> defence grouping and to move closer to <ORGANIZATION>NATO</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>A message from the West this week from <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> President <PERSON>Bill Clinton</PERSON> congratulated <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> on the anniversary , promising to support market reforms and praising <LOCATION>Ukraine</LOCATION> as a " stabilising factor " in a united <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>Oldest <LOCATION>Albania</LOCATION> book disappears from <LOCATION>Vatican</LOCATION> - paper .</S>
<S><LOCATION>TIRANA</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>A 16th-century document , the earliest complete example of written Albanian , has disappeared from the <LOCATION>Vatican</LOCATION> archives , an Albanian newspaper said on Friday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Gazeta Shqiptare</ORGANIZATION> said the " Book of Mass ' , by <PERSON>Gjon Buzuku</PERSON> , dating from 1555 and discovered in 1740 in a religious seminary in <LOCATION>Rome</LOCATION> , was the first major document published in the Albanian language .</S>
<S>" We Albanians , sons of Buzuku , believed our language had a written document but now we do not have it any more , " lamented scholar <PERSON>Musa Hamiti</PERSON> , told of the loss by the <LOCATION>Vatican</LOCATION> library .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Tirana</LOCATION>'s national library has three copies of the " Book of Mass ' . "</S>
<S>There is nothing left for us but to be grateful to civilisation for inventing photocopies , " <ORGANIZATION>Gazeta Shqiptare</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> to clamp down on barter deals .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MOSCOW</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Russian officials , keen to cut capital flight , will adopt tight measures to cut barter deals in foreign trade to a minimum , a customs official said on Friday .</S>
<S>" We have always been concerned about barter deals with other countries , viewing them as a disguised kind of capital flight from <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> , " <PERSON>Marina Volkova</PERSON> , deputy head of the currency department at the <ORGANIZATION>State Customs Committee</ORGANIZATION> , told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said last year goods had been exported under many Russian barter deals , with nothing imported in return .</S>
<S>She said the cost of such unimported goods was $ 1.10 billion in 1995 .</S>
<S>Barter deals were worth $ 4.9 billion last year , or about eight percent of all Russian exports estimated at $ 61.5 billion , she said .</S>
<S>" The cost of exported goods is too often understated , so the actual share of barter deals in Russian exports and the amount of unimported goods may be even higher , " <PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>A few days ago Russian President <PERSON>Boris Yeltsin</PERSON> issued a decree on state regulation of foreign barter deals , and <PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said this " could substantially improve the situation " .</S>
<S>In line with the decree , which will come into force on November 1 , all Russian barter traders will be obliged to import goods worth the cost of their exports within 180 days .</S>
<S>" If traders are late , they will have to pay fines worth the cost of their exported goods , " <PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>Understating the cost of exported goods could still be a loophole for barter dealers , but <PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said the authorities are currently " tackling the technicalities of the issue " .</S>
<S>Barter has always been a feature of the <LOCATION>Soviet Union</LOCATION>'s foreign trade , but <PERSON>Yeltsin</PERSON>'s decrees liberalising foreign trade in 1991-1992 has given barter a new impetus .</S>
<S>A few years ago , barter deals accounted for up to 25-30 percent of Russian exports because " thousands ( of ) trade companies which popped up preferred barter in the absence of reliable Russian banks and money transfer systems " , <PERSON>Volkova</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" Now many Russian banks are strong and can make various sorts of money tranfers , while incompetent traders are being ousted by more experienced ones .</S>
<S>But the current share of barter deals in Russian exports is still high , " she said .</S>
<S>-- <PERSON>Dmitry Solovyov</PERSON> , <ORGANIZATION>Moscow Newsroom</ORGANIZATION> , +7095 941 8520</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Viacom</ORGANIZATION> plans " Mission " sequel - report .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LOS ANGELES</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Paramount Pictures</ORGANIZATION> is going ahead with a sequel to the <PERSON>Tom Cruise</PERSON> blockbuster , " Mission : Impossible " and hopes to release it in the summer of 1998 , <ORGANIZATION>Daily Variety</ORGANIZATION> reported in its Friday edition .</S>
<S>The big-screen version of the spy TV series has grossed $ 175 million domestically since opening May 22 , and $ 338 million overseas so far .</S>
<S>It's the biggest success for Viacom Inc-owned <ORGANIZATION>Paramount</ORGANIZATION> since 1994's " Forrest Gump " .</S>
<S>However , many critics complained its plot was incomprehensible .</S>
<S><PERSON>Cruise</PERSON> will reprise his roles as star and co-producer , and will soon meet Academy Award-winning screenwriter <PERSON>William Goldman</PERSON> , who will write the script , the report said .</S>
<S>It said " Mission : Impossible " director <PERSON>Brian De Palma</PERSON> would have first crack at the sequel , though no deals have been made yet .</S>
<S><PERSON>Goldman</PERSON> , whose Oscars were for " Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid " and " All the President's Men " , earlier this summer criticised some of the season's blockbusters .</S>
<S>However , he singled out " Mission : Impossible " as an especially entertaining movie , <ORGANIZATION>Daily Variety</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>CRICKET - <PERSON>CRAWLEY</PERSON> FORCED TO SIT AND WAIT .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>England</LOCATION> batsman <PERSON>John Crawley</PERSON> was forced to endure a frustrating delay of over three hours before resuming his quest for a maiden test century in the third test against <LOCATION>Pakistan</LOCATION> on Friday .</S>
<S>Heavy overnight rain and morning drizzle ruled out any play before lunch on the second day but an improvement in the weather prompted the umpires to announce a 1415 local time ( 1315 GMT ) start in the event of no further rain .</S>
<S><PERSON>Crawley</PERSON> , unbeaten on 94 overnight in an <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> total of 278 for six , was spotted strumming a guitar in the dressing-room as the <LOCATION>Oval</LOCATION> ground staff took centre stage .</S>
<S>There were several damp patches on the square and the outfield and it was still raining when the players took an early lunch at 1230 local time ( 1130 GMT ) .</S>
<S>When brighter weather finally arrived , the umpires announced a revised figure of 67 overs to be bowled with play extended to at least 1900 local time ( 1800 GMT ) .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>CRICKET - <PERSON>POLLOCK</PERSON> HOPES FOR RETURN TO <ORGANIZATION>WARWICKSHIRE</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>South African all-rounder <PERSON>Shaun Pollock</PERSON> , forced to cut short his first season with <ORGANIZATION>Warwickshire</ORGANIZATION> to have ankle surgery , has told the English county he would like to return later in his career .</S>
<S><PERSON>Pollock</PERSON> , who returns home a month early next week , said : " I would like to come back and play county cricket in the future and I don't think I would like to swap counties . "</S>
<S>Explaining his premature departure was unavoidable , <PERSON>Pollock</PERSON> said : " I have been carrying the injury for a while and I hope that by having the surgery now I will be able to last out the new season back home . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>SOCCER - SPONSORS CASH IN ON <PERSON>RAVANELLI</PERSON>'s SHIRT DANCE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Middlesbrough</ORGANIZATION>'s Italian striker <PERSON>Fabrizio Ravanelli</PERSON> is to wear his team sponsor's name on the inside of his shirt so it can be seen when he scores .</S>
<S>Every time he finds the net , the grey-haired forward pulls his shirtfront over his head as he runs to salute the fans , and <ORGANIZATION>Middlesbrough</ORGANIZATION>'s sponsors want to cash in on the spectacle .</S>
<S>" Having seen <PERSON>Ravanelli</PERSON> celebrate his goals ...</S>
<S>we thought it would be fun to have ( the name ) on the inside of his shirt , " a spokesman for the sponsors said .</S>
<S>" It will give the fans something else to look at besides his chest . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Ravanelli</PERSON> aggravated a foot injury in the 1-0 defeat at <ORGANIZATION>Chelsea</ORGANIZATION> on Wednesday and was given only an even chance of playing at <LOCATION>Nottingham Forest</LOCATION> on Saturday by his manager <PERSON>Bryan Robson</PERSON> .</S>

<S>TENNIS - AUSTRALIANS ADVANCE AT CANADIAN OPEN .</S>
<S><LOCATION>TORONTO</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S>It was Australia Day at the $ 2 million Canadian Open on Thursday as three Aussies reached the quarter-finals with straight-set victories .</S>
<S>Unseeded <PERSON>Patrick Rafter</PERSON> recorded the most noteworthy result as he upset sixth-seeded American <PERSON>MaliVai Washington</PERSON> 6-2 6-1 in just 50 minutes .</S>
<S><PERSON>Todd Woodbridge</PERSON> , who defeated Canadian <PERSON>Daniel Nestor</PERSON> 7-6 ( 7-2 ) 7-6 ( 7-4 ) , and <PERSON>Mark Philippoussis</PERSON> , a 6-3 6-4 winner over <PERSON>Bohdan Ulihrach</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> , also advanced and will meet in Friday's quarter-finals .</S>
<S>Third-seeded <PERSON>Wayne Ferreira</PERSON> of <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> defeated <PERSON>Tim Henman</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> 6-4 6-4 after a three-hour evening rain delay and fifth-seeded <PERSON>Thomas Enqvist</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION> won his third-round match , eliminating <PERSON>Petr Korda</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> 6-3 6-4 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ferreira</PERSON> and <PERSON>Enqvist</PERSON> play in a Friday night quarter-final .</S>
<S>Two Americans , seventh seed <PERSON>Todd Martin</PERSON> and unseeded <PERSON>Alex O'Brien</PERSON> , will meet on Friday after winning matches on Thursday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin</PERSON> overcame <PERSON>Cedric Pioline</PERSON> of <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> 2-6 6-2 6-4 and <PERSON>O'Brien</PERSON> beat <PERSON>Mikael Tillstrom</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION> 6-3 2-6 6-3 .</S>
<S>" If you really look at the match , " said the 12th-ranked <PERSON>Washington</PERSON> after losing to the 70th-ranked <PERSON>Rafter</PERSON> , " I never really got a chance to play because he was serving big and getting in close to the net .</S>
<S>" He was also able to handle my serve pretty easily because my ( first ) service percentage was only in the 40s .</S>
<S>Put those two things together and you get a loss . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Rafter</PERSON> missed 10 weeks after wrist surgery earlier this year and the time away from tennis has given him a new perspective .</S>
<S>" Before when I was on tour , I always felt I had to be in bed by 9:30 or 10 o'clock and I had to be up at a certain time , " <PERSON>Rafter</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Now I can go to bed at at midnight or wake up at seven in the morning .</S>
<S>I just don't have as many set routines and it's made me a happier person . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin</PERSON> was pleased with his victory over <PERSON>Pioline</PERSON> , his first in five meetings with the 11th-ranked Frenchman . "</S>
<S>It's always difficult to win a match when you lose the first set , especially against someone you have never beaten , " he said .</S>
<S>" I got more aggressive in the second and third sets and the wind picked up and that also affected things because <PERSON>Cedric</PERSON> definitely went off a little bit . "</S>
<S>The 26-year-old <PERSON>O'Brien</PERSON> , who won the ATP Tour stop in <LOCATION>New Haven</LOCATION> last week , has now won 18 of his last 20 matches , dating back to qualifying rounds in <LOCATION>Los Angeles</LOCATION> in late July .</S>
<S>He ranks 76th after being 285th four weeks ago .</S>
<S>" I feel I'm hitting the ball well even though I'm having more mental letdowns than I did last week , " <PERSON>O'Brien</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>But I'm still competing well . "</S>
<S>" I got a lot of first serves in , " said <PERSON>Enqvist</PERSON> about his victory over <PERSON>Korda</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>I didn't miss that many shots and he was making the mistakes . "</S>
<S>Still marvelling at an exciting 64-stroke rally he won in the last game of his second-round match against <PERSON>Javier Sanchez</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Spain</LOCATION> on Tuesday , <PERSON>Enqvist</PERSON> joked , " Today against <PERSON>Petr</PERSON> there were about 64 strokes in the whole match .</S>
<S>It was mostly short points . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>TENNIS - INJURED <PERSON>CHANDA RUBIN</PERSON> OUT OF U.S. OPEN .</S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Promising 10th-ranked American <PERSON>Chanda Rubin</PERSON> has pulled out of the U.S. Open Tennis Championships with a wrist injury , tournament officials announced .</S>
<S>The 20-year-old <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> , who was to be seeded 11th , is still suffering from tendinitis of the right wrist that has kept her sidelined in recent months .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rubin</PERSON>'s misfortune turned into a very lucky break for eighth-seeded Olympic champion <PERSON>Lindsay Davenport</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Davenport</PERSON> had drawn one of the toughest first-round assignments of any of the seeded players in 17th-ranked <PERSON>Karina Habsudova</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Slovakia</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>But as the highest-ranked non-seeded player in the tournament , <PERSON>Habsudova</PERSON> will be moved into <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON>'s slot in the draw , while <PERSON>Davenport</PERSON> will now get a qualifier in the first round , according to U.S. Tennis Association officials .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> is the third notable withdrawal from the women's competition after 12th-ranked former Australian Open champion <PERSON>Mary Pierce</PERSON> and 20th-ranked Wimbledon semifinalist <PERSON>Meredith McGrath</PERSON> pulled out earlier this week with injuries .</S>
<S>Men's Australian Open champion <PERSON>Boris Becker</PERSON> will also miss the year's final Grand Slam with a wrist injury .</S>

<S>BASEBALL - <PERSON>SORRENTO</PERSON> HITS SLAM AS <ORGANIZATION>SEATTLE</ORGANIZATION> ROUTS <ORGANIZATION>ORIOLES</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BALTIMORE</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S>Former Oriole <PERSON>Jamie Moyer</PERSON> allowed two hits over eight scoreless innings before tiring in the ninth and <PERSON>Paul Sorrento</PERSON> added his third grand slam of the season as the <ORGANIZATION>Seattle Mariners</ORGANIZATION> routed <ORGANIZATION>Baltimore</ORGANIZATION> 10-3 Thursday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Moyer</PERSON> ( 10-2 ) , who was tagged for a pair of homers by <PERSON>Mike Devereaux</PERSON> and <PERSON>Brady Anderson</PERSON> and three runs in the ninth , walked none and struck out two .</S>
<S><PERSON>Norm Charlton</PERSON> retired the final three batters to seal the victory .</S>
<S>With one out in the fifth <PERSON>Ken Griffey Jr</PERSON> and <PERSON>Edgar Martinez</PERSON> stroked back-to-back singles off <ORGANIZATION>Orioles</ORGANIZATION> starter <PERSON>Rocky Coppinger</PERSON> ( 7-5 ) and <PERSON>Jay Buhner</PERSON> walked .</S>
<S><PERSON>Sorrento</PERSON> followed by hitting a 1-2 pitch just over the right-field wall for a 7-0 advantage .</S>
<S>Right fielder <PERSON>Bobby Bonilla</PERSON> was after the ball , which was touched by fans at the top of the scoreboard in right .</S>
<S>" Things fell in for us , " said <PERSON>Sorrento</PERSON> , who has six career grand slams and hit the ninth of the season for the <ORGANIZATION>Mariners</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" We have over a month left .</S>
<S>We've got to make up some ground . "</S>
<S>In the American League wild-card race , the <ORGANIZATION>Mariners</ORGANIZATION> are three games behind the <ORGANIZATION>White Sox</ORGANIZATION> , two behind <ORGANIZATION>Baltimore</ORGANIZATION> and two ahead of the <ORGANIZATION>Red Sox</ORGANIZATION> heading into <LOCATION>Boston</LOCATION> for a weekend series .</S>
<S><PERSON>Moyer</PERSON> retired 11 straight batters between the third and seventh innings and threw two or fewer pitches to 11 of the 29 batters he faced .</S>
<S>" I made some bad pitches at the end but I'm not going to dwell on it .</S>
<S>We won the game , " said <PERSON>Moyer</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Coppinger</PERSON> ( 7-5 ) was tagged for eight runs and 10 hits in 4 1/3 innings .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Orioles</ORGANIZATION> manager <PERSON>Davey Johnson</PERSON> missed the game after being admitted to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat .</S>
<S>Bench coach <PERSON>Andy Etchebarren</PERSON> took his place .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Boston</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Troy O'Leary</PERSON> homered off the right-field foul pole with one out in the bottom of the ninth and the <ORGANIZATION>Red Sox</ORGANIZATION> climbed to the .500 mark for the first time this season with their fourth straight victory , 2-1 over the <ORGANIZATION>Oakland Athletics</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Boston</ORGANIZATION> has won 15 of its last 19 games .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Boston</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Roger Clemens</PERSON> ( 7-11 ) was one out away from his second straight shutout when pinch-hitter <PERSON>Matt Stairs</PERSON> tripled over the head of centre fielder <PERSON>Lee Tinsley</PERSON> on an 0-2 pitch and pinch-hitter <PERSON>Terry Steinbach</PERSON> dunked a broken-bat single into right to lift <ORGANIZATION>Oakland</ORGANIZATION> into a 1-1 tie .</S>
<S>The run broke <PERSON>Clemens</PERSON> ' 28-inning shutout streak , longest in the majors this season .</S>
<S>He pitched his fourth complete game , allowing eight hits with two walks and 11 strikeouts .</S>
<S>Reliever <PERSON>Mark Acre</PERSON> ( 0-1 ) took the loss .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Garret Anderson</PERSON> and <PERSON>Gary DiSarcina</PERSON> drove in two runs apiece in a five-run first inning and <PERSON>Jim Edmonds</PERSON> highlighted a six-run sixth with a bases-loaded double as the <ORGANIZATION>California Angels</ORGANIZATION> coasted to a 12-3 victory over the <ORGANIZATION>Yankees</ORGANIZATION> in the rubber game of their three-game series .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Angels</ORGANIZATION> battered <PERSON>Kenny Rogers</PERSON> ( 10-7 ) for five runs in the first .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Yankees</ORGANIZATION> have allowed at least two runs in the first inning in six straight games , getting outscored 21-1 in the first inning in that span .</S>
<S><PERSON>Chuck Finley</PERSON> ( 12-12 ) snapped a four-game losing streak .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Kansas City</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Travis Fryman</PERSON> doubled in the go-ahead run in the fifth and <PERSON>Melvin Nieves</PERSON> and <PERSON>Damion Easley</PERSON> belted two-run homers as the <ORGANIZATION>Detroit Tigers</ORGANIZATION> claimed a 10-3 win over the <ORGANIZATION>Royals</ORGANIZATION> , handing them their fifth straight loss .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Tigers</ORGANIZATION> won their third straight and halted a seven-game road losing streak behind <PERSON>Justin Thompson</PERSON> ( 1-2 ) , who earned his first major-league win .</S>
<S><PERSON>Tim Belcher</PERSON> ( 12-8 ) was tagged for six runs and nine hits in eight innings .</S>
<S>At <LOCATION>Minnesota</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Ken Hill</PERSON> allowed two runs en route to his sixth complete game of the season and <PERSON>Rusty Greer</PERSON> added three hits , including a homer , and two RBI as the red-hot <ORGANIZATION>Texas Rangers</ORGANIZATION> routed the <ORGANIZATION>Twins</ORGANIZATION> 11-2 .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Rangers</ORGANIZATION> , who won for the 11th time in their last 13 games , have scored 45 runs in their last five contests .</S>
<S><PERSON>Hill</PERSON> ( 14-7 ) allowed 10 hits .</S>
<S>He has yielded just seven runs in his last four starts , covering 33 1/3 innings .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Chicago</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Erik Hanson</PERSON> outdueled <PERSON>Alex Fernandez</PERSON> , and <PERSON>Jacob Brumfield</PERSON> drove in <PERSON>Otis Nixon</PERSON> with the game's only run in the sixth inning as the <ORGANIZATION>Toronto Blue Jays</ORGANIZATION> blanked the <ORGANIZATION>White Sox</ORGANIZATION> 1-0 in a game shortened to six innings due to rain .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Toronto</ORGANIZATION> won its fifth straight and handed the <ORGANIZATION>White Sox</ORGANIZATION> their seventh loss in nine games .</S>
<S><PERSON>Hanson</PERSON> ( 11-15 ) allowed three hits , walked three and struck out four to snap a personal three-game losing streak .</S>
<S><PERSON>Fernandez</PERSON> ( 12-8 ) scattered six hits .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><PERSON>Predrosa</PERSON> drilled a right-foot shot into the back of the net after 24 minutes to set <ORGANIZATION>Sporting</ORGANIZATION> on the way to victory .</S>
<S>Although <ORGANIZATION>Espinho</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Nail Besirovic</PERSON> put the home side back on terms in the 35th minute , <ORGANIZATION>Sporting</ORGANIZATION> quickly restored their lead .</S>

<S>ATHLETICS - <PERSON>MASTERKOVA</PERSON> BREAKS SECOND WORLD RECORD IN 10 DAYS .</S>
<S><PERSON>Adrian Warner</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>BRUSSELS</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION>'s double Olympic champion <PERSON>Svetlana Masterkova</PERSON> smashed her second world record in just 10 days on Friday when she bettered the mark for the women's 1,000 metres .</S>
<S>After breaking the world record for the women's mile in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> last Wednesday , the Olympic 800 and 1,500 metres champion clocked two minutes 28.98 seconds over 1,000 at the <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> grand prix meeting .</S>
<S>The Russian ate up the ground in a swift last lap to shave 0.36 seconds off the previous best of 2:29.34 set by <LOCATION>Mozambique</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Maria Mutola</PERSON> in the same stadium in August last year .</S>
<S>Former world 800 champion <PERSON>Mutola</PERSON> pushed <PERSON>Masterkova</PERSON> all the way , finishing second in 2:29.66 .</S>
<S>But it was the Russian who picked up the bonus of $ 25,000 for the historic run in front of a capacity 40,000 crowd .</S>
<S><PERSON>Masterkova</PERSON> dominated the middle-distance races at the recent Atlanta Games following her return to competition this season after a three-year maternity break .</S>
<S>In her first mile race at the richest meeting in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> last Wednesday , she slashed 3.05 seconds off the previous record .</S>
<S>The record of four minutes , 12.56 seconds in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> earned <PERSON>Masterkova</PERSON> a bonus of $ 50,000 plus one kilo of gold .</S>
<S>After Friday's performance the Russian will have earned well over $ 100,000 in less than a fortnight , taking her appearance money into account .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> organisers had laid a new track for the meeting comparable to the surface at the Atlanta Games but put down on a softer surface .</S>
<S><PERSON>Masterkova</PERSON> clearly enjoyed it .</S>
<S><PERSON>Mutola</PERSON> looked threatening in the final 200 metres but the Russian found an extra gear to power home several strides ahead , pointing at the time on the clock with delight as she crossed the line .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>BRUSSELS</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>ATHLETICS - <PERSON>MITCHELL</PERSON> UPSTAGES TRIO OF OLYMPIC SPRINT CHAMPIONS .</S>
<S><PERSON>Adrian Warner</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>BRUSSELS</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>American <PERSON>Dennis Mitchell</PERSON> upstaged a trio of past and present Olympic 100 metres champions on Friday with a storming victory at the <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> grand prix .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Sporting</ORGANIZATION> his customary bright green outfit , the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> champion clocked 10.03 seconds despite damp conditions to take the scalp of <LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s reigning Olympic champion <PERSON>Donovan Bailey</PERSON> , 1992 champion <PERSON>Linford Christie</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> and American 1984 and 1988 champion <PERSON>Carl Lewis</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Mitchell</PERSON> also beat world and Olympic champion <PERSON>Bailey</PERSON> at the most lucrative meeting in the sport in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> last week .</S>
<S>The American , who finished fourth at the Atlanta Games , was fast out of his blocks and held off <PERSON>Bailey</PERSON>'s late burst in the final 20 metres before heading off for a lap of celebration .</S>
<S>The Canadian was second in 10.09 with <PERSON>Lewis</PERSON> third in 10.10 , ahead of <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> bronze medallist <PERSON>Ato Boldon</PERSON> who clocked 10.12 in fourth .</S>
<S><PERSON>Christie</PERSON> , competing in what is expected to be his last major international meeting , finished fifth in 10.14 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Lewis</PERSON> , making a rare appearance in <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> in a sprint race , left the track with a slight limp .</S>
<S>American Olympic high hurdles champion <PERSON>Allen Johnson</PERSON> defied the wet conditions to produce a brilliant 12.92 seconds in the 110 metres race , just 0.01 outside the world record held by <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Colin Jackson</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Johnson</PERSON> ran the same time at the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> Olympic trials in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> in June to become the second equal fastest hurdler of all time with American <PERSON>Roger Kingdom</PERSON> .</S>
<S>He seemed to relish the new track at the <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> meeting , dominating the race from start to finish with a slight wind at his back .</S>
<S><PERSON>Jackson</PERSON> , the only man to have run faster , could not live with his speed , taking second in 13.24 seconds .</S>
<S>The rain was pelting down when the women's high hurdlers stepped up for their 100 metres race .</S>
<S>But <LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION>'s Olympic high hurdles champion <PERSON>Ludmila Engquist</PERSON> , who crashed out of last week's meeting in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> after hitting a hurdle , also kept her footing perfectly to win in a fast 12.60 seconds .</S>
<S>Olympic silver medallist <PERSON>Brigita Bukovec</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Slovenia</LOCATION> could finish only fifth in the race in 12.95 .</S>
<S>Jamaican <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> champion <PERSON>Michelle Freeman</PERSON> took second in 12.77 ahead of Cuban <PERSON>Aliuska Lopez</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> fall cost <PERSON>Engquist</PERSON> a shot at a jackpot of 20 one-kg gold bars which can be won by athletes who clinch their events at all of the Golden Four series in <LOCATION>Oslo</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Berlin</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Seven athletes went into Friday's penultimate meeting of the series with a chance of winning the prize and American men's 400 metres hurdles champion <PERSON>Derrick Adkins</PERSON> kept his hopes alive in the competition by winning his event in 47.93 .</S>
<S>American Olympic champion <PERSON>Gail Devers</PERSON> clocked a swift 10.84 seconds on her way to victory in the women's 100 metres , the second fastest time of the season and 0.10 seconds faster than her winning time in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Jamaican veteran <PERSON>Merlene Ottey</PERSON> , who beat <PERSON>Devers</PERSON> in <LOCATION>Zurich</LOCATION> after just missing out on the gold medal in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> after a photo finish , had to settle for third place in 11.04 .</S>
<S>American world champion <PERSON>Gwen Torrence</PERSON> , the bronze medallist in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> , was second in 11.00 .</S>
<S>It was a costly defeat for <PERSON>Ottey</PERSON> since it threw her out of the race for the Golden Four jackpot .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>LISBON</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Portugal</LOCATION>'s new coach <PERSON>Artur Jorge</PERSON> called up six players from league champions <ORGANIZATION>Porto</ORGANIZATION> on Friday in an 18-man squad for the opening World Cup qualifier against <LOCATION>Armenia</LOCATION> on August 31 .</S>
<S>Midfielder <PERSON>Paulo Sousa</PERSON> , recently transferred to <ORGANIZATION>Borussia Dortmund</ORGANIZATION> from <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>Juventus</ORGANIZATION> , is the only leading member of the Portuguese side from this year's European championships who will not make the trip .</S>
<S>It will be <PERSON>Jorge</PERSON>'s first game in charge of the national squad since taking over from <PERSON>Antonio Oliveira</PERSON> , who now coaches <ORGANIZATION>Porto</ORGANIZATION> , at the end of Euro 96 .</S>

<S><LOCATION>BONN</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Trainer <PERSON>Berti Vogts</PERSON> kept faith with his entire European championship winning squad for <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION>'s first match since their title victory , a friendly in <LOCATION>Poland</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Vogts</PERSON> picked no new players for the squad for the September 4 game in <LOCATION>Zabrze</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Instead on Friday he nominated all 23 Euro ' 96 veterans including <ORGANIZATION>Bremen</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Jens Todt</PERSON> , called up before the final by special <ORGANIZATION>UEFA</ORGANIZATION> dispensation .</S>
<S>He will , however , have to do without the <ORGANIZATION>Dortmund</ORGANIZATION> trio of libero <PERSON>Matthias Sammer</PERSON> , midfielder <PERSON>Steffen Freund</PERSON> and defender <PERSON>Rene Schneider</PERSON> , who were all formally nominated despite being injured .</S>
<S>" This squad is currently the basis of my planning for the 1998 World Cup , " <PERSON>Vogts</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>We'll have to see which other players produce good league performances to play themselves into the squad . "</S>

<S>CRICKET - <LOCATION>SRI LANKA</LOCATION> AND <LOCATION>AUSTRALIA</LOCATION> SAY RELATIONS HAVE HEALED .</S>
<S><LOCATION>COLOMBO</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> agreed on Friday that relations between the two teams had healed since the Sri Lankans ' acrimonious tour last year .</S>
<S>The Sri Lankans were first found guilty then cleared of ball tampering and off-spinner <PERSON>Muttiah Muralitharan</PERSON> was called for throwing during a controversial three-test series in <LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" Our concern is to get out there and play proper cricket , " <LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> captain <PERSON>Arjuna Ranatunga</PERSON> told a news conference on the eve of a warmup match between the World Cup champions and a <ORGANIZATION>World XI</ORGANIZATION> team scheduled for Saturday .</S>
<S>" What happened is history . "</S>
<S>Australian team manager <PERSON>Cam Battersby</PERSON> said he agreed with <PERSON>Ranatunga</PERSON> .</S>
<S>" I believe relations between the two teams will be excellent , " <PERSON>Batterby</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>The Australians are making their first visit to the <LOCATION>Indian Ocean</LOCATION> island since boycotting a World Cup fixture in February after a terrorist bomb in <LOCATION>Colombo</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> have been promised the presence of commandos , sniffer dogs and plainclothes policemen to ensure a limited overs tournament is trouble-free .</S>
<S>The tournament , starting on August 26 , also includes <LOCATION>India</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Zimbabwe</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Battersby</PERSON> said he was satisfied with the security arrangements .</S>
<S>Sri Lankan officials said they expected heavy rain which washed out a warmup match on Friday should cease by Saturday .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> , led by wicketkeeper <PERSON>Ian Healy</PERSON> , opened their short tour of <LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> with a five-run win over the country's youth team on Thursday .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>PRESS DIGEST - <LOCATION>ANGOLA</LOCATION> - AUG 23 .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LUANDA</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Friday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>JORNAL DE ANGOLA</ORGANIZATION></S>
<S>- The Angolan Chief of State addressed a letter to <ORGANIZATION>UN Security Council</ORGANIZATION> proposing dates for the conclusion of the peace process in <LOCATION>Angola</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>He proposed definite dates , August 25 for return of <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> generals to the joint army , September 5 for the beginning of the formation of the <ORGANIZATION>Government of National Unity and Reconciliation</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Until this date the free circulation of peoples and goods should be guaranteed , the government administration installed in all areas and the <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> deputies should occupy their places in the <ORGANIZATION>National Assembly</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The president justified his proposal by the delays verified in the peace process , including the fact that areas under <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> control or occupation have not been effectively demilitarised , where the <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> military forces have been substituted by their so-called police .</S>
<S>- President <PERSON>Dos Santos</PERSON> proposes the establishment by <ORGANIZATION>UN Security Council</ORGANIZATION> of definitive and final timetable for the tasks and obligations under the Lusaka Agreement and the sending of a mission of <ORGANIZATION>SC</ORGANIZATION> , as soon as possible , to supervise the execution of the agreement .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S><ORGANIZATION>TVX Gold Inc</ORGANIZATION> was up C$ 0.30 to C$ 11.55 in trading of 780,000 shares , while <ORGANIZATION>Kinross Gold Corp</ORGANIZATION> gained C$ 0.25 to C$ 11 in volume of 720,000 shares .</S>
<S>And <ORGANIZATION>Scorpion Minerals Inc</ORGANIZATION> , a junior gold exploration company with five Indonesian mining properties , was up C$ 0.50 to C$ 6 , with about 120,000 shares changing hands .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>TVX</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Kinross</ORGANIZATION> rose after recent buy recommendations from <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> brokers , analysts said .</S>
<S>But <ORGANIZATION>Scorpion</ORGANIZATION> was raising a lot of eyebrows after it issued a release Friday morning saying it was not aware of any developments that could have affected the stock .</S>
<S>The company was formed this year and a couple of analysts have been on their properties , said one analyst .</S>
<S>Exploration results are expected soon .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Colombia</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> reach aviation agreement .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MIAMI</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> and Colombian governments reached an agreement that will allow <ORGANIZATION>AMR Corp</ORGANIZATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>American Airlines</ORGANIZATION> to operate three round-trip flights between <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Bogota</LOCATION> , the <ORGANIZATION>Department of Transportation</ORGANIZATION> said Friday .</S>
<S>Under the agreement , which followed talks in <LOCATION>Miami</LOCATION> this week , <ORGANIZATION>AMR</ORGANIZATION> also will be allowed to shift up to four of the weekly flights it now operates between <LOCATION>Miami</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Colombia</LOCATION> to its <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> gateway .</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> also will be able to designate one new all-cargo carrier for service between the two nations after two years .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Colombia</LOCATION> was permitted to add a single additional round-trip flight to its current <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> service , although it will not be able to do so while under Category Two ( Conditional ) status under the <ORGANIZATION>Federal Aviation Administration</ORGANIZATION>'s International Aviation Safety program .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Colombia</LOCATION> would be allowed to add new service when its safety assessment has been improved , the department said .</S>
<S>With the exception of the new services just agreed to , the governments of the two nations have agreed to maintain their current level of routes and airlines for the next 2-1/2 years , the agreement said .</S>
<S>The agreement resolved a dispute that arose in June when <LOCATION>Colombia</LOCATION> turned down <ORGANIZATION>American</ORGANIZATION>'s request to operate flights between <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Bogota</LOCATION> , a denial that prompted the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> to charge that the Colombians were breaking a bilateral aviation agreement and to propose sanctions against one of two Colombian airlines , <ORGANIZATION>Avianca</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>ACES</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>RTRS</ORGANIZATION> - Golf : <PERSON>Norman</PERSON> sacks his coach after disappointing season .</S>
<S><LOCATION>SYDNEY</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>World number one golfer <PERSON>Greg Norman</PERSON> has sacked his coach <PERSON>Butch Harmon</PERSON> after a disappointing season .</S>
<S>" <PERSON>Butch</PERSON> and I are finished , " <PERSON>Norman</PERSON> told reporters on Thursday before the start of the World Series of Golf in <LOCATION>Akron</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Ohio</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Norman</PERSON> , a two-time British Open champion , parted ways with his long-time mentor after drawing a blank in this year's four majors , winning two tournaments worldwide .</S>
<S>The blonde Australian opened with a level par round of 70 in <LOCATION>Akron</LOCATION> , leaving him four shots adrift of the leaders , Americans <PERSON>Billy Mayfair</PERSON> and <PERSON>Paul Goydos</PERSON> and <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Hidemichi Tanaki</PERSON> .</S>
<S>On Wednesday <PERSON>Norman</PERSON> described this year as his worst on the professional circuit since 1991 , when he failed to win a tournament .</S>
<S>" My application this year has been strange , " <PERSON>Norman</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Maybe I haven't been as keyed up as I should have been . "</S>
<S>" Sometimes you don't have it in your head to play .</S>
<S>Maybe this was one of those years where I was there , but I wasn't 100 percent there , and you have to be 100 percent to perform , " he said .</S>
<S>-- <ORGANIZATION>Sydney Newsroom</ORGANIZATION> 61-2 9373-1800</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>Soccer - Arab team breaks new ground in <LOCATION>Israel</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ori Lewis</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>TAIBE</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Israel</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>For the first time in Israeli history , an Arab team will take the field when the National League soccer season starts on Saturday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Hapoel Taibe</ORGANIZATION> fields four Jewish players and two foreign imports -- a Pole and a Romanian .</S>
<S>The rest of the side is made up mainly of Moslem Arabs .</S>
<S>The club , founded in 1961 , has a loyal following in <LOCATION>Taibe</LOCATION> , an Arab town of 28,000 in the heart of <LOCATION>Israel</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>But away from their home ground , they face unfriendly crowds who taunt the players with racist abuse .</S>
<S>" The very first thing we thought about after we knew we would be promoted was the game against <ORGANIZATION>Betar Jerusalem</ORGANIZATION> , " said <ORGANIZATION>Taibe</ORGANIZATION> supporter <PERSON>Karem Haj Yihye</PERSON> .</S>
<S>Two weeks ago <ORGANIZATION>Taibe</ORGANIZATION> , coached by Pole <PERSON>Wojtek Lazarek</PERSON> , met <ORGANIZATION>Betar</ORGANIZATION> , a club closely associated with the right-wing <ORGANIZATION>Likud</ORGANIZATION> party , for the first time in a Cup match in <LOCATION>Jerusalem</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Chants from the crowd of " Death to the Arabs " , and bottle-throwing during the game marred the match which ended in a goalless draw .</S>
<S>One <ORGANIZATION>Taibe</ORGANIZATION> supporter required hospital treatment for cuts and bruises after a stone struck his head as he was driving from the stadium .</S>
<S>" We're used to hearing the taunts of " Death to the Arabs ' , " said <PERSON>Sameh Haj Yihye</PERSON> , a <LOCATION>Taibe</LOCATION> resident who studies at <LOCATION>Jerusalem</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>Hebrew University</ORGANIZATION> . "</S>
<S>But we know that these are only words , nobody has died from hearing them and it only makes us support our team more vehemently . "</S>
<S>The dusty town of <LOCATION>Taibe</LOCATION> lacks the amenities of Jewish communities and many Israeli Arabs have long complained of state discrimination .</S>
<S>" There are no parks or empty areas of land around here , so when we want to play a friendly game of soccer we all load up in the car and travel to <LOCATION>Tel Aviv</LOCATION> , " 60 km ( 36 miles ) away , <PERSON>Sameh Haj Yihye</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>The town's ramshackle 2,500-seat ground is accessible only by two dirt tracks .</S>
<S>" We plan to build a 10,000-seat stadium , but it may well be situated elsewhere , " said club chairman <PERSON>Abdul Rahman Haj Yihye</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>We will discuss this with the mayor and hopefully a new or refurbished ground will be completed by the start of the new year . "</S>
<S>In the meantime , <ORGANIZATION>Taibe</ORGANIZATION> will play all their heavily policed home matches at the Jewish coastal town of <LOCATION>Netanya</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" We are Israelis , there is no question about that , " said <PERSON>Karem Haj Yihye</PERSON> , a hotel waiter .</S>
<S>" We don't have any connection with the Palestinians , they live over there , " he said , pointing to the <LOCATION>West Bank</LOCATION> seven km ( four miles ) to the east .</S>
<S>" We don't feel our club represents Palestinian Arabs , " said club chairman <PERSON>Abdul Rahman</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>We are trying to do all we can to run a professional outfit , we are pleased at any support we get , but do not go out looking to represent the whole Arab world . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>The draw made on Friday pitted <ORGANIZATION>Juventus</ORGANIZATION> , who beat Dutch champions <ORGANIZATION>Ajax Amsterdam</ORGANIZATION> 4-2 on penalties in last year's final , against <PERSON>Alex Ferguson</PERSON>'s European hopefuls in group C .</S>
<S>The other two teams in the group are last season's Cup Winners ' Cup runners-up <ORGANIZATION>Rapid Vienna</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Fenerbahce</ORGANIZATION> of <LOCATION>Turkey</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Juventus</ORGANIZATION> meet <ORGANIZATION>United</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Turin</LOCATION> on September 11 , with the return match at <LOCATION>Old Trafford</LOCATION> on November 20 .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>United</ORGANIZATION> have dominated the premier league in the 1990s , winning three English championships in four years , but have consistently failed in <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> , crashing out of the European Cup to <ORGANIZATION>Galatasaray</ORGANIZATION> of <LOCATION>Turkey</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Spain</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> at their last two attempts .</S>
<S>They have not lifted a European Trophy since 1991 when they beat <ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> in the Cup Winners ' Cup final , and their one and only European Cup triumph was way back in 1968 , when they beat <ORGANIZATION>Benfica</ORGANIZATION> of <LOCATION>Portugal</LOCATION> 4-1 at <LOCATION>Wembley</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Juventus</ORGANIZATION> have won the European Cup twice .</S>
<S>Before conquering <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> last year they beat <ORGANIZATION>United</ORGANIZATION>'s big English rivals <ORGANIZATION>Liverpool</ORGANIZATION> in the ill-fated 1985 final in the <LOCATION>Heysel</LOCATION> stadium in <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> .</S>

<S>Orthodox church blown up in southern <LOCATION>Croatia</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ZAGREB</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Saboteurs blew up a Serb orthodox church in southern <LOCATION>Croatia</LOCATION> on Friday with a blast which also damaged four nearby homes , the state news agency <ORGANIZATION>Hina</ORGANIZATION> reported .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>HINA</ORGANIZATION> said the church in the small village of <LOCATION>Karin Gornji</LOCATION> , 30 km ( 19 miles ) north of <LOCATION>Zadar</LOCATION> , was destroyed by the morning attack .</S>
<S>It did not report any casualties .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Zadar</LOCATION> police said in a statement they had launched an investigation and were doing their best to find the perpetrators .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>HINA</ORGANIZATION> said it was the first time an orthodox church had been blown up in the <LOCATION>Zadar</LOCATION> hinterland , where a large number of Serbs lived before the 1991 war over <LOCATION>Croatia</LOCATION>'s independence from the Yugoslav federation .</S>
<S>The area was part of the self-styled state of <LOCATION>Krajina</LOCATION> proclaimed by minority Serbs in 1991 and recaptured by the Croatian army last year .</S>
<S>Up to 200,000 Serbs fled to <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Yugoslavia</LOCATION> , leaving <LOCATION>Krajina</LOCATION> vacant and depopulated .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION>'s gross foreign debt rises in June .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BUDAPEST</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION>'s gross foreign debt rose to $ 27.53 billion in June from $ 27.25 billion in May , the</S>

<S><LOCATION>GROZNY</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Rebel fighters and Russian soldiers said a ceasefire effective at noon ( 0800 GMT ) on Friday was being generally observed , although scattered gunfire echoed through the Chechen capital <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The Russian army said earlier it was preparing to withdraw from the rebel-dominated southern mountains of the region as part of the peace deal reached with separatists on Thursday .</S>
<S>" There has been some shooting from their side but it has been relatively quiet , " said fighter <PERSON>Aslan Shabazov</PERSON> , a bearded man wearing a white t-shirt and camoflage trousers .</S>
<S>Soon after he spoke another burst of gunfire rocked the courtyard where the rebels had set up their base and a captured Russian T-72 tank roared out to investigate .</S>
<S>The separatists , who swept into <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> on August 6 , still control large areas of the centre of town , and Russian soldiers are based at checkpoints on the approach roads .</S>
<S>" The ceasefire is being observed , " said woman soldier <PERSON>Svetlana Goncharova</PERSON> , 35 , short dark hair poking out from under a peaked camouflage cap .</S>
<S>A few helicopters flew overhead , firing off flares , but there was no shooting from the air .</S>
<S>The truce , the latest of several , was agreed in talks on Thursday between Russian peacemaker <PERSON>Alexander Lebed</PERSON> and rebel chief-of-staff <PERSON>Aslan Maskhadov</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The two also agreed to set up joint patrols in <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> , but <PERSON>Goncharova</PERSON> said she was sceptical about whether this could work .</S>
<S>" We have to try it , but I doubt if this is possible with the separatists , " she said .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Jordan</LOCATION> expels Iraqi diplomat after bread riots .</S>

<S><LOCATION>AMMAN</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S><LOCATION>Jordan</LOCATION> , which has blamed <LOCATION>Iraq</LOCATION> for bread riots last week , has asked an Iraqi diplomat to leave , official and diplomatic sources said on Friday .</S>
<S>The main Friday prayers in southern <LOCATION>Jordan</LOCATION> that were the starting point for the riots a week ago passed peacefully under tight security imposed by the army with only brief demonstrations reported .</S>
<S><PERSON>Adel Ibrahim</PERSON> , the Iraqi embassy's press attache , was asked to leave " because he was carrying out duties incompatible with diplomatic norms " , one source told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> , implying he was accused of spying .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ibrahim</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> by telephone from his embassy office in <LOCATION>Amman</LOCATION> that he " had not been notified " of any explusion order .</S>
<S>The government declined official comment .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ibrahim</PERSON>'s assistant , <PERSON>Hussein Khalaf</PERSON> , was expelled earlier this year for similar reasons amid rising tension in bilateral ties after King <PERSON>Hussein</PERSON> began calling for change in <LOCATION>Baghdad</LOCATION> following top Iraqi defections in August 1995 .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Iraq</LOCATION> retaliated then by expelling a junior administrator working in the Jordanian embassy in <LOCATION>Baghdad</LOCATION> but has continued its policy of trying to avoid public conflicts with <LOCATION>Jordan</LOCATION> -- its only secure route to the rest of the world .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Jordan</LOCATION> has accused <LOCATION>Iraq</LOCATION> and a local pro-Baghdad party for the country's worst unrest in seven years which erupted after it almost doubled the prices of bread last week under radical economic reforms agreed with the <ORGANIZATION>International Monetary Fund</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Karak</LOCATION> , where two days of riots flared last Friday , a few hundred young men lingered outside <LOCATION>Omari</LOCATION> mosque on leaving , shouting slogans for about 15 minutes .</S>
<S>" Disperse , abstain from forming groups and help maintain order , " army officers , who has enforced a loose curfew since the riots , told the crowd through loudspeakers .</S>
<S>The men shouted " <PERSON>Allahu</PERSON> Akbar " ( <PERSON>God</PERSON> is Greatest ) as a former Islamist deputy , <PERSON>Ahmed Kafawin</PERSON> , told soldiers the crowd would not cause trouble .</S>
<S>He had earlier mounted the mosque's pulpit to demand release of detainees , an end to raids on houses and the cancelling of the bread price rises .</S>
<S>Armoured cars had patrolled streets in <LOCATION>Karak</LOCATION> , traditional bastion of communist ideology and Baath socialism that swept the region in the 1950s , and guarded entrances to the hill-top city famed for its Crusader castle before the prayers .</S>
<S>There was also heavy security in the crowded centre of <LOCATION>Amman</LOCATION> , where smaller clashes had erupted last Saturday , but Friday prayers at the main mosque ended quietly as police in full riot gear looked on .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Jordanian Arab Socialist Baath Party</ORGANIZATION> , which has one deputy in the 80-seat lower house of parliament , has denied involvement in unrest which it blamed on government policies and rising economic hardship .</S>
<S>Government attempts to link the rioting to foreign influence has been treated with derision by those in the streets who blame the protests on severe economic hardships .</S>

<S><PERSON>Madhusudan Munakarmi</PERSON> was arrested on Thursday after his neighbours informed police about the plight of 12-year old <PERSON>Dhiraj K.C.</PERSON> , who told police his employer used to tie him up with iron chains and locks concealed under his clothes .</S>
<S>The neighbours in <LOCATION>Kathmandu</LOCATION> called the police when they saw <PERSON>Dheeraj</PERSON> , employed by the man for the past nine months , limping because of the chains .</S>

<S>If convicted , he faces a maximum of three years in jail under <LOCATION>Nepal</LOCATION>'s child protection laws .</S>

<S>OPTIONS - Euro debt vols seen regrouping after fall .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Implied volatility of European bond and interest rate options should stabilise around current levels until early next week after falling before and after this week's German-led cut in interest rates , traders said .</S>
<S>" Volatility has come off a lot .</S>
<S>We're looking for it to stabilise now , " said one Euromark options trader at a <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> bank .</S>
<S>A trader at a Japanese bank said Euromark volatility now stood at 14.00 for September contract , 16.75 for December , 19.50 for March and 21.25 for June .</S>
<S>This compared with midweek levels , before the welter of interest rate cuts , of 18.50 for September , 20.00 for December , 22.00 for March and 23.5 for June , he said .</S>
<S>At 1347 GMT , December Euromark futures were trading at 96.78 , two basis points down on the day .</S>
<S>He said the sell-off in June vols might have been overdone , which could offer value at current levels .</S>
<S>He said caps and floors would be well bid after the round of interest rate cuts due to the fact these rates should stay low at the short end .</S>
<S>The size of the <ORGANIZATION>Bundesbank</ORGANIZATION>'s repo rate cut , to 3.00 percent from 3.30 percent , took markets by surprise .</S>
<S>" Volatility has a bid to it -- longer-dated volatility more than short-dated because the event people were buying for has passed and now perhaps people will sell some short dated vol and buy some long dated vol , " he said .</S>
<S>" Long dated volatility has been low this year , so it is still at levels which are not historically high .</S>
<S>" It is not a dangerous level to own vol. You are not going to lose a lot and you could make quite a bit . "</S>
<S>He said volatility levels should be stable until markets reassess the situation after a long weekend in <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Paribas Capital Markets OTC</ORGANIZATION> options specialist <PERSON>Robert Coughlan</PERSON> said that if volatility continued lower for the rest of Friday in over-the-counter 10-year Bunds , it should be higher next Tuesday .</S>
<S>He said the absence on holiday of many market makers was a main factor behind falls this week in volatility in high-yielding markets such as <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Spain</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Coughlan</PERSON> said the market had more downside than upside potential , but a fall was not likely to be of significant size .</S>
<S>" I recommend people sell strangles in a number of markets -- in <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> in particular .</S>
<S>" With high-yielding markets <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> will be a lot more vulnerable in September on economic and political fronts , so I would use current the low level of vol to buy options .</S>
<S>" So sell options on Bunds and <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> to enhance yield and buy options on <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> , " <PERSON>Coughlan</PERSON> said ..</S>
<S>-- <PERSON>Stephen Nisbet</PERSON> , <ORGANIZATION>International Bonds</ORGANIZATION> +44 171 542 6320</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>Americast</ORGANIZATION> said <ORGANIZATION>Southern New England Telecommunications Corp.</ORGANIZATION> has signed a letter of intent to join the group , which plans to provide a home entertainment service similar to cable television .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Zenith</ORGANIZATION> also said it planned to build a new $ 100 million plant in <LOCATION>Woodridge</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Ill</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>, to make picture tubes for 32- and 35-inch screen TV sets .</S>
<S>The company currently buys the tubes from competitors .</S>

<S>The contract calls for production of the set-top boxes over five years .</S>
<S><PERSON>Luehrs</PERSON> said manufacturing will begin and revenue will start to roll in during the first half of next year .</S>
<S>The boxes will be made on a build-to-order basis .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Zenith</ORGANIZATION> will convert its <LOCATION>Chihuahua</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Mexico</LOCATION> , analogue set-top box plant to manufacture the digital boxes .</S>
<S><PERSON>Luehrs</PERSON> declined to say when the operation was expected to be profitable .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Americast</ORGANIZATION> will provide the boxes to subscribers as part of the service .</S>
<S>Its service is being introduced in selected markets across the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Luehrs</PERSON> said digital technology in set-top boxes is only the beginning and said the technology will eventually show up in retail consumer electronics .</S>
<S>" We'll build a lot of these devices into television sets , for digital television , " he said . "</S>
<S>Although that is not where this particular contract is headed , the fact that there is a strong <ORGANIZATION>Zenith</ORGANIZATION> presence will pay us dividends in the future . "</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Zenith</ORGANIZATION> has been plagued by generally soft conditions in the colour television industry , reporting full-year losses since 1989 .</S>
<S>Last month , it reported a second-quarter loss of $ 33.2 million , or 51 cents a share , vs. a loss of $ 45.3 million , or 97 cents a share , a year earlier .</S>

<S><PERSON>Robert Gutenstein</PERSON> , an analyst for <ORGANIZATION>Kalf , Voorhis & Co</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S>Huge Windows 95 sales fail to meet expectations .</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin Wolk</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>SEATTLE</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S>A year after its massively publicized introduction , <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft Corp.</ORGANIZATION>'s Windows 95 computer operating system has fallen short of the most optimistic expectations for the software giant and the industry .</S>
<S>Even though more than 40 million copies of Windows 95 have been sold , making it the fastest-selling new software ever , it would have been impossible for any product to live up to the unprecedented hype of the Aug. 24 , 1995 launch , when stores around the world opened at midnight to greet long lines of customers .</S>
<S>The <PERSON>Redmond</PERSON> , Wash.-based company spent tens of millions of dollars promoting the product with stunts that included buying the entire print run of the <ORGANIZATION>Times of London</ORGANIZATION> and lighting <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Empire State</LOCATION> building in a Windows color scheme .</S>
<S>But the product , delivered eight months late , has fallen short of its sales potential in part because <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> delivered a mixed message to business customers , analysts said .</S>
<S>" It didn't do as well as it could have , " said <PERSON>Rob Enderle</PERSON> , an analyst with <ORGANIZATION>Giga Information Group</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Scores of software and hardware companies that had hoped for a big boost in sales were disappointed when only a brief spike materialized .</S>
<S>" People who were expecting major coat-tails were somewhat disappointed , " said <PERSON>Scott Winkler</PERSON> , an analyst with <ORGANIZATION>Gartner Group</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" It's not as though it hasn't had an impact , " he said . "</S>
<S>It just hasn't had the huge earth-shattering impact some people were looking for . "</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Symantec Corp.</ORGANIZATION> , which had been among the most bullish of software companies at the time of the Windows 95 launch , ended up posting disappointing financial results when retail sales of the operating system fell short of its projections .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Touchstone Software Corp.</ORGANIZATION> had to pay $ 1.3 million in cash and stock to settle a shareholders lawsuit brought after the company's sales failed to meet expectations tied to the Windows 95 launch .</S>
<S>Many software developers apparently saw their crucial holiday season sales suffer last year because store shelves were jammed with blue-and-white boxes of Windows 95 , resulting in a shortage of space for seasonal products , said <PERSON>Ann Stephens</PERSON> , president of <ORGANIZATION>PC Data Inc</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>To be sure , sales of Windows 95 and the accompanying Office 95 upgrade drove <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> sales up 46 percent last year to a record $ 8.67 billion and cemented the company's status as the industry's dominant company .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> executives say they are thrilled with the sales figures , and industry analysts estimate that by sometime next year , the installed base of Windows 95 will surpass that of the older version of Windows , now used on about 100 million computers worldwide .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Enderle</PERSON> said the figure could have been even higher if <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> had done a better job of handling the huge demand for technical support from customers who were frustrated trying to install the system .</S>
<S>He and other analysts said corporate <LOCATION>America</LOCATION> adopted a go-slow approach because <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> already was promoting the new version of its high-end Windows NT operating system , expected to be available in stores in the next several weeks .</S>
<S>" <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft</ORGANIZATION> sent a lot of signals that NT was going to be the answer , " <PERSON>Winkler</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Many people began to believe that Windows 95 was being downplayed . "</S>
<S>But now that Windows NT 4.0 has been launched , <PERSON>Winkler</PERSON> and others believe only a relatively small proportion of corporate users will elect to pay the added software and hardware costs needed to use it instead of Windows 95 .</S>
<S>" Windows 95 is going to do great , " he said . "</S>
<S>The mistake people made was in thinking it was going to be a fast , sweeping change rather than a slow , building change . "</S>

<S><PERSON>Tommy Thompson</PERSON> said Thursday .</S>
<S>According to a new release from the governor , <LOCATION>Wisconsin</LOCATION> submitted a plan to the <ORGANIZATION>U.S. Department of Health and Human Services</ORGANIZATION> for administration of the new block grant system for welfare just minutes after President <PERSON>Bill Clinton</PERSON> signed the measure into law Thursday .</S>
<S>" As the nation's leader in welfare reform , <LOCATION>Wisconsin</LOCATION> is far ahead of the curve and ready to go under this new system , " <PERSON>Thompson</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>Still , the governor said the new law does not go as far as the state's own welfare reform program , dubbed W-2 .</S>
<S>He said that despite the new law , <LOCATION>Wisconsin</LOCATION> will still require federal waivers allowing the working poor to acquire health care coverage from the state , a 60-day residency requirement for participation in the welfare program , and child support collections to go directly to custodial parents .</S>
<S>The nation's new welfare reform law limits eligibility , gives states more power and ends direct federal aid for poor children .</S>

<S><PERSON>Steve Barnes</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>LITTLE ROCK</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Ark</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>State and federal agents on Thursday sifted through the rubble of two predominantly black <LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> churches that burned within minutes of one another late Tuesday and early Wednesday .</S>
<S>Both churches were in the <LOCATION>Mississippi</LOCATION> delta region of <LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> , about 90 miles ( 145 kms ) southeast of <LOCATION>Little Rock</LOCATION> , and were located within three miles of one another .</S>
<S>" We're investigating with the idea that both fires may be arson , but that hasn't been conclusively established , " said <PERSON>Wayne Jordan</PERSON> , a spokesman for the <ORGANIZATION>Arkansas State Police</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Agents of the <ORGANIZATION>F.B.I.</ORGANIZATION> and the <ORGANIZATION>Bureau of Alcohol , Tobacco and Firearms</ORGANIZATION> were also at the scene , <PERSON>Jordan</PERSON> said .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Mount Zion Missionary Baptist Church</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>St. Matthews Missionary Baptist Church</LOCATION> were both frame structures , each near <LOCATION>Turner</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> , a small community surrounded by cotton and soybean fields .</S>
<S>" This is rural <LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>I'm surprised anyone could even find us out here , " said <PERSON>Fannie Johnson</PERSON> , a member of <LOCATION>St. Matthew's</LOCATION> , who said she believed arson was to blame .</S>
<S>Others connected with the two churches said they shared that suspicion , although all said they knew of no motive and no racial tension in the area .</S>
<S>" It's sad someone would have that kind of spite in their heart , " said Rev. <PERSON>Jerome Turner</PERSON> , pastor of <LOCATION>Mount Zion Missionary Baptist Church</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> has been spared the loss of predominantly black churches to arson , a wave that has claimed an estimated 30 houses of worship across the south in the past several months .</S>
<S>A black church near <LOCATION>Camden</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Arkansas</LOCATION> , about 100 miles ( 161 kms ) south of <LOCATION>Little Rock</LOCATION> , burned in July , but federal agents have not determined the cause .</S>

<S>Sea lion paparazzi to keep tabs on whales .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-22</S>
<S><LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> marine biologists have trained a pair of sea lions to tag and photograph elusive whales as they cruise through the <LOCATION>Pacific</LOCATION> depths , <ORGANIZATION>New Scientist</ORGANIZATION> magazine reported on Thursday .</S>
<S><PERSON>James Harvey</PERSON> and <PERSON>Jennifer Hurley</PERSON> of the <ORGANIZATION>Moss Landing Marine Laboratories</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>California</LOCATION> say their sea lions , natural companions of many species of whale , can go where no man or woman has ever gone before .</S>
<S>" Any diver knows that when a whale gets going you can't keep up , " <PERSON>Harvey</PERSON> told the magazine . "</S>
<S>That is why we know only about five percent of what whales do . "</S>
<S>The sea lions -- 17-year-old <PERSON>Beaver</PERSON> and nine-year-old <PERSON>Sake</PERSON> -- have undergone six years of training for their mission .</S>
<S><PERSON>Beaver</PERSON> once worked for the <ORGANIZATION>U.S. Navy</ORGANIZATION> and <PERSON>Sake</PERSON> is an amusement park veteran .</S>
<S><PERSON>Harvey</PERSON> said they could accurately tag whales with a radio transmitter , and could also swim all the way around one of the giant mammals , filming it with a video camera .</S>
<S>Their first assignment , later this year , will be documenting humpback whale migration off <LOCATION>Monterey</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>California</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The article did not spell out exactly how the sea lions manage to tag the whales but said in training they were taught to stick a radio transmitter on to a plastic model of a whale using suction cups .</S>

<S>It ranged from 817.60 to 819.30 .</S>
<S>" The dollar is overbought at the moment , " said a western bank dealer . "</S>
