<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>China</LOCATION> copper stocks owned by state reserve - trade .</S>
<S><PERSON>Lynne O'Donnell</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>HONG KONG</LOCATION> 1996-08-23</S>
<S>Up to 100,000 tonnes of copper held in <LOCATION>Shanghai</LOCATION> bonded warehouses , confounding the world market as to its source and ultimate fate , probably belongs to <LOCATION>China</LOCATION>'s strategic state reserve , industry sources said on Friday .</S>
<S>Around 40,000 tonnes of the copper have already been moved to warehouses near the northern port of <LOCATION>Yingkou</LOCATION> , where some of the strategic stockpile was stored , they said .</S>
<S>Just who owns the copper is a question that has kept traders and industry analysts guessing since the metal was channelled into <LOCATION>Shanghai</LOCATION> by the <ORGANIZATION>China National Nonferrous Metals Import and Export Corp</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> ) in June and July .</S>
<S>It was unclear whether or not the 40,000 tonnes had cleared customs -- which would provide some concrete indication that the strategic reserve , administered directly by the central government's <ORGANIZATION>State Planning Commission</ORGANIZATION> , owned the copper .</S>
<S>Traders have said the reserve could negotiate concessions on duties -- three percent import tax and 17 percent value-added tax -- that made the copper prohibitively expensive otherwise .</S>
<S>But one source , the head of a <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> trading house , said it made no difference if the copper was customs cleared or not .</S>
<S>" If they spend all this money moving the copper to <LOCATION>Yingkou</LOCATION> , it will be sitting there for years , " he said .</S>
<S>" Once it arrives in <LOCATION>Yingkou</LOCATION> , it is subject to monitoring by the <ORGANIZATION>State Planning Commission</ORGANIZATION> , which has to give permission for any more movement ; it is out of the hands of traders , " he said .</S>
<S>Mystery has surrounded the <LOCATION>Shanghai</LOCATION> stockpile in recent months , with traders unsure not only of who owns it , but of its exact size and what its owner planned to do with it .</S>
<S>Trading sources generally agreed it would be cost-effective to take the copper back into a depleted central reserve as it had already served its purpose in taking advantage of long-term backwardation on the <ORGANIZATION>London Metal Exchange</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>LME</ORGANIZATION> ) .</S>
<S>A backwardation occurs when the spot price of a metal is higher than the forward price .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> lent around 85,000 tonnes of copper onto the <ORGANIZATION>LME</ORGANIZATION> between April and June 1995 on behalf of the state reserve , running the state stockpile down to 115,000 tonnes from 200,000 tonnes previously .</S>
<S>Traders in <LOCATION>Asia</LOCATION> said <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> could well have lent it to the market at around US$ 2,700 a tonne , and then paid somewhere between $ 2,200 and $ 2,400 a tonne when it started taking the metal back earlier this year .</S>
<S>This would have cleared <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> a healthy profit , which could then have been used to finance storage and other costs .</S>
<S>Word that <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> had offered the copper to European trading houses in a series of secret meetings unnerved an already jittery market .</S>
<S>Industry analysts <ORGANIZATION>Bloomsbury Minerals Economics</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>BME</ORGANIZATION> ) said on Wednesday the motivation of the owners of the 85,000 tonnes , " whoever they are , is the most important short-term fundamental " in an already tight world market .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>BME</ORGANIZATION> repeated in its latest review rumours of involvement by <ORGANIZATION>Sumitomo Corp</ORGANIZATION> , with <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> said to be helping the Japanese trader unload its copper positions after it revealed in June losses of $ 1.8 billion in a decade of unauthorised deals .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Sumitomo</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>CNIEC</ORGANIZATION> have made no comments on the talk and Chinese traders said they know nothing of such an arrangement .</S>
<S>Traders in <LOCATION>Shanghai</LOCATION> said on Thursday they were unaware of movements out of the <LOCATION>Shanghai</LOCATION> bonded warehouses .</S>
<S>They reported more arrivals that were probably spot purchases .</S>
<S>They also expressed concern that the tonnage in bonded warehouses would move onto the domestic market .</S>
<S>But these concerns were irrelevant , a <LOCATION>Singapore</LOCATION> trader said , despite a forecast that domestic Chinese copper demand could hit one million tonnes this year .</S>
<S>As with many commodities , " there is a desire ( by the Chinese government ) to keep a stockpile of the metal , " he said . "</S>
<S>You don't keep it to help industry , you keep it in case of emergency . "</S>
<S>-- <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> newsroom ( 852 ) 2843-6470</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S>Earnings per share 0.14 yuan ( no comparative figure )</S>

<S>It said investment bank <ORGANIZATION>Rothschild & Cie</ORGANIZATION> was an intermediary in the talks and added that unlisted German retailers <ORGANIZATION>Metro</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>Rewe</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Lidl</ORGANIZATION> were also still in discussions .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Promodes</ORGANIZATION> has in <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> its Promo hypermarket unit with 36 Continent superstores , which is 1995 generated 4.7 percent of total <ORGANIZATION>Promodes</ORGANIZATION> sales .</S>
<S>The French group entered the German market in 1990 , buying</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ford China</ORGANIZATION> JV posts 77 percent net drop in H1 96 .</S>
<S><LOCATION>SHANGHAI</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>A Chinese truck maker in which <ORGANIZATION>Ford Motor Co</ORGANIZATION> has a 20 percent stake said it posted a 77 percent drop in post-tax profits in the first half of 1996 .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Jiangling Motors Corp</ORGANIZATION> , in a statement in Saturday's edition of the <ORGANIZATION>China Securities</ORGANIZATION> newspaper , said net profit in the period was 3.385 million yuan , down from 14.956 million in the same 1995 period .</S>
<S>Turnover fell to 937.891 million yuan from 1.215 billion , while net assets per share were 1.88 yuan , unchanged , and earnings per share fell to 0.005 yuan from 0.02 yuan , the statement said .</S>
<S>In the first half , the company said it produced 8,333 vehicles and sold 9,018 , but it did not explain the difference .</S>
<S>It blamed the drop in profits on a weak vehicle market and said as its engine plant had only just started trial production , the company's results would not improve in the short-term .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ford</ORGANIZATION> owns 138.643 million shares in the firm .</S>
<S>The majority shareholder , with 51 percent , or 353.24 million shares , is <ORGANIZATION>Jiangling Motors Group</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The company , in the southern province of <LOCATION>Jiangxi</LOCATION> , had about eight percent of <LOCATION>China</LOCATION>'s light truck market in 1994 .</S>
<S>( $ 1 = 8.3 yuan )</S>

<S>RALLYING - <PERSON>KANKKUNEN</PERSON> IN COMMAND AS <PERSON>MCRAE</PERSON> ROLLS OUT .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Finland</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Juha Kankkunen</PERSON> produced an impressive performance in his <ORGANIZATION>Toyota</ORGANIZATION> on Saturday to open up a 37 seconds lead after six stages of the 1,000 Lakes Rally , sixth round of the world championship .</S>
<S>On a weekend overshadowed by Friday's fatal accident , four times world champion <PERSON>Kankunnen</PERSON> emerged from the first five of Saturday's 10 stages with a commanding advantage over his country's latest prospect , <PERSON>Marcus Gronholm</PERSON> , also in a <ORGANIZATION>Toyota</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>World championship leader <PERSON>Tommi Makinen</PERSON> in his <ORGANIZATION>Mitsubishi</ORGANIZATION> was third but current world champion <PERSON>Colin McRae</PERSON> ended a bad week by crashing out .</S>
<S>After being fined $ 250,000 by the sports governing body on Tuesday , the British driver rolled his <ORGANIZATION>Subaru</ORGANIZATION> 6.5 km into stage six .</S>
<S>He and co-driver <PERSON>Derek Ringer</PERSON> were unhurt but team boss <PERSON>David Richards</PERSON> was furious with them .</S>
<S>" It's not unfortunate , it's incompetent , " he declared .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kankkunen</PERSON> has set an astonishing pace for a driver who has not rallied for three months .</S>
<S>" If you do a lot of something , sometimes it's good to have a break .</S>
<S>It's not bad for an old man ! "</S>
<S>said the 37-year-old veteran .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ford</ORGANIZATION> had a poor morning with Spaniard <PERSON>Carlos Sainz</PERSON> losing 90 seconds through turbo trouble while Belgian <PERSON>Bruno Thiry</PERSON> dropped four minutes when a transmission shaft snapped .</S>

<S>RALLYING - BELGIAN SPECTATOR DIES IN FINNISH RALLY .</S>
<S><LOCATION>JYVASKYLA</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Finland</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>A Belgian man died and 31 people were injured after an accident in Friday's opening phase of the world championship 1,000 Lakes Rally .</S>
<S>The unnamed victim died during the night , a hospital spokesman said on Saturday .</S>
<S>Danish driver <PERSON>Karsten Richardt</PERSON> had ploughed into the crowd during the two-kilometre first stage held in the host city of <LOCATION>Jyvaskyla</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Richardt</PERSON>'s <ORGANIZATION>Mitsubishi</ORGANIZATION> skidded down an escape road and ploughed into a cordoned-off area for spectators .</S>
<S>A second Belgian was also seriously injured but the hospital spokesman said his life was not in danger .</S>
<S>The stage was suspended but the four-day rally resumed on Saturday .</S>
<S>A woman was killed before last year's event when she walked in front of a car practising on the course .</S>

<S>CRICKET - <ORGANIZATION>ESSEX</ORGANIZATION> POISED TO STEP UP TITLE CHALLENGE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Essex</ORGANIZATION> are set to step up their English county championship challenge with a fifth consecutive victory after new-ball pair <PERSON>Neil Williams</PERSON> and <PERSON>Mark Ilott</PERSON> sent <ORGANIZATION>Gloucestershire</ORGANIZATION> reeling on Saturday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Williams</PERSON> seized two wickets in two deliveries and left-armer <PERSON>Ilott</PERSON> also captured two as <ORGANIZATION>Gloucestershire</ORGANIZATION> , 252 behind on first innings , slumped to 27 for four at the close on the third day of the four-day game at <LOCATION>Colchester</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Essex</ORGANIZATION> , who started the current round of matches in fifth place 20 points behind leaders <ORGANIZATION>Derbyshire</ORGANIZATION> with a game in hand , could go top if they complete victory on Monday's last day and other results favour them .</S>
<S><PERSON>Williams</PERSON> thrust <ORGANIZATION>Essex</ORGANIZATION> on course for success by dispatching <PERSON>Matt Windows</PERSON> and <PERSON>Andrew Symonds</PERSON> in his second over , before <PERSON>Ilott</PERSON> removed <PERSON>Dominic Hewson</PERSON> and <PERSON>Tim Hancock</PERSON> to reduce <ORGANIZATION>Gloucestershire</ORGANIZATION> to 17 for four at one stage .</S>
<S>The visitors had started the day optimistically by sending back former <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> captain <PERSON>Graham Gooch</PERSON> when he added just six to his overnight 105 , but <ORGANIZATION>Essex</ORGANIZATION> went on to make 532 for eight before declaring .</S>
<S>Captain <PERSON>Paul Prichard</PERSON> plundered 88 from 73 deliveries , hitting 15 fours and one six .</S>
<S>Second-placed <ORGANIZATION>Kent</ORGANIZATION> were frustrated by rain which prevented any play at <LOCATION>Cardiff</LOCATION> , where they have reached 255 for three in their first innings against <ORGANIZATION>Glamorgan</ORGANIZATION> , while third-placed <ORGANIZATION>Surrey</ORGANIZATION> are facing an uphill task against <ORGANIZATION>Nottinghamshire</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Surrey</ORGANIZATION> slipped to 88 for four in reply to <ORGANIZATION>Notts</ORGANIZATION> ' commanding first innings of 446 for nine declared at <LOCATION>Trent Bridge</LOCATION> , before <PERSON>Alistair Brown</PERSON> struck a 55-ball half-century .</S>
<S><PERSON>Brown</PERSON>'s 56 not out , containing eight fours and three sixes , lifted <ORGANIZATION>Surrey</ORGANIZATION> to 128 for four on a rain-curtailed day .</S>
<S>Fourth-placed <ORGANIZATION>Leicestershire</ORGANIZATION> had <ORGANIZATION>Hampshire</ORGANIZATION> on the ropes at <LOCATION>Leicester</LOCATION> before rain intervened .</S>
<S>Pace trio <PERSON>David Millns</PERSON> ( 2-24 ) , <PERSON>Gordon Parsons</PERSON> ( 3-20 ) and <PERSON>Vince Wells</PERSON> ( 2-19 ) had <ORGANIZATION>Hampshire</ORGANIZATION> reeling at 81 for seven in reply to the home county's first innings of 353 .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION> rekindled their title hopes after three successive defeats by taking the upper hand against arch-rivals <ORGANIZATION>Lancashire</ORGANIZATION> at <LOCATION>Old Trafford</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Facing <ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION>'s 529 for eight declared , <ORGANIZATION>Lancashire</ORGANIZATION> were forced to follow on 206 behind after being bowled out for 323 , paceman <PERSON>Darren Gough</PERSON> polishing off the innings with a burst of three wickets for one run in 17 deliveries .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Lancashire</ORGANIZATION> then reached 210 for five at the close -- just four ahead -- after <PERSON>Neil Fairbrother</PERSON> hit 55 in 60 balls to add to his first innings of 86 .</S>

<S>SOCCER - OUT-OF-SORTS <ORGANIZATION>NEWCASTLE</ORGANIZATION> CRASH 2-1 AT HOME .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Newcastle</ORGANIZATION>'s early season teething problems continued on Saturday when they lost 2-1 at home to premier league pacesetters <ORGANIZATION>Sheffield Wednesday</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>England</LOCATION> striker <PERSON>Alan Shearer</PERSON> gave <PERSON>Kevin Keegan</PERSON>'s talent-laden side the lead from the penalty spot after 13 minutes after Wednesday's Yugoslav <PERSON>Dejan Stefanovic</PERSON> pulled down Colombian forward <PERSON>Faustino Asprilla</PERSON> .</S>
<S>But two minutes later <ORGANIZATION>Wednesday</ORGANIZATION> equalised through <PERSON>Peter Atherton</PERSON> , who found space in the penalty area to meet <PERSON>Mark Pembridge</PERSON>'s free kick with a precise glancing header .</S>
<S><PERSON>Guy Whittingham</PERSON> stole three points for the <ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION> side with a goal 10 minutes from time .</S>
<S>To add to <ORGANIZATION>Newcastle</ORGANIZATION>'s misery , <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> striker <PERSON>Les Ferdinand</PERSON> was stretchered off in the second half .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Wednesday</ORGANIZATION> , who escaped relegation on the final day of last season , have now won their first three games of the season .</S>
<S>Elsewhere , title hopefuls <ORGANIZATION>Liverpool</ORGANIZATION> were held 0-0 at home by newly-promoted <ORGANIZATION>Sunderland</ORGANIZATION> , and in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> , the tie between <ORGANIZATION>Tottenham Hotspur</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Everton</ORGANIZATION> also ended goaless .</S>
<S>Frenchman <PERSON>Frank LeBoeuf</PERSON> and Italian <PERSON>Gianluca Vialli</PERSON> scored their first premier league goals as <ORGANIZATION>Chelsea</ORGANIZATION> beat <ORGANIZATION>Coventry</ORGANIZATION> 2-0 , and managerless <ORGANIZATION>Arsenal</ORGANIZATION> won by the same scoreline at <LOCATION>Leicester</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Last season's league and Cup winners <ORGANIZATION>Manchester United</ORGANIZATION> host 1995 champions <ORGANIZATION>Blackburn</ORGANIZATION> on Sunday .</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>RUGBY UNION</ORGANIZATION> - <LOCATION>NEW ZEALAND</LOCATION> WIN FIRST SERIES IN <LOCATION>SOUTH AFRICA</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PRETORIA</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S><LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> made history on Saturday when they completed their first series victory in <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> with a 33-26 victory in the second test .</S>
<S>The win gave the <ORGANIZATION>All Blacks</ORGANIZATION> an unbeatable 2-0 lead in the three-test series .</S>
<S>Each side scored three tries and the <ORGANIZATION>Springboks</ORGANIZATION> outscored the <ORGANIZATION>All Blacks</ORGANIZATION> 15-12 in the second half but still suffered a fourth successive defeat against their old enemies .</S>
<S>Two tries from wing <PERSON>Jeff Wilson</PERSON> in the first quarter gave <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> a 24-11 lead before tries from flanker <PERSON>Ruben Kruger</PERSON> and scrum-half <PERSON>Joost van der Westhuizen</PERSON> in the space of two minutes narrowed the gap to a single point at 23-24 .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Springboks</ORGANIZATION> would have gone ahead had not fly-half <PERSON>Joel Stransky</PERSON>'s conversion hit an upright and <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> only scrambled to safety through a fine penalty from replacement fly-half <PERSON>Jon Preston</PERSON> and a drop goal by number eight <PERSON>Zinzan Brooke</PERSON> .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S>SOCCER - DISAPPOINTING <ORGANIZATION>AJAX</ORGANIZATION> SLUMP 2-0 AT <LOCATION>HEERENVEEN</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>AMSTERDAM</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>Dutch champions <ORGANIZATION>Ajax Amsterdam</ORGANIZATION> faltered in their second league match of the season on Saturday losing 2-0 away at <ORGANIZATION>Heerenveen</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> , who had a dismal series of pre-season results before beating <ORGANIZATION>NAC</ORGANIZATION> of <LOCATION>Breda</LOCATION> in their opening game , had the best of an entertaining first half but failed to break the deadlock .</S>
<S>Eight minutes after the interval , <ORGANIZATION>Heerenveen</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Romeo Wouden</PERSON> broke through the <LOCATION>Amsterdam</LOCATION> defence , left defender <PERSON>John Veldman</PERSON> standing and curled the ball beyond goalkeeper <PERSON>Edwin van der Sar</PERSON> into the <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> net .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> , without injured defenders <PERSON>Marcio Santos</PERSON> and <PERSON>Winston Bogarde</PERSON> and strikers <PERSON>Jari Litmanen</PERSON> and <PERSON>Marc Overmars</PERSON> , then stepped up the pace and looked certain to equalise .</S>
<S>But they left gaps at the back and on 73 minutes Danish striker <PERSON>Jon Dahl Tomasson</PERSON> rushed out of his own half , beat the <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> defence and lobbed <PERSON>van der Sar</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The defeat means <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION>'s main title contenders <ORGANIZATION>PSV Eindhoven</ORGANIZATION> , who beat the champions 3-0 in the traditional league curtain-raiser , can go three points clear of their rivals if they beat <ORGANIZATION>Groningen</ORGANIZATION> on Sunday .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>British hostage in <LOCATION>Chechnya</LOCATION> describes ordeal .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>A British aid worker , held hostage in <LOCATION>Chechnya</LOCATION> for nearly four weeks , said on Saturday a cocked Kalashnikov had been thrust into his mouth at one point during his ordeal .</S>
<S><PERSON>Michael Penrose</PERSON> , a 23-year-old worker with the group <ORGANIZATION>Action Against Hunger</ORGANIZATION> , described his ordeal to a news conference when he arrived back in <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> from <LOCATION>Moscow</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" The worst period of physical manhandling was during that time when we were beaten with Kalashnikovs and at one point I had a Kalashnikov held to the back of my throat -- cocked , " he said .</S>
<S>" For the first period we were held in a small room with no bed or anything .</S>
<S>We had very little food and sometimes went two or three days without eating . "</S>
<S>Gunmen seized <PERSON>Penrose</PERSON> , who comes from <LOCATION>Swerford</LOCATION> in southern <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> , Frenchman <PERSON>Frederic Malardeau</PERSON> and six other hostages from their car in <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> , the capital of <LOCATION>Chechnya</LOCATION> , on July 27 .</S>
<S>The assailants had demanded a ransom of 300,000 pounds ( $ 465,000 ) but no money was paid by the charity when they were released on Wednesday .</S>
<S>The hostages were held in a house in or near <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> which was bombarded regularly .</S>
<S>" During the last 15 days of being held , the fighting in <LOCATION>Grozny</LOCATION> was very close .</S>
<S>At first it was street fighting outside the house and then we came under very heavy shelling and bombardment from conventional weapons like tanks , artillery and grenade launchers , " he said .</S>
<S><PERSON>Penrose</PERSON> had been working for the charity which provides food to civilians for only a few weeks before he was captured .</S>
<S>When asked if he would return to the mountainous region where rebels have been fighting Russian troops for full independence , <PERSON>Penrose</PERSON> said : " Not for the time being .</S>
<S>I don't think it's safe for me .</S>
<S>But maybe in the future , depending on the circumstances . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><PERSON>Diana</PERSON>'s office said on Saturday the princess had sent a message to the Nobel Peace Prize-winning missionary as news broke this week of her battle against heart problems and malaria .</S>
<S>A spokeswoman declined to release details of the message .</S>
<S><PERSON>Diana</PERSON> first met the Albanian-born missionary in <LOCATION>Rome</LOCATION> in 1992 .</S>
<S>She said afterwards that the meeting had fulfilled her " dearest wish " and the two women have met several times since .</S>
<S>The princess , who has carved out a major role for herself as a helper of the sick and needy , is said to have turned to <PERSON>Mother Teresa</PERSON> for guidance as her marriage crumbled to heir to the British throne <PERSON>Prince Charles</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The 85-year-old nun said in the past that she was praying for the couple , whose divorce is expected to become final next week .</S>
<S>Doctors caring for <PERSON>Mother Teresa</PERSON> in a <LOCATION>Calcutta</LOCATION> hospital said on Saturday that her fever had fallen and her malaria was under control but she remained on a respirator in intensive care .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>Adventurers start Canadian wilderness race .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PEMBERTON</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>British Columbia</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>About 350 adventurers from nine countries set out on Saturday to climb , raft , bike and run in a 323-mile ( 517-km ) endurance race through the Canadian wilderness .</S>
<S>The event , called the Eco-Challenge , is part of a growing sport known as adventure racing in which competitors test their limits for days over a perilous wilderness course .</S>
<S>" I'm looking forward to this race .</S>
<S>I think it will be more physically challenging and we'll have to go up against more diverse situations due to the terrain , " said Dr. <PERSON>Michael Stroud</PERSON> , a veteran Eco-Challenge participant .</S>
<S>The Eco-Challenge has been staged twice before -- in <LOCATION>Utah</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Maine</LOCATION> last year -- and is modelled on similar races overseas .</S>
<S>The 70 teams in this year's race will will trek glaciers , climb mountains , whitewater raft , horseback ride , canoe and mountain bike along the grueling course .</S>
<S>This year's race , the route of which was keep a secret until Friday evening , is being held near <LOCATION>Pemberton</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>British Columbia</LOCATION> , about 100 miles ( 160 km ) northeast of <LOCATION>Vancouver</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The area is filled with treacherous mountain peaks , ice fields and frigid waters .</S>
<S>Organisers expect about two-thirds of the participants to drop out or be disqualified before the finish .</S>
<S>The hardy ones are expected to complete the course in about six days , with first-place finishers receiving $ 10,000 in prize money .</S>
<S>In the Eco-Challenge , competitors race in teams of five which must include both men and women .</S>
<S>Team members must remain within 100 yards ( metres ) of each other at all times and finish together .</S>
<S>With racers carrying about 40 pounds ( 18 kg ) of gear on their backs , broken bones , sunstroke , dehydration and exhaustion are common .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>Cholera kills 21 in southern <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LAGOS</LOCATION> 1996-05-28</S>
<S>An outbreak of cholera has killed 21 people in a week at <LOCATION>Ubimini</LOCATION> in oil-rich southern <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> , the <ORGANIZATION>News Agency of Nigeria</ORGANIZATION> reported on Saturday .</S>
<S>The chairman of the local council , <PERSON>Damian Ejiohuo</PERSON> , said drugs had been rushed to the area to quell the disease and the community needed a safer source of drinking water to prevent future outbreaks .</S>
<S>Epidemics are common in rural areas of <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> where piped water is not usually available .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Malawi</LOCATION>'s ex-president <PERSON>Banda</PERSON> says he's feeling well .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BLANTYRE</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S><LOCATION>Malawi</LOCATION>'s frail former president , <PERSON>Kamuzu Banda</PERSON> , said on Saturday in a rare public interview that he was feeling well despite his advanced years .</S>
<S>" I feel all right and I eat everything that is put on the table .</S>
<S>And that means I am all right , " he told reporters invited to his home .</S>
<S><PERSON>Banda</PERSON> , a vegetarian teetotaller believed to be 97 , walked unaided but supporting himself on a walking stick .</S>
<S>He clutched a fly whisk which for a long time symbolised his obsession with power .</S>
<S>His health was the subject of much recent speculation .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Malawi</LOCATION>'s undisputed ruler for three decades , he lost power in the first all-party elections in 1994 .</S>
<S>He spent a year under house arrest and was tried but acquitted last year on charges of ordering the murder of four opponents in 1983 .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Zimbabwe</LOCATION> fires striking civil servants .</S>
<S><PERSON>Emelia Sithole</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>HARARE</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>The Zimbabwean government fired thousands of workers on Saturday for defying an order to end a strike which has crippled essential services and disrupted international and domestic flights .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Public Service Commission</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>PSC</ORGANIZATION> ) said in a statement that the workers -- including nurses , junior doctors , mortuary attendants , customs officers and firefighters -- would be barred from entering their workplaces on Monday .</S>
<S>" All civil servants who did not return to work at their normal working hours , and remained working for the full working day on 23 August 1996 , have been summarily dismissed ...</S>
<S>with immediate effect , " it said in a statement .</S>
<S>Union officials from the <ORGANIZATION>Public Service Association</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>PSA</ORGANIZATION> ) were unavailable for comment .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Public Service , Labour and Social Welfare</ORGANIZATION> Minister <LOCATION>Florence</LOCATION> Chitauro told state radio her ministry had already begun recruiting other people to replace the strikers , sub-contracting some of the work to private firms .</S>
<S>The government had been threatening to fire the workers since the strike began on Tuesday , saying it was illegal .</S>
<S>But the strikers ignored the threat and vowed to stay on the streets until their demands for wage rises of 30 to 60 percent were met .</S>
<S>The stoppage has left essential services stretched with many hospitals handling only emergency cases under senior doctors with the help of army medical personnel and the <ORGANIZATION>Red Cross</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>It has also disrupted flights .</S>
<S>Some internal services were cancelled , leaving tourists at the <LOCATION>Victoria Falls</LOCATION> resort stranded , and flights abroad were delayed .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>PSA</ORGANIZATION> said 80 percent of the country's 180,000 civil servants took part in the strike which is a rare challenge to President <PERSON>Robert Mugabe</PERSON> , who has been in power since independence from <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> in 1980 .</S>
<S>Opposition parties , civic organisations and private-sector unions have expressed support for the action and denounced the government's pay rises of up to eight percent for its workers .</S>
<S>Civil servants earn on average Z$ 1,000 ( $ 100 ) a month .</S>
<S>They say their pay has not kept up at all with inflation , currently running at 22 percent .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>Rwanda</LOCATION> says <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> expels 28 Rwandan refugees .</S>
<S><LOCATION>KIGALI</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S><LOCATION>Rwanda</LOCATION> said on Saturday that <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> had expelled 28 Rwandan Hutu refugees accused of being " trouble-makers " in camps in eastern <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Captain <PERSON>Firmin Gatera</PERSON> , spokesman for the Tutsi-dominated Rwandan army , told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Kigali</LOCATION> that 17 of the 28 refugees handed over on Friday from the Zairean town of <LOCATION>Goma</LOCATION> had been soldiers in the former Hutu army which fled to <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> in 1994 after being defeated by Tutsi forces in <LOCATION>Rwanda</LOCATION>'s civil war .</S>
<S>Zairean Prime Minister <PERSON>Kengo wa Dondo</PERSON> said on Thursday in a visit to <LOCATION>Rwanda</LOCATION> that his country would expell all the refugees back to <LOCATION>Rwanda</LOCATION> but he gave no timeframe .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> is home to 1.1 million Rwandan Hutu refugees who fled three months of civil war in 1994 .</S>
<S>Many had taken part in the genocide that year of one million people , mostly Tutsis , and refuse to go home for fear of reprisal at the hands of the new Tutsi-dominated government in <LOCATION>Kigali</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Gatera</PERSON> said the refugees were handed over following a deal made at a meeting between the governor of <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION>'s north <LOCATION>Kivu</LOCATION> region and his counterpart in the Rwandan border town of <LOCATION>Gisenyi</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" After a meeting between the governor of north <LOCATION>Kivu</LOCATION> and the prefect of <LOCATION>Gisenyi</LOCATION> , 28 prisoners ( refugees ) were handed over to Rwandan authorities on Friday , " <PERSON>Gatera</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Out of these 17 were former soldiers .</S>
<S>These people are now in <LOCATION>Gisenyi</LOCATION> prison , " <PERSON>Gatera</PERSON> added .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>Revered skull of <LOCATION>S. Africa</LOCATION> king is Scottish woman's .</S>
<S><LOCATION>JOHANNESBURG</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>A limelight-loving South African chief was in disgrace on Saturday after a prized skull he brought home from <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> was identified as belonging not to his sacred tribal ancestor , but to a middle-aged white woman .</S>
<S>A forensic scientist who examined the supposed skull of 19th century King <PERSON>Hintsa</PERSON> , a chief of President <PERSON>Nelson Mandela</PERSON>'s Xhosa tribe killed in battle by the British , said it was in fact the cranium of a European woman .</S>
<S>Chief <PERSON>Nicholas Gcaleka</PERSON> , dressed in animal skins and full tribal regalia , journeyed to a wintry <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> in February on a hugely publicised quest to find <PERSON>Hintsa</PERSON>'s skull .</S>
<S>The witchdoctor said ancestors had appeared to him in a dream and ordered him to return the head , said to have been carried off as a colonial trophy by the officer who shot and allegedly beheaded <PERSON>Hintsa</PERSON> after a battle in 1835 .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Gcaleka</PERSON> ran into trouble as soon as he returned to <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> with a skull he found in a cottage in a lonely <LOCATION>Highland</LOCATION> forest near <LOCATION>Inverness</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>He said the spirit of a hurricane had guided him there .</S>
<S>Members of the Xhosa royal family , branding <PERSON>Gcaleka</PERSON> a charlatan , confiscated the head and sent it for tests to a forensic scientist , who examined the shape of the skull and the hole that he determined had not come , as supposed , from a bullet .</S>
<S>" It can be stated beyond reasonable doubt that this skull is not that of the late king , " the scientist said in a statement .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Sudan</LOCATION> arrests opposition sewing machine smugglers .</S>
<S><LOCATION>KHARTOUM</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>Sudanese police have arrested three people trying to smuggle sewing machines and army clothing to Sudanese opposition groups in <LOCATION>Eritrea</LOCATION> , an official newspaper reported on Saturday .</S>
<S>The government-owned <ORGANIZATION>al-Ingaz al-Watani</ORGANIZATION> said the smugglers were caught in <LOCATION>Banat</LOCATION> in the eastern state of <LOCATION>Kassala</LOCATION> , on the border with <LOCATION>Eritrea</LOCATION> , and had confessed they were on their way to " the so-called alliance forces which have been undertaking subversive operations on the eastern border " .</S>

<S><PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> campaign busy making " news " .</S>
<S><PERSON>Laurence McQuillan</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>WASHINGTON</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>President <PERSON>Bill Clinton</PERSON> has served notice he intends to be busy " making news " -- or at least doing things that look and sound like it in a campaign year .</S>
<S>With Democrats gathering in <LOCATION>Chicago</LOCATION> to start a convention on Monday to nominate him for a second term as president , <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> plans a steady parade of events designed to highlight his leadership and dim the glow of the just-concluded Republican conclave that gave a boost to rival <PERSON>Bob Dole</PERSON> .</S>
<S>After a week of carefully orchestrated events signing into law bills passed by the Republican-controlled <ORGANIZATION>Congress</ORGANIZATION> , <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> used his Saturday radio address to the nation to proudly " announce " a development in the war on crime .</S>
<S>" Sixty days ago I directed the attorney general to draw up a plan for a national registry of sex offenders , " <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>That plan has now reached my desk . "</S>
<S>" Today I am pleased to announce that we are following through on our commitment to keep track of these criminals , not just in a single state but wherever they go , " he said .</S>
<S>Actually , creation of such a registry was underway without <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> lifting a finger .</S>
<S>Attorney General <PERSON>Janet Reno</PERSON>'s report -- all nine pages of it , including footnotes -- offers only the interim services of the <ORGANIZATION>FBI</ORGANIZATION> until a formal registry on sex offenders has been established .</S>
<S>Two months ago , <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> announced he wanted an interim effort established .</S>
<S>Now , 60 days later , he had a chance to talk about it again .</S>
<S>It is an example of <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON>'s strategic planning as he heads into the stretch drive for the Nov. 5 presidential election .</S>
<S>Such things do not happen by chance in the <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> <LOCATION>White House</LOCATION> , they are part of his political chess game .</S>
<S>In the past week <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> signed into law an increase in the minimium wage , a bill that makes it easier for someone with a pre-existing health problem to change jobs , and sweeping changes overhauling the nation's welfare system .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>America</LOCATION> can look back on a week of remarkable achievement , " <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> said , without even a passing reference to the Republican majority in the <ORGANIZATION>House</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Senate</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>America</LOCATION> is on the right track offering more opportunity , demanding more responsibility , building a stronger community , the sense of shared values and stronger families , " he said in striking the theme of his coming week .</S>
<S>According to a senior campaign official , <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> " will be making a lot of news in the coming week -- something different each day . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> departs on Sunday on a four-day train trip through <LOCATION>West Virginia</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Kentucky</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Ohio</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Michigan</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Indiana</LOCATION> while fellow Democrats are gathered in <LOCATION>Chicago</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" He'll make news during the day ... and then at night the attention will go to the convention , " said the campaign official . "</S>
<S>We think it'll work really well . "</S>
<S>Although officials decline to say just what each day's " news " will be , the intent is to put a focus on <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> himself and not just those attending the party's convention .</S>
<S>Each day of the trip will have a late start , so that network television correspondents will be able to do live reports for morning programmes .</S>
<S>Campaign officials then hope the day's " news " event will be showcased on evening television news shows as a lead-in for that night's convention programme .</S>
<S>" We'll be concentrating ... on supporting the president as he is on the trip and making significant public policy statements related to some of his plans for the future , " said <LOCATION>White House</LOCATION> Press Secretary <PERSON>Mike McCurry</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>McCurry</PERSON> said that when <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> delivers his acceptance address on Thursday night to fellow Democrats and a national television audience , he will " set out a road map " for the nation's future -- one the president hopes guides him back to the <LOCATION>White House</LOCATION> for four more years .</S>

<S>Belgian police searched two more houses on Saturday for bodies in a child-sex scandal of murder , kidnapping and pornography that has sent a shockwave of revulsion throughout <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Recriminations built up over how the scandal's central figure , convicted child rapist <PERSON>Marc Dutroux</PERSON> , managed to prey on children unhindered for so long .</S>
<S>In just over a week two young girls have been found dead , from starvation , two have been freed from a dungeon-like secret compartment and an international hunt has started for at least two others .</S>
<S>On Saturday investigators with dogs trained to find bodies searched one house at <LOCATION>Ransart</LOCATION> and one at <LOCATION>Mont-sur-Marchienne</LOCATION> -- both suburbs of the southern city of <LOCATION>Charleroi</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Both houses are owned by <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> .</S>
<S>Belgian media speculated that <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> , charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children , must have had high level protection to molest youngsters .</S>
<S>They put forward no proof to support the speculation , but seized on a comment by chief prosecutor <PERSON>Michel Bourlet</PERSON> on Belgian television on Friday night that he would chase down everyone involved in the case " if I am allowed to " .</S>
<S><PERSON>Bourlet</PERSON> said between 300 and 400 paedophile porn video tapes had been seized , some of which featured <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> was charged a week ago after police rescued two young girls from a concrete dungeon in the basement of one of the six houses he owns in and around <LOCATION>Charleroi</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Just a day later the national euphoria at the rescue turned to disgust as <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> led police to the bodies of two eight-year-old girls in another of his houses .</S>
<S><PERSON>Julie Lejeune</PERSON> and <PERSON>Melissa Russo</PERSON> , had been kidnapped in June last year .</S>
<S><PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> said they starved to death nine months later .</S>
<S>He also admitted kidnapping two other girls , <PERSON>An Marchal</PERSON> and <PERSON>Eefje Lambrecks</PERSON> , a year ago .</S>
<S>The fate of the girls is unknown , but there has been speculation they were sold into prostitution in <LOCATION>Slovakia</LOCATION> or the <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> where <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> was a frequent visitor .</S>
<S>Belgian police have visited <LOCATION>Bratislava</LOCATION> and will visit <LOCATION>Prague</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Five other people have been arrested including <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON>'s second wife <PERSON>Michelle Martin</PERSON> , charged as an accomplice .</S>
<S>The others have been charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children or are suspected of criminal association .</S>
<S>Dutch police are also holding a 74-year old Dutchman in connection with the disappearance of <PERSON>An</PERSON> and <PERSON>Eefje</PERSON> , although a spokesman said no direct link had yet been established .</S>
<S>At least part of the speculation in the Belgian media of high-level protection for <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> and his accomplices is based on leaked documents cataloguing a high degree of police bungling , incompetence and indifference .</S>
<S>Among the revelations are the fact that the gendarmerie was running a surveillance operation codenamed " Othello " against <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> in 1995 -- when both <PERSON>Julie</PERSON> and <PERSON>Melissa</PERSON> and <PERSON>An</PERSON> and <PERSON>Eefje</PERSON> were kidnapped .</S>
<S>They show that the gendarmes were aware that <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> was building cells in some of his houses for holding children , yet this information was either not passed on to other police forces searching for the missing girls or was overlooked when it was .</S>
<S>They also show that police investigating a theft visited <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> late last year at the house where <PERSON>Julie</PERSON> and <PERSON>Melissa</PERSON> were being held but accepted his word that the children's cries they could hear came from neighbours .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Justice</ORGANIZATION> Minister <PERSON>Stefaan De Clerck</PERSON> has admitted that mistakes were made and ordered an inquiry at the same time as stressing there were no indications of a cover-up .</S>
<S>There is also widespread disbelief that no one appeared to question how <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> , an unemployed father of three with no visible means of support , managed to own six houses .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>Death toll of <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> bomb put at seven-newspaper .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PARIS</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>An Algerian newspaper on Saturday put at seven -- two women and five children -- the death toll of a bomb blast in a market west of <LOCATION>Algiers</LOCATION> on Friday .</S>
<S>Algerian security forces said on Friday three women and two children were killed and five people wounded when a home-made bomb exploded at a market in the coastal town of <LOCATION>Bou Haroun</LOCATION> , 65 km ( 40 miles ) west of <LOCATION>Algiers</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The security forces also said a man carrying an explosive device also died after it went off prematurely .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>El-Watan</ORGANIZATION> paper said the blast killed seven -- a mother and her 25-year-old daughter , four young boys and a five-year-old girl .</S>
<S>Several people were also wounded , it said .</S>
<S>The explosion was the latest in series of bomb attacks in <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION>'s four-year-old civil strife .</S>
<S>The government-appointed watchdog , <ORGANIZATION>Human Rights National Observatory</ORGANIZATION> , was quoted this month by local newspapers as saying about 1,400 civilians have died in bomb attacks blamed on Moslem rebels in the past two years .</S>
<S>An estimated 50,000 Algerians and more than 110 foreigners have been killed in violence pitting Moslem rebels against government forces since early 1992 , when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists had taken a commanding lead .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>Malta</LOCATION> police seize cannabis among chilli sauce .</S>
<S><LOCATION>VALLETTA</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>Police in <LOCATION>Malta</LOCATION> said on Saturday they had seized 7.5 tonnes of cannabis concealed in a shipment of chilli sauce on its way from <LOCATION>Singapore</LOCATION> to <LOCATION>Romania</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Police commissioner <PERSON>George Grech</PERSON> said the cannabis was found on Friday packed in 500 boxes hidden behind chilli sauce in a container that arrived at <LOCATION>Malta Freeport</LOCATION> a week ago .</S>
<S>The container was on its way to <LOCATION>Romania</LOCATION> via the former <LOCATION>Yugoslavia</LOCATION> from <LOCATION>Singapore</LOCATION> and was the biggest drugs haul in <LOCATION>Malta</LOCATION> , police said .</S>
<S>No street value was given for the cannabis .</S>

<S>Czech coach in fatal crash in <LOCATION>Austria</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>VIENNA</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>A Czech coach crashed and burst into flames on a southern Austrian motorway early on Saturday , killing one person and injuring 15 , police said .</S>
<S>Austrian television said the coach , which was carrying 45 , was en route from the <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> to <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> when the accident occurred near <LOCATION>Steinberg</LOCATION> , 200 km southwest of <LOCATION>Vienna</LOCATION> .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>Most Spaniards back talks with Basque rebels--poll .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MADRID</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>Most Spaniards would support government talks with the illegal Basque separatist group <ORGANIZATION>ETA</ORGANIZATION> if the rebels renounced violence permanently , a survey published in daily <ORGANIZATION>El Mundo</ORGANIZATION> on Saturday said .</S>
<S>While 57 percent of the population supported negotiations with <ORGANIZATION>ETA</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>Basque Homeland and Freedom</ORGANIZATION> ) , 30 percent opposed it , the survey by the state-controlled <ORGANIZATION>Centre for Sociological Studies</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>CIS</ORGANIZATION> ) found .</S>
<S>But 80 percent said <ORGANIZATION>ETA</ORGANIZATION> had shown little interest in achieving peace in the Basque country when it offered a one-week truce in July while continuing to hold prison officer <PERSON>Jose Antonio Ortega Lara</PERSON> , kidnapped in January .</S>
<S>The problem of terrorism had neither worsened nor improved since the conservative <ORGANIZATION>Popular Party</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>PP</ORGANIZATION> ) came to power in May , according to 56 percent of those questioned , while 22 percent said it had worsened .</S>
<S>The survey questioned 2,496 people between July 17 and 21 and has a margin of error of plus or minus two percent .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>Thirty killed as floods plunge <LOCATION>Lahore</LOCATION> into chaos .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ISLAMABAD</LOCATION> 1996-08-24</S>
<S>At least 30 people have been killed and about 100 injured in the flood-hit Pakistani city of <LOCATION>Lahore</LOCATION> , newspapers reported on Saturday .</S>
<S>They said 461 mm ( 18 inches ) of rain had drenched the <LOCATION>Punjab</LOCATION> provincial capital in 36 hours , turning streets into rivers , knocking out power , water and telephone services , disrupting air and rail traffic , and sweeping away houses and cars .</S>
<S>Newspapers quoted witnesses as saying they had seen bodies floating in the streets .</S>
<S>Among the dead were five members of the religious <ORGANIZATION>Jamaat-i-Islami</ORGANIZATION> party who drowned while trying to remove books from a basement library .</S>
<S>They said thousands of people had been made homeless after a breach opened in the city canal , inundating residential areas .</S>
<S>Army troops were called in to evacuate residents of low-lying areas to higher ground .</S>
<S>Officials said the <LOCATION>Ravi</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Chenab</LOCATION> rivers , which both flow through <LOCATION>Punjab</LOCATION> , were in high flood and emergency services backed by troops were on full alert .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> funded to develop Java software .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MOUNTAIN VIEW</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Calif.</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>A small team of engineers from <ORGANIZATION>Sun Microsystems Inc.</ORGANIZATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>JavaSoft</ORGANIZATION> unit said Sunday they have formed a new company , dubbed <ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> , to build Java infrastructure software .</S>
<S>The fledgling company , established in a ground-floor office here over the last two weeks , has received venture financing from <ORGANIZATION>Bessemer Venture Partners</ORGANIZATION> of <LOCATION>Menlo Park</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Calif</LOCATION> ..</S>
<S><PERSON>David Cowan</PERSON> , <ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> founder and acting chief executive , is a general partner of <ORGANIZATION>Bessemer</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The startup company's acting chairman is <PERSON>Jim Bidzos</PERSON> , the president of <ORGANIZATION>RSA Data Security</ORGANIZATION> , a unit of <ORGANIZATION>Security Dynamics Technologies Inc.</ORGANIZATION> as well as chairman of <ORGANIZATION>VeriSign</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> , which opened its doors with about half a dozen initial employees , combines experience at <ORGANIZATION>JavaSoft</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>Apple Computer Inc.</ORGANIZATION> , and <ORGANIZATION>Oracle Systems</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" Java portends dramatic changes in the way we use the Internet , " said <PERSON>Hong Bui</PERSON> , vice president of engineering of the new company after serving as a senior engineer at <ORGANIZATION>JavaSoft</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Java is a computer programming language introduced by <ORGANIZATION>Sun Microsystems</ORGANIZATION> in mid-1995 which has immediately captured the attention of the industry for its ability to operate across virtually all computer system in a relatively secure manner .</S>
<S>Just last week , <ORGANIZATION>Sun Microsystems</ORGANIZATION> and the <LOCATION>Silicon Valley</LOCATION> venture capital giant <ORGANIZATION>Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers</ORGANIZATION> said they had completed financing of a $ 100 million fund managed by <ORGANIZATION>Kleiner Perkins</ORGANIZATION> to fund startups developing Java technologies .</S>
<S>Java has been licensed by nearly 50 organisations , ranging from <ORGANIZATION>Microsoft Corp.</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>International Business Machines Corp.</ORGANIZATION> to the <LOCATION>Taiwan</LOCATION> government .</S>
<S><PERSON>Prasad Wagle</PERSON> , another former senior <ORGANIZATION>JavaSoft</ORGANIZATION> engineer who is among the founding engineers at <ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> , said the new company aims to build software infrastructure using Java to make networked applications ubiquitious .</S>
<S>One feature of the Java language is that small software programmes , known as " applets " because they are small applications , can be downloaded from the server computers at the centre of networks onto individual computers for use .</S>
<S>In this model , individual computer users can always gain access to the latest programmes and do not need to store more software than they are currently using on their computers at any one time , also saving costs of memory and storage .</S>
<S><PERSON>Chris Zuleeg</PERSON> , a veteran of <ORGANIZATION>Apple</ORGANIZATION> and a former <ORGANIZATION>JavaSoft</ORGANIZATION> marketing manager , is vice president of marketing at <ORGANIZATION>Internet Startup</ORGANIZATION> , whose Web site is www.internetstartup.com .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Bessemer</ORGANIZATION> has funded numerous Internet pioneers , including <ORGANIZATION>PSI Net</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>VeriSign</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Individual</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>GOLF - <PERSON>MICKELSON</PERSON> WINS FOURTH TITLE OF YEAR IN <LOCATION>AKRON</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>AKRON</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Ohio</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S><PERSON>Phil Mickelson</PERSON> birdied two of the last three holes to win World Series of Golf by three strokes over <PERSON>Billy Mayfair</PERSON> on Sunday .</S>
<S>It was the fourth tournament title this year for <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> , who shot an even-par 70 , after being tied for the lead with <PERSON>Billy Mayfair</PERSON> with three holes to play .</S>
<S>Along with <PERSON>Mayfiar</PERSON> at 277 for the tournament were <PERSON>Steve Stricker</PERSON> , who had a 68 , and <PERSON>Duffy Waldorf</PERSON> , with a 66 .</S>
<S>" It was very hard to sleep last night because there was so much I could accomplish with this win , " said <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> , who had a three-stroke lead entering the third round . "</S>
<S>This was a win I wanted very , very much . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON>'s victory gave him a 10 year exemption to the PGA Tour .</S>
<S>The $ 378,000 first place check brings <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> back to the top of the money list with $ 1,574,799 won this year .</S>
<S>" This is a major championship golf course , and for me to perform well on this style of course is a big step up for me in my career and my performance in future majors , " he said .</S>
<S><PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> three-stroke lead was cut to two when <PERSON>Mayfair</PERSON> birdied the course's only easy hole , the par five second hole , while <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> three-putted for par from 25 feet .</S>
<S>On the back nine <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> began driving erratically , and poor tee shots resulted in bogeys on the , eighth , 12th and 13th holes , bringing <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> back to four under par , tied with <PERSON>Mayfair</PERSON> , who had parred 14 straight holes after the birdie on no.2 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> then set up a tap in birdie on the 16th , sending a wedge shot to 18 inches .</S>
<S>He had another birdie on the 17th , where he his a 6-iron to six feet .</S>
<S><PERSON>Mayfair</PERSON> bogeyed the 17th , missing a five foot par putt , and dropped from solo second place to a three way tie for second .</S>
<S>It was the second successive year in which <PERSON>Mayfair</PERSON> has finished runner up in this tournament .</S>
<S>He lost to <PERSON>Greg Norman</PERSON> in sudden death last year .</S>
<S>The defending champion was in contention , two behind <PERSON>Mickelson</PERSON> for much of the day , until he bogeyed the 13th and 14th holes .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>MOTOCROSS - GERMAN 125CC GRAND PRIX RESULTS .</S>
<S><LOCATION>HOLZGERLINGEN</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>Leading results in</S>

<S>MOTORCYCLING - JAPANESE WIN BOTH ROUND <PERSON>NINE</PERSON> SUPERBIKE RACES .</S>
<S><LOCATION>SUGO</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>Teenager <PERSON>Yuuichi Takeda</PERSON> , racing in only his first season , outclassed the big names to win the first race in round nine of the world superbike championship on Sunday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> , 18 , showed poise far beyond his years to overtake Australian <ORGANIZATION>Ducati</ORGANIZATION> rider <PERSON>Troy Corser</PERSON> , last year's championship runner-up , with four of the 25 laps left .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Honda</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> was pursued past <PERSON>Corser</PERSON> by the <ORGANIZATION>Yamaha</ORGANIZATION> duo of <PERSON>Noriyuki Haga</PERSON> and <PERSON>Wataru Yoshikawa</PERSON> with <PERSON>Haga</PERSON> briefly taking the lead in the final chicane on the last lap .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> found one more spurt of power to just take the flag first with <PERSON>Haga</PERSON> second and <PERSON>Yoshikawa</PERSON> third .</S>
<S><PERSON>Haga</PERSON> had the consolation of recording the fastest lap at 147.159 kph .</S>
<S><PERSON>Corser</PERSON> , who crashed during practice on Friday , limped in fourth , four seconds behind <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> with championship leader <PERSON>Aaron Slight</PERSON> of <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> 11 seconds behind the winner .</S>
<S>In the second race , <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> again challenged strongly until the fifth lap from the end when he crashed while running second to eventual race winner <PERSON>Takuma Aoki</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Aoki</PERSON> , the elder brother of reigning 125cc world champion <PERSON>Haruchika</PERSON> , had a race-long duel with <PERSON>John Kocinski</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> on a <ORGANIZATION>Ducati</ORGANIZATION> before taking the chequered flag .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kocinski</PERSON> led for the early laps before he was passed first by <PERSON>Aoki</PERSON> , who recorded the fastest lap of 147.786 kph , and then by <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> .</S>
<S>With <PERSON>Takeda</PERSON> out of the race , <PERSON>Kocinski</PERSON> regained second place but he could not overtake <PERSON>Aoki</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Haga</PERSON> again was the unlucky rider finishing third ahead of <PERSON>Slight</PERSON> with <PERSON>Corser</PERSON> in 10th place .</S>
<S>But the strong showing by the Japanese riders did not alter the championship table with <PERSON>Slight</PERSON> still leading on 280 points , followed by <PERSON>Corser</PERSON> with 269 and <PERSON>Kocinski</PERSON> with 254 .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>CRICKET - <PERSON>POLLOCK</PERSON> CONCLUDES <ORGANIZATION>WARWICKSHIRE</ORGANIZATION> CAREER WITH FLOURISH .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>South African fast bowler <PERSON>Shaun Pollock</PERSON> concluded his <ORGANIZATION>Warwickshire</ORGANIZATION> career with a flourish on Sunday by taking the final three wickets during the county's Sunday league victory over <ORGANIZATION>Worcestershire</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Pollock</PERSON> , who returns home on Tuesday for an ankle operation , took the last three wickets in nine balls as <ORGANIZATION>Worcestershire</ORGANIZATION> were dismissed for 154 .</S>
<S>After an hour's interruption for rain , <ORGANIZATION>Warwickshire</ORGANIZATION> then reached an adjusted target of 109 with 13 balls to spare and record their fifth win in the last six games .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Warwickshire</ORGANIZATION> are currently in fourth position behind <ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>Nottinghamshire</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Surrey</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION> captain <PERSON>David Byas</PERSON> completed his third Sunday league century as his side swept clear at the top of the table , reaching a career best 111 not out against <ORGANIZATION>Lancashire</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Lancashire</ORGANIZATION>'s total of 205 for eight from 40 overs looked reasonable before <PERSON>Byas</PERSON> put their attack to the sword , collecting his runs from just 100 balls with three sixes and nine fours .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Yorkshire</ORGANIZATION> eventually reached their target with only four wickets down and 7.5 overs to spare .</S>

<S>CRICKET - RUN-OUT GIVES <PERSON>LEWIS</PERSON> AND <LOCATION>ENGLAND</LOCATION> SLIM SATISFACTION .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S><PERSON>Chris Lewis</PERSON> did his best to forget his controversial omission from the <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> one-day squad on Sunday but could not prevent <LOCATION>Pakistan</LOCATION> reasserting their dominance in the final test at <LOCATION>The Oval</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>A super piece of fielding by <PERSON>Lewis</PERSON> , dropped as a disciplinary measure after arriving only 35 minutes before the start on the fourth morning , provided the only bright spot for <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> as the touring team batted on to reach 413 for five at the interval , a lead of 87 .</S>
<S>The solitary wicket to fall was <PERSON>Asif Mujtaba</PERSON> , run out for 13 attempting a second run to third man where <PERSON>Lewis</PERSON> was lurking with a point to prove .</S>
<S>There seemed scant danger until the <ORGANIZATION>Surrey</ORGANIZATION> player swooped on to the ball and returned off balance to county team mate <PERSON>Alec Stewart</PERSON> who whipped off the bails .</S>
<S><PERSON>Lewis</PERSON> , though , could not make similar waves with the ball as <PERSON>Salim Malik</PERSON> and <PERSON>Wasim Akram</PERSON> batted through the rest of the session with few alarms .</S>
<S><PERSON>Wasim</PERSON> rattled along to 30 not out , outscoring his partner who was unbeaten on 24 at the break , although the weather was again threatening to play the dominant role .</S>
<S>Rain arrived just as the players left the field for lunch , forcing the ground-staff into action yet again .</S>
<S>The weather delayed the resumption for over an hour , the umpires finally announcing play would start again at 1445 local time ( 1345 GMT ) .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>BASEBALL - <ORGANIZATION>ORIOLES</ORGANIZATION> SNEAK PAST <ORGANIZATION>ANGELS</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BALTIMORE</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S><PERSON>Rafael Palmeiro</PERSON>'s two-out single in the sixth inning scored <PERSON>Roberto Alomar</PERSON> with the go-ahead run as the <ORGANIZATION>Baltimore Orioles</ORGANIZATION> rallied past the <ORGANIZATION>California Angels</ORGANIZATION> 5-4 and took over the American League's wild-card berth on Saturday .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Orioles</ORGANIZATION> trailed 4-3 when pinch-hitter <PERSON>Mike Devereaux</PERSON> led off the sixth with a triple against reliever <PERSON>Kyle Abbott</PERSON> ( 0-1 ) and scored the tying run on <PERSON>Alomar</PERSON>'s single .</S>
<S>After <PERSON>Brady Anderson</PERSON> sacrificed , <PERSON>Palmeiro</PERSON> hit the first pitch into right field for a single , scoring <PERSON>Alomar</PERSON> .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Boston</LOCATION> , former <PERSON>Mariner Darren Bragg</PERSON>'s first career grand slam in the sixth inning off reliever <PERSON>Randy Johnson</PERSON> lifted the <ORGANIZATION>Boston Red Sox</ORGANIZATION> to their fifth win in six games , a 9-5 victory over <LOCATION>Seattle</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" Just one of those things , I was just trying to make contact , " said <PERSON>Bragg</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>The bases were loaded and I had two strikes .</S>
<S>I was just trying to put the ball in play .</S>
<S>I got the good part of the bat on it and it carried out . "</S>
<S>In <ORGANIZATION>Cleveland</ORGANIZATION> , <PERSON>Kevin Seitzer</PERSON>'s two-out single in the top of the 10th brought home <PERSON>David Hulse</PERSON> with the winning run as the <ORGANIZATION>Milwaukee Brewers</ORGANIZATION> sent the <ORGANIZATION>Cleveland Indians</ORGANIZATION> to their third straight extra-inning defeat 4-3 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Bob Wickman</PERSON> ( 5-1 ) , acquired from the <ORGANIZATION>New York Yankees</ORGANIZATION> on Friday , earned the win in his <ORGANIZATION>Milwaukee</ORGANIZATION> debut despite allowing the tying run in the eighth inning .</S>
<S>At <LOCATION>Minnesota</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Marty Cordova</PERSON> and <PERSON>Matt Lawton</PERSON> hit solo homers and <PERSON>Frankie Rodriguez</PERSON> allowed six hits over seven innings to earn his first win as a starter in a month as the <ORGANIZATION>Minnesota Twins</ORGANIZATION> held on to beat the <ORGANIZATION>Texas Rangers</ORGANIZATION> 6-5 .</S>
<S>" Yeah , you know it's fun , it's always fun when you've got a chance to go to the ballpark and win a game that's important , " said <PERSON>Rodriguez</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>Every game should be important , but it's a little more important now . "</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>New York</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Wally Whitehurst</PERSON> allowed two runs over seven innings for his first win in more than two years and <PERSON>Paul O'Neill</PERSON>'s three-run double snapped a sixth-inning tie as the <ORGANIZATION>New York Yankees</ORGANIZATION> held on for a 5-4 victory over the <ORGANIZATION>Oakland Athletics</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Whitehurst</PERSON> , promoted from <ORGANIZATION>Triple-A Columbus</ORGANIZATION> on Wednesday , allowed seven hits and struck out one without a walk .</S>
<S>It was his first win since defeating the <ORGANIZATION>St. Louis Cardinals</ORGANIZATION> on May 28th , 1994 when he was with the <ORGANIZATION>San Diego Padres</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>In <LOCATION>Kansas City</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Jose Rosado</PERSON> came within one out of his third complete game and <PERSON>Michael Tucker</PERSON> homered and drove in three runs as the <ORGANIZATION>Kansas City Royals</ORGANIZATION> broke a six-game losing streak with a 9-2 victory over the <ORGANIZATION>Detroit Tigers</ORGANIZATION> in a battle of cellar-dwellers .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rosado</PERSON> ( 5-3 ) allowed two runs -- one earned -- and seven hits over 8-2/3 innings with three walks and six strikeouts .</S>
<S>In his last four starts , the 21-year-old left-hander has given up only four earned runs in 29-2/3 innings .</S>

<S>BASEBALL - <ORGANIZATION>BRAVES</ORGANIZATION> RALLY TO BEAT <ORGANIZATION>CUBS</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ATLANTA</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S><PERSON>Fred McGriff</PERSON> went 5-for-5 and homered twice , including a three-run blast with two out in the bottom of the ninth inning that lifted the <ORGANIZATION>Atlanta Braves</ORGANIZATION> to a 6-5 victory over the <ORGANIZATION>Chicago Cubs</ORGANIZATION> on Saturday .</S>
<S>" I was just trying to hang in there and hit it up the middle , " said <PERSON>McGriff</PERSON> about his homer in the ninth . "</S>
<S>I was just looking for the ball , trying to stay on it .</S>

<S><PERSON>Vinny Castilla</PERSON> and <PERSON>Dante Bichette</PERSON> each added two RBI for <LOCATION>Colorado</LOCATION> , which improved the major league's best home mark to 44-20 .</S>

<S>SOCCER - CHAMPIONS <LOCATION>PORTO</LOCATION> KICK OFF SEASON WITH A DRAW .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LISBON</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>Portuguese champions <ORGANIZATION>Porto</ORGANIZATION> kicked off the season with a disappointing 2-2 home draw against <ORGANIZATION>Setubal</ORGANIZATION> and were lucky to squeeze in an equaliser in extra time .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Porto</ORGANIZATION> , who are fighting to take their third consecutive title this season , were 2-0 down until the 86th minute when a header by <PERSON>Mario Jardel</PERSON> found the net after a string of missed opportunities , including a penalty taken by top league scorer <PERSON>Domingos Oliveira</PERSON> in the 60th minute .</S>
<S><PERSON>Domingos</PERSON> redeemed himself by netting the equaliser just into extra time .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Setubal</ORGANIZATION> , who put on a skilful counter-attack throughout the game , opened the scoring 16 minutes into the match when an unmarked <PERSON>Chiquinho Conde</PERSON> shot around <ORGANIZATION>Porto</ORGANIZATION>'s new Polish keeper <PERSON>Andrejez Wozniak</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Conde</PERSON> scored his second in the 70th minute .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Benfica</ORGANIZATION> , also playing their first game of the season at home , were held to a 1-1 draw by northern side <ORGANIZATION>Braga</ORGANIZATION> despite the fact that the visitors were reduced to 10 men in the 54th minute after <PERSON>Rodrigo Carneiro</PERSON> was sent off for a second bookable offence .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Benfica</ORGANIZATION> dominated the game but their lack of a first-class striker was apparent throughout and in the 30th minute they lost key Brazilian midfielder <PERSON>Valdo</PERSON> who suffered a light knee injury .</S>
<S>He was substituted by <PERSON>Paulao</PERSON> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Benfica</ORGANIZATION> finally opened the scoring in the 81st minute with a penalty taken by <PERSON>Helder</PERSON> after <PERSON>Luis Baltasar</PERSON> tripped up captain <PERSON>Joao Pinto</PERSON> under the referee's nose .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Braga</ORGANIZATION> defender <PERSON>Idalecio</PERSON> gave his team their equaliser seven minutes from the final whistle with a header into the back of the net .</S>

<S>SOCCER - <ORGANIZATION>FIORENTINA</ORGANIZATION> WIN WITH <PERSON>BATISTUTA</PERSON> DOUBLE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MILAN</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>Argentine striker <PERSON>Gabriel Batistuta</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> the perfect 70th birthday present on Sunday with two goals that gave the Italian Cup winners a 2-1 Supercup victory over serie A champions <ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The victory , coming on the eve of the founding of the <LOCATION>Florence</LOCATION> club in 1926 , also marked the first time since the pre-season trophy between the Cup winners and league champions was started in 1988 that the Cup winners had won .</S>
<S><PERSON>Batistuta</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> the lead in the 11th minute .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Stefan Schwarz</PERSON> picked him out with a lob to the edge of the box and <PERSON>Batistuta</PERSON> did the rest , chipping veteran defender <PERSON>Franco Baresi</PERSON> and scoring at the near post .</S>
<S>Montenegrin midfielder <PERSON>Dejan Savicevic</PERSON> equalised for the home team , weaving past a defender , checking and firing in a left-footed shot in the 21st minute that gave young <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> goalkeeper <PERSON>Francesco Toldo</PERSON> little chance .</S>
<S>The scored stayed level to the final minutes but with a penalty shoot out looming , <PERSON>Batistuta</PERSON> took charge .</S>
<S>French international midfielder <PERSON>Marcel Desailly</PERSON> fouled the Argentine , whose coach at <ORGANIZATION>Boca Juniors</ORGANIZATION> before he joined <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> in 1991 was new <ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION> coach <PERSON>Oscar Tabarez</PERSON> , and <PERSON>Batistuta</PERSON> rammed home the free kick from 30 metres out .</S>
<S>The 83rd minute shot , curling over the defence and dipping in under the bar from the striker dubbed <PERSON>Batigol</PERSON> by adoring <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> fans , was just reward for <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> who looked a far more impressive team .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION>'s player of the year <PERSON>George Weah</PERSON> missed a good first half opportunity but otherwise looked a little rusty while Italian team mate <PERSON>Roberto Baggio</PERSON> did not play due to injury .</S>
<S>New Dutch signing <PERSON>Edgar Davids</PERSON> came on late in the second half as a <ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION> substitute but made little impact .</S>
<S>The league season starts on September 8 .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>CYCLING - <PERSON>FERRIGATO</PERSON> SPRINTS TO SECOND STRAIGHT WORLD CUP WIN .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ZURICH</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S><PERSON>Andrea Ferrigato</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> sprinted to his second cycling World Cup win in successive weekends with victory in the Swiss Grand Prix on Sunday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ferrigato</PERSON> , winner of the Leeds Classic last Sunday with a one second win over <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Max Sciandri</PERSON> , posted a similarly narrow margin of victory again .</S>
<S>The 26-year-old Italian surged past compatriot <PERSON>Michele Bartoli</PERSON> and last year's winner and defending World Cup champion <PERSON>Johan Museeuw</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Belgium</LOCATION> in the final few metres of the 237km race .</S>
<S>All three clocked the same time of five hours 51 minutes , 52 seconds .</S>
<S>Former world champion <PERSON>Lance Armstrong</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> was in front as the leading pack of seven riders turned into the <LOCATION>Oerlikon</LOCATION> velodrome for the final one lap sprint but quickly faded and settled for fourth .</S>
<S>The back-to-back wins vault <PERSON>Ferrigato</PERSON> from sixth to second in the overall World Cup rankings with 112 points but <PERSON>Museeuw</PERSON> continues to hold a commanding lead with 162 points after eight of the 11 rounds .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>SOCCER - <ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> BEAT <ORGANIZATION>GRONINGEN</ORGANIZATION> 4-1 TO PULL AWAY FROM <ORGANIZATION>AJAX</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>AMSTERDAM</LOCATION> 1996-08-25</S>
<S>Belgian international <PERSON>Luc Nilis</PERSON> scored twice on Sunday as <ORGANIZATION>PSV Eindhoven</ORGANIZATION> came from behind to beat <ORGANIZATION>Groningen</ORGANIZATION> 4-1 in <LOCATION>Eindhoven</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Vitesse Arnhem</ORGANIZATION> are the only unbeaten teams after two rounds of the Dutch league .</S>
<S>Defending champions <ORGANIZATION>Ajax Amsterdam</ORGANIZATION> were defeated 2-0 loss away to <ORGANIZATION>Heerenveen</ORGANIZATION> on Saturday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Groningen</ORGANIZATION> took the lead in the seventh minute when <PERSON>Dean Gorre</PERSON> intercepted a back pass from <PERSON>Ernest Faber</PERSON> to goalkeeper <PERSON>Ronald Waterreus</PERSON> and shot home .</S>
<S><PERSON>Faber</PERSON> made amends in the 32nd minute when he headed in a corner to score the equaliser .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> took control in the second half but could not score until <ORGANIZATION>Groningen</ORGANIZATION> striker <PERSON>Romano Sion</PERSON> was sent off in the 58th minute .</S>
<S>Five minutes after his dimissal , <PERSON>Nilis</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> the lead and in the final 15 minutes he added another as did <PERSON>Zeljko Petrovic</PERSON> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Vitesse Arnhem</ORGANIZATION> upstaged <ORGANIZATION>Utrecht</ORGANIZATION> 1-0 despite ending the match with only nine men following the dismissal of defenders <PERSON>Raymond Atteveld</PERSON> and <PERSON>Erwin van der Looi</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Gaston Taument</PERSON> scored twice and newly signed Argentine <PERSON>Pablo Sanchez</PERSON> once in <ORGANIZATION>Feyenoord Rotterdam</ORGANIZATION>'s 3-0 victory over <ORGANIZATION>Volendam</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> defender , who led the <LOCATION>Netherlands</LOCATION> into the quarter-finals at June's European championship finals in <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> , had decided to devote his attention to playing for his <LOCATION>Amsterdam</LOCATION> club , <PERSON>Endt</PERSON> said .</S>

<S>Indian opener <PERSON>Navjot Singh Sidhu</PERSON> was on Sunday given a 50-day ban from international cricket for quitting this year's tour of <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> , the <ORGANIZATION>Press Trust of India</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>The right-handed batsman will have to forfeit half the money he was due to earn from the tour , the news agency said after a disciplinary committee set up by the <ORGANIZATION>Board of Control for Cricket in India</ORGANIZATION> met at <LOCATION>Mohali</LOCATION> , near the northern city of <LOCATION>Chandigarh</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Sidhu</PERSON> abandoned the Indian team after the third one-day international against <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> at <LOCATION>Old Trafford</LOCATION> in <LOCATION>Manchester</LOCATION> on May 26 , before <LOCATION>India</LOCATION> began a three-test series , citing serious differences with captain <PERSON>Mohammed Azharuddin</PERSON> .</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>RUGBY UNION</ORGANIZATION> - <ORGANIZATION>All Blacks</ORGANIZATION> relive triumph .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PRETORIA</LOCATION> , Aug 25 - Captain <PERSON>Sean Fitzpatrick</PERSON> and his <ORGANIZATION>All Blacks</ORGANIZATION> revisited the test venue today to relive some of the magic moments of yesterday's momentous rugby victory over <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> , <ORGANIZATION>NZPA</ORGANIZATION> reported .</S>
<S>Most of the test 15 who beat the <ORGANIZATION>Springboks</ORGANIZATION> 33-26 to secure <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION>'s first-ever rugby series in <LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION> stood in the middle of the empty 50,000-seat <LOCATION>Loftus Versfeld</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Magnificent , ' ' said <PERSON>Fitzpatrick</PERSON> , <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION>'s most capped player and the world's most capped forward .</S>
<S>The players relived the moves and tries , the tackles and what might have been as the emotions of victory continued .</S>
<S><PERSON>Zinzan Brooke</PERSON> , the only No 8 in test rugby to have scored a dropped goal when he kicked a three-pointer against <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> during last year's World Cup , added a second to his name yesterday .</S>
<S>I was right here , ' ' he said standing at the spot where he had received the ball for the kick .</S>
<S>The maul was there and I was going to go in but I thought I should hold off because we had the ball .</S>
<S>When ( halfback ) <PERSON>Justin Marshall</PERSON> got the ball he was going to go on the openside where <PERSON>Jon Preston</PERSON> was so I emptied my lung at him to get the ball this way .</S>
<S>I just hit through and I was punching the air before the ball got there .</S>
<S>It cost me a few bucks at the bar . '</S>
<S>The decision to attempt a dropped goal was a spontaneous one , <PERSON>Brooke</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>It was just like the World Cup , the ball came and the chance was there . '</S>
<S>Centre <PERSON>Frank Bunce</PERSON> said he had never felt so exhausted during a match .</S>
<S>We were gutted and there was nowhere to hide , they just kept coming at you , ' ' he said .</S>
<S>I was gone in the first 20 minutes , completely exhausted , but you had no choice .</S>
<S>There was just so much riding on it .</S>
<S>It's amazing just how big this ground was yesterday . '</S>
<S>Two-try winger <PERSON>Jeff Wilson</PERSON> said he was so tired that he kept asking <PERSON>Bunce</PERSON> where he should be while defending .</S>
<S>He told me I'm buggered too so just hang in there ' , ' ' <PERSON>Wilson</PERSON> recalled .</S>
<S>About 4000 New Zealander supporters were partying into the early hours of today in the South African capital .</S>
<S>Messages of goodwill continued to roll into the team hotel .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>All Blacks</ORGANIZATION> coach <PERSON>John Hart</PERSON> said Prime Minister <PERSON>Jim Bolger</PERSON> rang him today to offer his congratulations .</S>
<S>He thanked us on behalf of the country , which is really nice for the team , and I understand we had tremendous support at home . '</S>
</DOCUMENT>
