<S><LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> declares food poisoning threat receding .</S>
<S><LOCATION>TOKYO</LOCATION> 1996-08-27</S>
<S>The government said on Tuesday that the threat from a mysterious killer germ , while still requiring vigilance , appears to be receding in the western <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> city of <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> , where the epidemic hit the hardest .</S>
<S>The food poisoning epidemic caused by the O-157 colon bacillus in <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> appears to be " settling down " , Health Minister <PERSON>Naoto Kan</PERSON> was quoted by a government spokesman as telling the cabinet .</S>
<S>The O-157 colon bacillus has been found responsible for a widespread food poisoning epidemic that has killed 11 people and made over 9,500 ill this year .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> , near the regional commercial centre of <LOCATION>Osaka</LOCATION> , has been hit hardest by the deadly bacteria , with nearly 6,500 , mostly schoolchildren , affected by the disease .</S>
<S>Two children in <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> have died from complications associated with the bacteria .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kan</PERSON> told a cabinet meeting on Tuesday that no new victims have been reported since August 8 , indicating that the peak has passed , at least for <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> officials agreed with the assessment , but said it was too early to feel relieved .</S>
<S>" There are still patients hospitalised and problems which must be dealt with , " a city spokesman said , citing the issue of whether to allow children infected with the bacteria but not showing symptoms to attend school from September .</S>
<S>Health authorities believe school lunches were the source of the food poisoning in <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> , but researchers have been unable to pinpoint the exact source of the infection .</S>
<S>The outbreak has prompted authorities to tighten sanitary standards at slaughterhouses and meatpacking plants and sparked calls for an overhaul of the nation's school lunch programme .</S>
<S>The ministers agreed at Tuesday's cabinet meeting to step up inspection measures for school lunches in September and October , when schools around the country resume .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>Agriculture Ministry</ORGANIZATION> also announced that it will compile hygiene guidelines based on <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> government methods of checking the safety of farm produce to prevent another outbreak of the epidemic .</S>
<S>As of Monday , 31 children were still hospitalised in <LOCATION>Sakai</LOCATION> city , of whom six were in serious condition .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> aluminium shipments surge 8.9 pct in July .</S>
<S><LOCATION>TOKYO</LOCATION> 1996-08-27</S>
<S>Japanese shipments of aluminium mill products in July surged 8.9 percent over the same month last year to 224,609 tonnes , while production rose 6.4 percent to 222,457 tonnes , according to preliminary data released on Tuesday by the <ORGANIZATION>Japan Aluminium Federation</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The surge reflected strong demand from the beverage can and housing construction sectors , federation officials said .</S>
<S>Figures released two weeks ago from <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION>'s seven largest mills already showed that <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION>'s can sheet output reached its highest monthly level ever in July , reflecting above-average temperatures that sparked a jump in beer consumption .</S>
<S>A federation official added that the half-year through September 1996 also appeared likely to set a new record for can production , despite cooler temperatures in August .</S>
<S>July inventories stood at 75,632 tonnes , down 2.6 percent from the prior month .</S>
<S>July foil output was off 0.2 percent year-on-year at 11,525 tonnes , while foil shipments fell 0.8 percent to 11,244 tonnes .</S>
<S>June mill output data were revised slightly downward to 210,622 tonnes from the preliminary 210,683 , while shipments were revised marginally upward to 213,989 tonnes from 213,845 .</S>
<S>Final figures for June pegged can stock shipments at 40,144 tonnes , up 2.4 percent year-on-year .</S>
<S>Shipments to the auto sector fell 5.5 percent to 15,286 tonnes , while the construction sector rose 2.4 percent to 79,390 tonnes .</S>
<S>Exports dipped 3.7 percent to 18,867 tonnes .</S>

<S>Israeli police demolished a 10 metre ( yard ) by 20 metre structure in <LOCATION>Jerusalem</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Old City</LOCATION> they said had been built with funding from the <ORGANIZATION>Palestinian self-rule Authority</ORGANIZATION> for use as a social club .</S>

<S>" There has been a call for a general strike between one ( 1000 GMT ) and three o'clock , " Palestinian lawmaker <PERSON>Ahmed Hashem Zighayer</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S>Tuesday's demolition came a day after <ORGANIZATION>PLO</ORGANIZATION> officials said they had bowed to <PERSON>Netanyahu</PERSON>'s demand they close offices in <LOCATION>Jerusalem</LOCATION> .</S>

<S>It says it will never cede any part of the city .</S>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION> adopts rules to improve investor access to best stock prices .</S>
<S><LOCATION>WASHINGTON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Securities and Exchange Commission</ORGANIZATION> Wednesday approved rules designed to give stock market investors a better chance at getting the best price available for their orders .</S>
<S>The so-called order handling rules , which were proposed last September , were approved in a 4-0 vote .</S>
<S>The new rules will require specialists at stock exchanges and market makers on Nasdaq to allow customers to view price quotes from other electronic trading systems that may not be readily available to them .</S>
<S>The rules will also require that customer limit orders be displayed with prices better than those available in quotes publicly available at the time .</S>
<S>Specialists and market makers are companies or individuals recognised as qualified to maintain an orderly market in a stock .</S>
<S>In a limit order , investors specify the price at which they are willing to buy or sell , as opposed to a market order executed at prevailing prices .</S>
<S>" These rules are intended to empower all investors , by allowing their orders to compete on a level playing field , and by providing the disclosure they need to make informed decisions , " said <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION> Chairman <PERSON>Arthur Levitt</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION>'s goal , he added , was to create " one system where one price could be available to everybody . "</S>
<S>The director of the <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION>'s division of market regulation , <PERSON>Richard Lindsey</PERSON> , said <LOCATION>Wall Street</LOCATION> firms will probably need to spend about $ 7 million to carry out the improvements called for by the new rules .</S>
<S>In proposing the rules last year , the <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION> noted that while technology has improved , commonplace practices still existed that worked against investors ' best interests .</S>
<S>It noted that customers whose orders were not displayed lost the chance of getting the best possible price available in the market .</S>
<S>It also cited the potential problem of a two-tiered market in which market makers quote one price to public investors while quoting better prices in private systems , thus robbing investors without access to " hidden " quotes the benefit of the best available prices .</S>
<S>Earlier this month , the <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION> settled charges of alleged malpractices on Nasdaq when the parent of the Nasdaq market , the <ORGANIZATION>National Association of Securities Dealers</ORGANIZATION> , agreed to spend $ 100 million over five years to upgrade its oversight of brokers ' trading practices .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION> dropped a third proposal that would have allowed investors with market orders to trade at a better price if there were shifts in prices before their orders were executed .</S>
<S>The agency said it would monitor effects of the two new rules before considering the " price improvement " proposal again .</S>
<S>The agency also proposed rule changes that would require continuous " bid " and " ask " quotations from exchange specialists and market makers who trade more than 1 percent of a stock during any quarter on Nasdaq .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>SEC</ORGANIZATION>'s limit order display rule will mean a major change for Nasdaq , where such orders have never been displayed .</S>
<S>The president of the Nasdaq , <PERSON>Alfred Berkeley</PERSON> , was to hold a news conference Wednesday afternoon to elaborate on the new rules ' effects on the market , the second largest in the world .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>ROME</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>

<S>A passenger train collided with a locomotive at a main railway station in <LOCATION>Linz</LOCATION> on Wednesday and police said around 10 people were injured .</S>

<S>The express passenger train travelling from <LOCATION>Steyr</LOCATION> , southeast of <LOCATION>Linz</LOCATION> , with around 80 people on board , hit the back of a service locomotive used to shunt wagons into sidings .</S>
<S>The police spokesman said he was not sure whether any more passengers were still trapped in the wreckage .</S>
<S>Doctors and medical staff from a hospital across the road from the station were at the scene of the accident within minutes and were able to treat the injured quickly , he added .</S>

<S><LOCATION>WINNIPEG</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s largest grain handling firm said Wednesday it expects to forge a partnership with hog farmers by 1997 with a view to expanding the company's scope into pork production .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>Saskatchewan</LOCATION> is well positioned to take advantage of growing world markets for pork , " <ORGANIZATION>Saskatchewan Wheat Pool</ORGANIZATION> chief executive <PERSON>Don Loewen</PERSON> said in a company statement .</S>

<S>ATHLETICS - ROVERETO INTERNATIONAL MEETING RESULTS .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ROVERETO</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Leading results from an</S>
<S>international athletics meeting on Wednesday :</S>

<S>CYCLING - <PERSON>KELLY</PERSON> WINS WORLD TIME TRIAL TITLE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MANCHESTER</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><PERSON>Shane Kelly</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> retained the world one-kilometre time trial title at the world track championships on Wednesday , with a track record time of one minute 2.777 seconds .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kelly</PERSON> averaged 57.345 kph to beat <PERSON>Soren Lausgberg</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> by eighteen hundredths of a second .</S>
<S>The bronze medal went to another German , <PERSON>Jan Van Eijden</PERSON> , in 1:04.541 .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>CYCLING - <PERSON>BOARDMAN</PERSON> FULFILS WORLD RECORD PREDICTION .</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin Ayres</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>MANCHESTER</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Chris Boardman</PERSON> fulfilled his prediction that he would break the world 4,000 metres world record in the world track cycling championships on Wednesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Boardman</PERSON> clocked four minutes 13.353 seconds to slice more than six seconds from the previous world mark of 4:19.699 set by Olympic champion <PERSON>Andrea Collinelli</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> in July .</S>
<S><PERSON>Collinelli</PERSON> qualified in second place , also beating his old record in 4:17.696 .</S>
<S>" I was very nervous before the start but then I was amazed by the speed of my ride , " <PERSON>Boardman</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>I don't know if I can go any faster .</S>
<S>Who knows what will happen in the later stages ? "</S>
<S><PERSON>Boardman</PERSON> , 28 , did not contest the Olympic pursuit because of its proximity to the Tour de France in which he led the French <ORGANIZATION>GAN</ORGANIZATION> team .</S>
<S>However , he took a bronze medal in the Olympic road time-trial and then returned home to prepare for the world track series in the <LOCATION>Manchester</LOCATION> indoor velodrome .</S>
<S>He adopted the " superman " riding position with arms at full stretch perfected by fellow Briton <PERSON>Graeme Obree</PERSON> , the 1995 world champion , and taken up in <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> by <PERSON>Collinelli</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Obree</PERSON> was forced to pull out of his title defence because of a viral infection .</S>
<S>Qualifiers for Wednesday evening's quarter-finals :</S>
<S>1. <PERSON>Chris Boardman</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> ) 4:13.353</S>
<S>2. <PERSON>Andrea Collinelli</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> ) 4:17.696</S>
<S>3. <PERSON>Mariano Friedick</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> ) 4:19.808</S>
<S>4. <PERSON>Heiko Szonn</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> ) 4:21.009</S>
<S>5. <PERSON>Francis Moreau</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> ) 4:21.454</S>
<S>6. <PERSON>Alexei Markov</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> ) 4:22.738</S>
<S>7. <PERSON>Michael Sandstod</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Denmark</LOCATION> ) 4:24.427</S>
<S>8. <PERSON>Edouard Gritsoun</PERSON> ( <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> ) 4:26.467</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>CYCLING - <PERSON>BOARDMAN</PERSON> BREAKS WORLD 4,000 METRES RECORD .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MANCHESTER</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Chris Boardman</PERSON> broke the world 4,000 metres cycling record by more than six seconds at the world championships on Wednesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Boardman</PERSON> clocked four minutes 13.353 seconds in the qualifying round of the individual pursuit event to beat the previous mark of 4:19.699 set by <PERSON>Andrea Collinelli</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Italy</LOCATION> at the <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> Olympics on July 24 .</S>

<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>England</LOCATION> soccer manager <PERSON>Glen Hoddle</PERSON> confirmed on Wednesday that the <ORGANIZATION>Liverpool</ORGANIZATION> pair of <PERSON>Steve McManaman</PERSON> and <PERSON>Robbie Fowler</PERSON> would miss <LOCATION>England</LOCATION>'s World Cup qualifying match against <LOCATION>Moldova</LOCATION> on Sunday .</S>
<S>The two men , both suffering from back injuries , joined the <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> squad at training but it was soon clear they had no chance of making the flight to <LOCATION>Kishinev</LOCATION> on Friday .</S>
<S>" They had some scans and X-rays yesterday and they're out , " said <PERSON>Hoddle</PERSON> .</S>
<S>" The more important thing for me was to get them down here and have a chat .</S>
<S>To go another five weeks without that chance would have been foolish , " he added .</S>
<S><PERSON>Hoddle</PERSON> , who has already lost the services of midfielder <PERSON>Darren Anderton</PERSON> and defender <PERSON>Steve Howey</PERSON> , delayed naming any replacements .</S>

<S><PERSON>Weaver</PERSON> had been reported after being found guilty of irresponsible riding at the provincial track of <LOCATION>Pontefract</LOCATION> 10 days ago .</S>
<S>It was his fourth riding offence this season .</S>

<S>ROWING - <PERSON>REDGRAVE</PERSON> MAY SEEK FIFTH OLYMPIC GOLD .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Steven Redgrave</PERSON> said on Wednesday he might change his mind and go for a fifth consecutive Olympic gold medal at the <ORGANIZATION>2000 Games</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Sydney</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Redgrave</PERSON> is one of only five athletes who have won gold medals at four successive Olympics .</S>
<S>He shared victory with <PERSON>Matthew Pinsent</PERSON> in the coxless pairs at the Atlanta Games and said at the time that would be his last shot .</S>
<S>But he has had second thoughts since then . "</S>
<S>I'm only 34 .</S>
<S>Some say that's too old for an athlete , " he said .</S>
<S>" But I'll be 38 by <LOCATION>Sydney</LOCATION> and that's not too old .</S>
<S>It's whether I have got the enthusiasm for the training over the next four years .</S>
<S>Rowing is an endurance sport . "</S>

<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>

<S><PERSON>Botham</PERSON> dismissed <PERSON>Mike Gatting</PERSON> with his seventh ball when the former <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> captain pushed a half-volley to square-leg on the first day of the four-day match against <ORGANIZATION>Middlesex</ORGANIZATION> at <LOCATION>Portsmouth</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Earlier <PERSON>Botham</PERSON> arrived in <LOCATION>Portsmouth</LOCATION> from <LOCATION>Southampton</LOCATION> only to be told his services would not be required .</S>
<S>He then drove 40 kms back to play for the second XI to learn that <PERSON>John Stephenson</PERSON> had dropped out of the <ORGANIZATION>Middlesex</ORGANIZATION> match in the meantime with a shoulder injury .</S>
<S><PERSON>Botham</PERSON> dashed back to <LOCATION>Portsmouth</LOCATION> and took the field as the thrid over began .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ian Botham</PERSON> began his test career in 1977 by dismissing Australian captain <PERSON>Greg Chappell</PERSON> with a long hop and went on to become his country's most successful all-rounder ever with 5,200 runs , 383 wickets plus 120 catches in 102 tests .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>TENNIS - <PERSON>SELES HAS</PERSON> WALKOVER TO U.S. OPEN THIRD ROUND .</S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Second seed and co-world number one <PERSON>Monica Seles</PERSON> advanced to the third round of the U.S. Open Tennis Championships without hitting a ball on Wednesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Seles</PERSON> , the 1991 and 1992 champion who dropped just one game in her opening match , was scheduled to play <PERSON>Laurence Courtois</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Belgium</LOCATION> Wednesay night .</S>
<S>But tournament officials announced about four-and-a-half hours before the match that <PERSON>Courtois</PERSON> had pulled out due to a left knee bone inflammation , moving <PERSON>Seles</PERSON> into the next round on a walkover .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>TENNIS - SERIOUS <PERSON>MEDVEDEV</PERSON> IS HAVING FUN AGAIN .</S>
<S><PERSON>Richard Finn</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Outspoken <PERSON>Andrei Medvedev</PERSON> exchanged his reputation as the clown prince of tennis on Wednesday for a new no-nonsense attitude that has made life on the courts fun again .</S>
<S>" I think I'm much more focused on what I have to do , and that's playing tennis , " <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> said after routing Frenchman <PERSON>Jean-Philippe Fleurian</PERSON> 6-2 6-0 6-1 in the opening round of the U.S. Open .</S>
<S>It was <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON>'s sixth victory in a row after winning his first tournament of the year last week at the Hamlet Cup .</S>
<S>" I realised this year , that without putting 99.9 percent of your mind into tennis , I don't think you can successful , " said the 22-year-old <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> .</S>
<S>" The whole day I'm thinking abnout tennis .</S>
<S>I felt that all the other things I was doing the years before , they were distracting me , they were not helping me at all . "</S>
<S>For <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> that meant confining his post-match comments to tennis and not going off on tirades about about peripheral issues such as the poor quality of food in the players lounge , an entertaining rant that took his mind off the task at hand .</S>
<S>" I know what I'm here for , " said <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> , who lost in the second round of the Open the last two years after reaching the quarters in 1993 , the same year he tried his hand as a restaurant critic .</S>
<S>" I'm not here to fight the press or talk about the food or entertain the people off the court .</S>
<S>I'm here to play tennis and to win .</S>
<S>I have much less fun off the court .</S>
<S>I have much more fun on the court , " he said .</S>
<S>Just three years ago <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> was one of the world's best , with a ranking of six after reaching the French Open semifinal and winning three tournaments .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON>'s ranking slowly began to drop last year as he struggled with a wrist injury .</S>
<S>The Ukrainian finally hit a low of 44th two months ago .</S>
<S>" It's somewhere where I wouldn't like to stay very long , " <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> said of his current ranking of 36 . "</S>
<S>It's a part of the penalty that I have to accept . "</S>
<S>As part of his new businesslike approach , <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> hired Australian coach <PERSON>Bob Brett</PERSON> at the start of this year and the partnership is beginning to pay off .</S>
<S>" At the beginning of the year we started from zero , " said <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> . "</S>
<S>Winning in <LOCATION>Long Island</LOCATION> ( last week ) was like winning for the first time . "</S>
<S>While <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON>'s 77-minute romp past <PERSON>Fleurian</PERSON> was rather ordinary , the fact that the two were playing each other was rather remarkable .</S>
<S>In the original draw , <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> and <PERSON>Fleurian</PERSON> were slotted to play each other .</S>
<S>When controversy forced the draw to be done over -- against odds of 151-to-1 -- <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> and <PERSON>Fleurian</PERSON> drew each other a second time .</S>
<S>" When I saw the new draw I didn't have to change my preparation , " <PERSON>Medvedev</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>I think it's destined that it turned out for me . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>TENNIS - <PERSON>GRAF</PERSON> WORKS HARD FOR FIRST-ROUND WIN .</S>
<S><PERSON>Bill Berkrot</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-27</S>
<S>It wasn't supposed to be this hard for defending champion <PERSON>Steffi Graf</PERSON> to win her opening match at the U.S. Open on Tuesday night .</S>
<S>But the script that called for the usual first-round demolition by the top-ranked top seed was rewritten by 29th-ranked Indonesian <PERSON>Yayuk Basuki</PERSON> playing with nothing to lose abandon .</S>
<S><PERSON>Graf</PERSON> , of course , prevailed 6-3 7-6 , but not before some tense moments that even had the German superstar thinking the match was going three sets .</S>
<S>" I won the second set , which I didn't think I would do , being down 5-2 and the chances she had at 6-5 , " <PERSON>Graf</PERSON> recalled .</S>
<S>Several of the other women's seeds eased into the second round with more typical Graf-like efficiency Tuesday .</S>
<S>As afternoon turned to evening , fourth-seeded Spaniard <PERSON>Conchita Martinez</PERSON> took apart Romanian <PERSON>Ruxandra Dragomir</PERSON> in 58 minutes with the loss of just two games , one more than second seed <PERSON>Monica Seles</PERSON> , who opened the second-day programme by crushing American <PERSON>Anne Miller</PERSON> 6-0 6-1 .</S>
<S>Third seed <PERSON>Arantxa Sanchez Vicario</PERSON> , the 1994 champion , and eighth-seeded Olympic gold medalist <PERSON>Lindsay Davenport</PERSON> dropped three game each en route to the second round .</S>
<S>But the day was not without its seeded casualties on the women's side .</S>
<S>Fifth-seed <PERSON>Iva Majoli</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Croatia</LOCATION> was picked off by Austrian <PERSON>Judith Wiesner</PERSON> and Wimbledon semifinalist <PERSON>Kimiko Date</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> , the 10th seed , fell 6-2 7-5 to 53rd-ranked American <PERSON>Kimberly Po</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Date</PERSON>'s defeat left no other seeded players in <PERSON>Seles</PERSON>'s quarter of the draw , which lost <PERSON>Anke Huber</PERSON> ( 6 ) and <PERSON>Maggie Maleeva</PERSON> ( 12 ) on Monday .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Graf</PERSON> , winner of 20 Grand Slam titles , was not about to join that list .</S>
<S>" At some points I felt a little nervous , " she admitted . "</S>
<S>When it came down to the important points , I felt more confident . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Basuki</PERSON> , a first-round loser here for the fifth consecutive year , was clearly going for winners , hitting the lines and running <PERSON>Graf</PERSON> around the court as she broke the top seed twice in the second set to grab that shocking 5-2 lead .</S>
<S><PERSON>Graf</PERSON> ran off the next three games to restore some semblance of order .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Basuki</PERSON> , her long black ponytail flying as she raced for shots , held her serve and twice had set point on <PERSON>Graf</PERSON>'s serve at 6-5 before the German unleashed a forehand pass to force the tie-break .</S>
<S>" I lost the moment , " lamented <PERSON>Basuki</PERSON> , who has reached the fourth round at <LOCATION>Wimbledon</LOCATION> four times and was a semifinalist in <LOCATION>Montreal</LOCATION> earlier this month .</S>
<S>Still , the feisty Indonesian got off to a 3-0 lead in the tie-breaker before a pair of costly double faults gave <PERSON>Graf</PERSON> her chance to avoid a third set .</S>
<S>" Usually in the first one or two matches , you want to find your rhythm and want to get into it , " said <PERSON>Graf</PERSON> , who won seven of the last eight points in the breaker .</S>
<S>" To be in that situation today , a couple of times having to play well , get down and play point-by-point , definitely is a good start . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>BASEBALL - <PERSON>SOSA</PERSON> HAS SURGERY , OUT UP TO SIX WEEKS .</S>
<S><LOCATION>CHICAGO</LOCATION> 1996-08-27</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Chicago Cubs</ORGANIZATION> right fielder <PERSON>Sammy Sosa</PERSON> underwent surgery on Monday to remove a fractured bone from his right hand and will miss four to six weeks , the club announced Tuesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Sosa</PERSON> , a leading candidate for National League Most Valuable Player honours , was injured August 20th when he was hit by a <PERSON>Mark Hutton</PERSON> pitch in the first inning of an 8-1 victory over the <ORGANIZATION>Florida Marlins</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The 27-year-old <PERSON>Sosa</PERSON> leads the league with 40 homers and is tied for 10th with 100 RBI .</S>
<S>The loss of <PERSON>Sosa</PERSON> , who appeared in all 124 games this season , is a huge blow to the <ORGANIZATION>Cubs</ORGANIZATION> ' playoff hopes .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>SOCCER - <PERSON>MARCELO</PERSON> HAT-TRICK KEEPS <ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> AT TOP OF DUTCH LEAGUE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>AMSTERDAM</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Brazilian striker <PERSON>Marcelo</PERSON> scored a hat-trick as <ORGANIZATION>PSV Eindhoven</ORGANIZATION> maintained their 100 percent record and stayed on top of the Dutch first division with a 3-1 win at <LOCATION>Volendam</LOCATION> on Wednesday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION>'s main rivals for the title , defending champions <ORGANIZATION>Ajax Amsterdam</ORGANIZATION> , celebrated the novelty of having the roof of their new 51,000 seat stadium closed against the rain , with a 1-0 win over <ORGANIZATION>AZ Alkmaar</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> were missing six first-team players but <PERSON>Frank de Boer</PERSON> shot home the winner from a 20-metre free kick in the 30th minute of a dull game .</S>
<S><PERSON>Marcelo</PERSON> , signed in close season to replace compatriot <PERSON>Ronaldo</PERSON> who left to play for <ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> , opened the <ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> scoring in the 19th minute when he fired home after good work from <PERSON>Rene Eijkelkamp</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The Brazilian found the mark again two minutes after halftime and again in the 56th minute before midfielder <PERSON>Pascal Jongsma</PERSON> scored a consolation goal for <ORGANIZATION>Volendam</ORGANIZATION> five minutes from time .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Feyenoord Rotterdam</ORGANIZATION> suffered an early shock when they went 1-0 down after four minutes against de <ORGANIZATION>Graafschap Doetinchem</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The equaliser came in the 73rd minute when Swedish international <PERSON>Henke Larsson</PERSON> scored from close range and 10 minutes later <PERSON>Jean-Paul van Gastel</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>Feyenoord</ORGANIZATION> a 2-1 victory from the penalty spot .</S>
<S>After three matches <ORGANIZATION>PSV</ORGANIZATION> lead the first division with nine points , three points clear of fifth-placed <ORGANIZATION>Ajax</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S>SOCCER - <PERSON>ROBSON</PERSON> WINS FIRST TROPHY WITH <ORGANIZATION>BARCELONA</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>MADRID</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Former <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> manager <PERSON>Bobby Robson</PERSON> enjoyed his first success in charge of <ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> as his team weathered 90 minutes of non-stop <ORGANIZATION>Atletico Madrid</ORGANIZATION> pressure to win the Spanish Super Cup 6-5 on aggregate on Wednesday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> had won the first leg 5-2 but the second leg was a different story .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Atletico</ORGANIZATION> came within a whisker of taking the Cup on the away-goal rule but squandered several chances after going 3-1 ahead 15 minutes from the end .</S>
<S><PERSON>Juan Lopez</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>Atletico</ORGANIZATION> the lead midway through the first half after <ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION> fullback <PERSON>Albert Ferrer</PERSON> and substitute goalkeeper <PERSON>Julen Lopetegui</PERSON> failed to clear a <PERSON>Milinko Pantic</PERSON> cross .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Barcelona</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Hristo Stoichkov</PERSON> made his only significant contribution of the evening 10 minutes after halftime when <PERSON>Sergi Barjuan</PERSON> broke down the right to set up the fiery Bulgarian with a simple equaliser .</S>
<S>But <ORGANIZATION>Atletico</ORGANIZATION> struck back almost immediately through new signing <PERSON>Juan Eduardo Esnaider</PERSON> and then Serbian set-piece specialist <PERSON>Pantic</PERSON> made it 3-1 with a superb free-kick in the 75th minute .</S>
<S><PERSON>Robson</PERSON> praised <ORGANIZATION>Atletico</ORGANIZATION> after the game , which was played in the <LOCATION>Community of Madrid</LOCATION> athletic stadium because of pitch problems at the <PERSON>Vicente</PERSON> <LOCATION>Calderon</LOCATION> ground .</S>
<S>The venue of <ORGANIZATION>Atletico</ORGANIZATION>'s first league game , scheduled for Sunday , is still in doubt with the <ORGANIZATION>Real Madrid</ORGANIZATION>'s <LOCATION>Santiago Bernabeu</LOCATION> a distinct possibility .</S>

<S>SOCCER - <ORGANIZATION>PARMA</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>ROMA</ORGANIZATION> AND <ORGANIZATION>UDINESE</ORGANIZATION> OUT OF ITALIAN CUP .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ROME</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>UEFA Cup hopefuls <ORGANIZATION>Parma</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Roma</ORGANIZATION> , under new coaches this season , crashed out of the Italian Cup to second division opponents on Wednesday while league champions <ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION> could only draw 1-1 at humble <ORGANIZATION>Empoli</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Wealthy <ORGANIZATION>Parma</ORGANIZATION> , now coached by the former Italian international <PERSON>Carlo Ancelotti</PERSON> , were without new striker <PERSON>Enrico Chiesa</PERSON> and went down 3-1 at serie B club <ORGANIZATION>Pescara</ORGANIZATION> in their second round clash .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Pescara</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Ottavio Palladini</PERSON> shattered <ORGANIZATION>Parma</ORGANIZATION> with goals in the second and fourth minutes .</S>
<S>Midfielder <PERSON>Marco Giampaolo</PERSON> made it 3-0 in the 38th minute and <ORGANIZATION>Parma</ORGANIZATION>'s <PERSON>Alessandro Melli</PERSON> pulled back a late goal six minutes from time .</S>
<S>The second round was the entry point for the bulk of the serie A sides with the winners going through .</S>
<S>The later stages of the cup are played over two legs .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Parma</ORGANIZATION>'s defeat was a repeat of last season's fiasco when they lost their opening cup match 3-0 to <ORGANIZATION>Palermo</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Roma</ORGANIZATION> , now coached by Argentine <PERSON>Carlos Bianchi</PERSON> and watched by Italian national coach <PERSON>Arrigo Sacchi</PERSON> , lost 3-1 to <ORGANIZATION>Cesena</ORGANIZATION> -- another repeat of last season when the <LOCATION>Rome</LOCATION> club also went out at the first hurdle .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Udinese</ORGANIZATION> , with <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION>'s Euro ' 96 hero <PERSON>Oliver Bierhoff</PERSON> in their lineup , completed the hat-trick of beaten serie A sides when they went under 2-1 to newly relegated <ORGANIZATION>Cremonese</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Milan</ORGANIZATION>'s new Uruguayan coach <PERSON>Oscar Tabarez</PERSON> avoided the nightmare of defeat but faces a replay at home next Sunday .</S>
<S>Cup holders <ORGANIZATION>Fiorentina</ORGANIZATION> easily beat <ORGANIZATION>Cosenza</ORGANIZATION> 3-1 while European Cup holders <ORGANIZATION>Juventus</ORGANIZATION> also cruised through with a 2-0 win at small southern club <ORGANIZATION>Fidelis Andria</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Two other serie A sides lost at the weekend -- <ORGANIZATION>Piacenza</ORGANIZATION> and last year's losing finalists <ORGANIZATION>Atalanta</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>Two cup matches could not be played on Wednesday due to argument over first round results .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Lecce</ORGANIZATION>'s 3-0 weekend defeat of <ORGANIZATION>Genoa</ORGANIZATION> was expected to be overturned by a sporting judge on Thursday after the home club fielded an ineligible player .</S>
<S>That would set <ORGANIZATION>Genoa</ORGANIZATION> up for a second round match against local rivals <ORGANIZATION>Sampdoria</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Nocerina</ORGANIZATION>'s 4-3 defeat of <ORGANIZATION>Piacenza</ORGANIZATION> was also subject to a complaint , later removed , that forced their second round match against serie A newcomers <ORGANIZATION>Perugia</ORGANIZATION> to be delayed .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>SOCCER - <ORGANIZATION>BAYERN</ORGANIZATION> HIT FOUR TO TAKE BUNDESLIGA TOP SPOT .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BONN</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Goals from <PERSON>Thomas Helmer</PERSON> and <PERSON>Juergen Klinsmann</PERSON> helped <ORGANIZATION>Bayern Munich</ORGANIZATION> to a 4-2 home win over <ORGANIZATION>Bayer Leverkusen</ORGANIZATION> on Wednesday and powered them to the top of the Bundesliga .</S>
<S>The comfortable victory gave <ORGANIZATION>Bayern</ORGANIZATION> 10 points from their first four games , a point ahead of second-placed <ORGANIZATION>Stuttgart</ORGANIZATION> , who have a game in hand .</S>
<S>Brazilian midfielder <PERSON>Paulo Sergio</PERSON> put <ORGANIZATION>Leverkusen</ORGANIZATION> ahead in the 25th minute but <PERSON>Alexander Zickler</PERSON> equalised just a minute later .</S>
<S>A header from <PERSON>Helmer</PERSON> and an acrobatic strike from <PERSON>Klinsmann</PERSON> gave <ORGANIZATION>Bayern</ORGANIZATION> a two-goal cushion at halftime .</S>
<S>But the pick of the 13-times champions ' goals came from <PERSON>Ruggiero Rizzitelli</PERSON> , who beat three defenders to put <ORGANIZATION>Bayern</ORGANIZATION> 4-1 up .</S>
<S><PERSON>Markus Feldhoff</PERSON> hit a consolation goal for <ORGANIZATION>Leverkusen</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Hansa Rostock</ORGANIZATION> brought <ORGANIZATION>Cologne</ORGANIZATION>'s 100 percent record to an end with a 2-0 win over the Rhineside club while a <PERSON>Sean Dundee</PERSON> hat-trick inside seven minutes stood out in <ORGANIZATION>Karlsruhe</ORGANIZATION>'s 4-0 demolition of <ORGANIZATION>St Pauli</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S>SOCCER - <PERSON>SMICER</PERSON>'s LAST-GASP GOAL KEEPS <ORGANIZATION>LENS</ORGANIZATION> IN THE LEAD .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PARIS</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Euro 96 star <PERSON>Vladimir Smicer</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> scored at the last second for <ORGANIZATION>Lens</ORGANIZATION> , allowing them to retain the lead in the French soccer league on Wednesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Smicer</PERSON> pushed the ball home in injury time to lead his team to a 3-2 victory over <ORGANIZATION>Montpellier</ORGANIZATION> , who were leading 2-1 until <LOCATION>Cameroon</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Marc-Vivien Foe</PERSON> equalised on a header in the 85th minute .</S>
<S>The win was the fourth in as many matches this season for <ORGANIZATION>Lens</ORGANIZATION> , who lead the table on 12 points .</S>
<S>In-form <ORGANIZATION>Paris St Germain</ORGANIZATION> , who dismissed <ORGANIZATION>Nantes</ORGANIZATION> 1-0 , are second with 10 points .</S>
<S>Along with <PERSON>Smicer</PERSON> , <PERSON>Robert Pires</PERSON> was the star of the night in <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> , scoring the first hat-trick of the league season in <ORGANIZATION>Metz</ORGANIZATION>'s 3-1 home victory over neighbouring <ORGANIZATION>Strasbourg</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Pires</PERSON> , one of the most promising strikers in the country , was called up for the first time this week by French manager <PERSON>Aime Jacquet</PERSON> for a friendly against <LOCATION>Mexico</LOCATION> on Saturday at the <LOCATION>Parc des Princes</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Pires</PERSON> scored first with a powerful shot in the 35th minute before striking again from close range just before the break .</S>
<S>A solitary raid allowed him to score his third in the 74th .</S>
<S><PERSON>Smicer</PERSON>'s goal was as hard-won as his team's victory .</S>
<S>Spurred by <PERSON>Foe</PERSON>'s leveller five minutes before , <ORGANIZATION>Lens</ORGANIZATION> pressed hard and <PERSON>Foe</PERSON> hit the crossbar in the dying seconds on another header .</S>
<S>The ball bounced back to <PERSON>Smicer</PERSON>'s feet and he scored .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Montpellier</ORGANIZATION> seized an unexpected lead thanks to <PERSON>Kader Ferhaoui</PERSON> in the fourth minute after a blunder from <ORGANIZATION>Lens</ORGANIZATION> goalkeeper <PERSON>Jean-Claude Nadon</PERSON> .</S>
<S>The side from northern <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> , forced to fight an uphill battle from then on , pulled level thanks to <PERSON>Tony Vairelles</PERSON> in the eighth minute but young striker <PERSON>Fabien Lefevre</PERSON> made it two for <ORGANIZATION>Montpellier</ORGANIZATION> five minutes later .</S>
<S>League favourites <ORGANIZATION>PSG</ORGANIZATION> scored a convincing 1-0 win over <ORGANIZATION>Nantes</ORGANIZATION> and confirmed they would again be the team to beat this season .</S>
<S>Ironically , <ORGANIZATION>PSG</ORGANIZATION>'s victory owed a lot to two former <ORGANIZATION>Nantes</ORGANIZATION> players , striker <PERSON>Patrice Loko</PERSON> , who scored on a brilliant shot in the 33rd minute , and defender <PERSON>Benoit Cauet</PERSON> , who started the one-two which allowed <PERSON>Loko</PERSON> to score .</S>
<S>The Parisians , who have yet to concede a goal , were without <LOCATION>Brazil</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Leonardo</PERSON> and <LOCATION>Panama</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Julio Cesar Dely Valdes</PERSON> , both called up by their national sides .</S>
<S>For <ORGANIZATION>Nantes</ORGANIZATION> , who shocked <ORGANIZATION>PSG</ORGANIZATION> to win the league crown two years ago , the fall is very painful .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>The Canaries</ORGANIZATION> , who lost most of their key players within two years , have yet to win a match this season .</S>
<S>Reigning champions <ORGANIZATION>Auxerre</ORGANIZATION> had to settle for a goalless draw against <ORGANIZATION>Marseille</ORGANIZATION> on Tuesday .</S>

<S>ATHLETICS - <PERSON>CHRISTIE</PERSON> AND <PERSON>JOHNSON</PERSON> ASKED TO JOIN <PERSON>OWENS</PERSON> ' TRIBUTE .</S>
<S><PERSON>Adrian Warner</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>BONN</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Organisers hope to persuade <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s former Olympic 100 metres champion <PERSON>Linford Christie</PERSON> to join a " <ORGANIZATION>Dream Team</ORGANIZATION> " sprint relay in a special tribute to <PERSON>Jesse Owens</PERSON> at Friday's <LOCATION>Berlin</LOCATION> grand prix .</S>
<S><PERSON>Christie</PERSON> , who is retiring from international competition at the end of the season , was not due to compete in the German capital but <LOCATION>Berlin</LOCATION> promoter <PERSON>Rudi Thiel</PERSON> said : " We are still hopeful of getting him to come . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Thiel</PERSON> has managed to get most of the Olympic 100 metres champions since 1948 to attend the meeting , which is being held in the stadium where <PERSON>Owens</PERSON> won four gold medals 60 years ago at the <LOCATION>Berlin</LOCATION> Olympics .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Donovan Bailey</PERSON> , the Olympic 100 metres champion and world record holder , and Namibian <PERSON>Frankie Fredericks</PERSON> , the silver medallist at the recent <LOCATION>Atlanta</LOCATION> Games , have already agreed to run in the 4X100 metres team .</S>
<S><PERSON>Thiel</PERSON> said on Wednesday that he had also asked Olympic 200 and 400 champion <PERSON>Michael Johnson</PERSON> to run as well as <PERSON>Christie</PERSON> .</S>
<S>" Most of the Olympic champions of the past are coming including <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s ( 1980 champion ) <PERSON>Allan Wells</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Christie</PERSON> belongs to them .</S>
<S>It would be great to have him here .</S>
<S>" There is a good offer ....</S>
<S>My minimum would be that he just ran the relay , " he said .</S>
<S>The 36-year-old Briton is still considering the offer and is expected to announce his decision later on Wednesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Owens</PERSON>'s widow <PERSON>Ruth</PERSON> is not well enough to attend but a message from her will be read out during the meeting and one of the sprinter's relatives is expected to attend .</S>
<S>The relay race , which will include squads from <LOCATION>Africa</LOCATION> , the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> as well as the <PERSON>Owens</PERSON> ' quartet , will be held at the end of the meeting .</S>
<S>Organisers had hoped to include 1984 and 1988 champion <PERSON>Carl Lewis</PERSON> in the squad but he injured himself in <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> last Friday .</S>

<S>CRICKET - NEW CAPTAIN <PERSON>TENDULKAR</PERSON> UPSTAGED BY 120 FROM <PERSON>JAYASURIYA</PERSON> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>COLOMBO</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><PERSON>Sachin Tendulkar</PERSON> marked his debut as Indian captain with a patient 110 on Wednesday , but was upstaged by dashing Sri Lankan opener <PERSON>Sanath Jayasuriya</PERSON> whose 120 steered the world champions to a nine-wicket Singer Cup win .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> , playing in front of their home crowd for the first time since winning the World Cup last March , comfortably passed <LOCATION>India</LOCATION>'s modest 226-5 from 50 overs in 44.2 overs .</S>
<S>The devastating opening pair of <PERSON>Jayasuriya</PERSON> and <PERSON>Romesh Kaluwitharana</PERSON> shared a fine first wicket stand of 129 to the delight of the 25,000 fans .</S>
<S><PERSON>Jayasuriya</PERSON> , whose first 50 included three sixes and three fours , went on to an unbeaten 120 and the man-of-the-match award .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kaluwitharana</PERSON> , slow in comparison , was bowled by <PERSON>Tendulkar</PERSON> for 53 , but <PERSON>Aravinda de Silva</PERSON> with 49 not out helped see <LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> home .</S>
<S>Earlier , <PERSON>Tendulkar</PERSON> completed his ninth century in one-day cricket , taking 138 balls to do it before being run out .</S>
<S>The rest of the Indian batting was generally tied down by brilliant fielding and some fairly tight bowling , although ex-captain <PERSON>Mohamed Azharuddin</PERSON> chipped in with 58 , adding 129 with <PERSON>Tendulkar</PERSON> off 28 overs , before being stumped .</S>
<S>The next match in the four-nation tournament is on Friday when <LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> play <LOCATION>Australia</LOCATION> in a repeat of the World Cup final in <LOCATION>Lahore</LOCATION> where <LOCATION>Sri Lanka</LOCATION> won by seven wickets .</S>

<S>PRESS DIGEST - <LOCATION>ANGOLA</LOCATION> - AUG 28 .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LUANDA</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Wednesday .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>JORNAL DE ANGOLA</ORGANIZATION></S>
<S>- <PERSON>Princeton Lyman</PERSON> , the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> Under-Secretary of State for International Organisations , will on Wednesday continue his work in <LOCATION>Angola</LOCATION> visiting <LOCATION>Bailundo</LOCATION> , where he should be received by <PERSON>Jonas Savimbi</PERSON> , leader of <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>On Tuesday <PERSON>Lyman</PERSON> participated in a meeting of a joint-commission where he considered that the Angolan politicians should advance faster and find a way to cooperate .</S>
<S>In his opinion the quartering of <ORGANIZATION>Unita</ORGANIZATION> forces must be concluded in all the Angolan territory and the troops must be selected and integrated in the armed forces , the government forces must be concentrated in the principal units and the free circulation of people and goods must be reality in all the country .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>S.AFRICAN TRUTH BODY TO SUMMON APARTHEID POLICE .</S>
<S><LOCATION>CAPE TOWN</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>South Africa</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>Truth and Reconciliation Commission</ORGANIZATION> said on Wednesday it would subpoena persons accused of human rights violations to appear before it .</S>
<S>" We can subpoena anyone we want to , even the president of the country , " spokesman <PERSON>John Allen</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> . "</S>
<S>Subpoenas are due to be served on a number of people this week . "</S>
<S>Media reports have speculated that the commission , which is trying to heal the wounds of apartheid by confronting the past , could subpoena apartheid-era President <PERSON>P.W. Botha</PERSON> and former police generals <PERSON>Basie Smit</PERSON> and <PERSON>Johan Van Der Merwe</PERSON> .</S>
<S>In submissions last week to the commission <ORGANIZATION>National Party</ORGANIZATION> leader and former president <PERSON>F.W. De Klerk</PERSON> said he had received no co-operation from <PERSON>Botha</PERSON> in compiling his party's report .</S>
<S>Since it began work in April the commission has been hearing harrowing tales from the victims of apartheid-era abuses , by both the white minority regime and its opponents .</S>
<S>It also wants to hear from those who committed the abuses , to whom it can offer amnesty in return for frankness .</S>
<S>Hopes that reformed perpetrators would come forward voluntarily have faded but the commission has the legal power to force them to appear .</S>
<S><PERSON>Allen</PERSON> declined to give say who would be subpoenaed .</S>
<S>" At the moment we have a preliminary list of less than 10 people , but this is just the beginning , " he said .</S>
<S>The commission was set up last year to probe 30 years of human-rights violations during the apartheid era .</S>
<S>It is chaired by Nobel Peace winner , retired Archbishop <PERSON>Desmond Tutu</PERSON> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Allen</PERSON> said the commission could announce the names of subpoenaed persons on Monday next week .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S>TURKISH AIRPLANE LANDS IN <LOCATION>SOFIA</LOCATION> ON BOMB THREAT .</S>
<S><LOCATION>SOFIA</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>A Turkish airliner on flight from <LOCATION>Istanbul</LOCATION> to <LOCATION>Vienna</LOCATION> on Wednesday landed in emergency at <LOCATION>Sofia</LOCATION> airport after receiving a bomb threat , said an airport official .</S>
<S>" The plane landed at <LOCATION>Sofia</LOCATION> airport at 1503 ( 1203 GMT ) after receiving a signal that there is an explosive on board , " the official , who declined to be named told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The plane , surrounded by 11 fire-engines , is being checked for explosives at the moment .</S>
<S>Nothing has been found so far , added the official .</S>
<S>In March a Turkish Cypriot airliner hijacked while on a flight from northern <LOCATION>Cyprus</LOCATION> to <LOCATION>Istanbul</LOCATION> landed in <LOCATION>Sofia</LOCATION> airport to refuel before landing in <LOCATION>Munich</LOCATION> , where the hijacker was arrested .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> <LOCATION>Alberta</LOCATION> well tests 1,100 bbl / day .</S>
<S><LOCATION>FORT WORTH</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Texas</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Arch Petroleum Inc</ORGANIZATION> said Wednesday an exploratory well in <LOCATION>Alberta</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Morinville</LOCATION> area tested in excess of 1,100 barrels daily and will begin production immediately .</S>
<S>The company said the 90 percent owned Trax et al Morinville 10-23 logged 28 feet of productive <LOCATION>Leduc Reef</LOCATION> at 5,350 feet .</S>
<S>Reserve estimates from this well are at 250,000 gross barrels of oil .</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>Trax</LOCATION> well is one of the prospects developed by <ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> through its early 1996 purchase of <ORGANIZATION>Trax Petroleums Ltd</ORGANIZATION> , the company said .</S>
<S>It said another , the Cometra et al Morinville 11-13 , has logged 128 feet of productive <LOCATION>Leduc Reef</LOCATION> at 5,400 feet and is flowing water free at the rate of 590 barrels of oil per day on a 15 / 64ths-inch choke .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> owns a 16 percent working interest in this well with most of the rest held by the privately owned operator .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> said full production has begun and initial estimates of gross reserves attributable to this well range up to one million barrels of oil .</S>
<S>A third well drilled in this area , the Trax et al Morinville 2-25 , encountered the <LOCATION>Leduc Reef</LOCATION> but tested wet .</S>
<S>At the company's Nordegg prospect , the Apache et al Saunders 14-28 , has reached total depth in the <LOCATION>Leduc Reef</LOCATION> at approximately 3,800 feet and has been abandoned , <ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>It said this acreage earning well brought an interest in an additional 5,120 acres , building the company's gross land position in this area to 8,320 acres .</S>
<S>At the Butte prospect , the Garrington 4-8 has reached total depth of 11,500 and has logged 278 feet of <LOCATION>Leduc Reef</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Testing has begun and results will be announced within the next several days , <ORGANIZATION>Arch</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>Including the costs of the two abandoned wells , the company said , these first prospects have added to reserves at a finding cost of about <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> $ 2 per barrel of oil equivalent .</S>
<S>-- <PERSON>Jim Brumm</PERSON> 212-859-1710 .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> judge orders <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> officials deposed .</S>
<S><PERSON>Leslie Gevirtz</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>BOSTON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>In order to help him decide whether he should hear the case , a <ORGANIZATION>U.S. District Court</ORGANIZATION> judge Wednesday ordered the legal counsels of <ORGANIZATION>Biogen Inc</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>Berlex Laboratories</ORGANIZATION> , a subsidiary of <ORGANIZATION>Schering AG</ORGANIZATION> , deposed .</S>
<S>The tempest beyond the test tube involves allegations that the <ORGANIZATION>U.S. Food and Drug Administration</ORGANIZATION> violated the Orphan Drug law by allowing <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> the right to sell its multiple sclerosis drug Avonex .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> also charges that Avonex is so similar to its MS drug , Betaseron , that it is a patent infringement .</S>
<S>Both drugs are types of interferon .</S>
<S>One analyst said sales of Avonex had already cut into Betaseron market share .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>BioVest Research , Inc</ORGANIZATION>'s analyst <PERSON>Eddie Hedaya</PERSON> said , " <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> sales are losing share like mad ...</S>
<S>my understanding of the marketplace is that they're below expectations . "</S>
<S>He added <ORGANIZATION>Chiron Corp</ORGANIZATION> reported its sales of inventory to <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> was down .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Chiron</ORGANIZATION> makes Betaseron ; <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> markets it , he said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> , in its <ORGANIZATION>Securities and Exchange Commission</ORGANIZATION> quarterly report for the period ending June 30 , said it had earned $ 6.1 million from Avonex sales during the drugs first six weeks on the market .</S>
<S>When it approved Avonex in May , the <ORGANIZATION>FDA</ORGANIZATION> said both <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION>'s product and Betaseron were developed under the incentives of the Ophran Drug Act which provides seven years of marketing exclusivity for products that treat rare diseases .</S>
<S>Avonex " has been allowed to enter the market because it differs from interferon beta-1b ( Betaseron ) ..</S>
<S>the <ORGANIZATION>FDA</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>Now , <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> District Judge <PERSON>Mark Wolf</PERSON> has ordered the chief counsel for <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> , <PERSON>Michael Astrue</PERSON> , and <PERSON>Robert Chabora</PERSON> , his counterpart at <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> be deposed about a May 21 meeting the two men attended to help him determine whether the lawsuit filed by <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> against <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> should be heard in <LOCATION>Massachusetts</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> filed a lawsuit against <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> in <ORGANIZATION>U.S. District Court</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Newark</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>N.J.</LOCATION> in July , but <ORGANIZATION>Biogen</ORGANIZATION> had already filed a suit against <ORGANIZATION>Berlex</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Massachusetts</LOCATION> in May .</S>
<S><PERSON>Wolf</PERSON> ordered the depositions to determine if he or <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> District Judge <PERSON>John Bissell</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Newark</LOCATION> should preside over the case .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><ORGANIZATION>COMEX</ORGANIZATION> copper ends higher after late recovery .</S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>COMEX</ORGANIZATION> copper ended higher after a late , modest recovery dragged the market from the lows , but traders shrugged-off an imminent strike at <ORGANIZATION>Codelco</ORGANIZATION>'s <LOCATION>Salvador</LOCATION> mine in <LOCATION>Chile</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The market was also waiting for Friday's <ORGANIZATION>LME</ORGANIZATION> stock report which will include figures delayed from Tuesday because of the <LOCATION>U.K.</LOCATION> public holiday on Monday when the <ORGANIZATION>LME</ORGANIZATION> was closed .</S>
<S>" We are in the late stages of the weaker period of the market , and as we get to the post Labor Day market we will start to see more consumer interest and the demand side of the market will start to firm prices up , " said <PERSON>William O'Neill</PERSON> of <ORGANIZATION>Merrill Lynch</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>December <ORGANIZATION>COMEX</ORGANIZATION> settled 0.35 cent higher at 90.20 cents , traded 90.50 to 89.40 cents .</S>
<S>September went out 0.05 cent lower at 91.05 .</S>
<S>The August contract expired at 0.85 cent down at 90.85 cents .</S>
<S>Volume was estimated at 8,000 lots .</S>
<S>Workers at <LOCATION>Salvador</LOCATION> voted to strike from Saturday , and it was not clear when further talks between the unions and management would take place .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>Salvador</LOCATION> is a small facility , and the prospects are that if there will be a strike , it will not be a long strike , " <PERSON>O'Neill</PERSON> said .</S>

<S>Average daily shipments from <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> copper service centers in July fell three percent from the previous month , but were higher than in July 1995 , the <ORGANIZATION>Copper and Brass Servicenter Association</ORGANIZATION> reported .</S>
<S>" July was still above the historic average for that month , " the <ORGANIZATION>CBSA</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>In the first seven months of 1996 , shipments of copper sheet , coil and strip were 2.2 percent ahead of the same period last year .</S>
<S>Alloy shipments , however , were 7.5 percent down .</S>
<S>" Several service centers indicated that while their volume of orders remains constant , the size-per-order continues to be smaller than what was realised during the first five months of the year , " the <ORGANIZATION>CBSA</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>Service centers continued to lower their inventories in July when total copper stocks were off two percent and alloy products down 1.9 percent .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> historical calendar - September 4 .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Following are some of the major events to have occurred on September 4 in history .</S>
<S>1241 - <PERSON>Alexander III</PERSON> , King of <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> , born .</S>
<S>King from 1249-1286 , he consolidated royal power , leaving <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> united and independent .</S>
<S>1260 - The Ghibellines retook the city of <LOCATION>Florence</LOCATION> from the <LOCATION>Florentine Guelfs</LOCATION> at the battle of <LOCATION>Monte Aperto</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>1768 - <PERSON>Francois-Rene ( Vicomte de ) Chateaubriand</PERSON> born .</S>
<S>He was a politician , one of the first French romantic writers and ambassador to the British court .</S>
<S>He wrote " Rene " , a seminal work in the French romantic movement and a famous autobiography " Memoires d'Outre Tombe " .</S>
<S>1781 - <LOCATION>Los Angeles</LOCATION> was founded by Spanish settlers and named " <LOCATION>El Pueblo de Nuestra Senora La Reina de Los Angeles</LOCATION> " ( <LOCATION>The Town of Our Lady the Queen of the Angels</LOCATION> ) .</S>
<S>1824 - <PERSON>Anton Bruckner</PERSON> born .</S>
<S>Austrian composer and organist , he wrote nine symphonies on a huge scale and three grand masses in the romantic tradition .</S>
<S>1870 - In <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> , the Second Empire was ended and <PERSON>Napoleon III</PERSON> was deposed after his surrender two days earlier in the Franco-Prussian war .</S>
<S>1886 - At <LOCATION>Skeleton Canyon</LOCATION> in <LOCATION>Arizona</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Geronimo</PERSON> , Apache chief and leader of the last great Red Indian rebellion finally surrendered to General <PERSON>Nelson Miles</PERSON> .</S>
<S>1892 - Prolific French modernist composer <PERSON>Darius Milhaud</PERSON> born .</S>
<S>He wrote a jazz ballet " La Creation du Monde " and scores for many films including an early version of " Madame Bovary " .</S>
<S>1906 - German-born <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> biologist <PERSON>Max Delbruck</PERSON> born .</S>
<S>Winner of the 1969 Nobel Prize for physiology or medicine for work on the genetic structure of viruses that infect bacteria .</S>
<S>1907 - <PERSON>Edvard Grieg</PERSON> , Norwegian composer best known for his " Peer Gynt Suite " and his Piano Concerto , died in <LOCATION>Bergen</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>1908 - <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> film director <PERSON>Edward Dmytryk</PERSON> born .</S>
<S>Best known for his films " Crossfire " - one of <LOCATION>Hollywood</LOCATION>'s first attempts to deal with racial discrimination and " Farewell My lovely " .</S>
<S>1909 - The world's first Boy Scout Rally was held at <ORGANIZATION>Crystal Palace</ORGANIZATION> near <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>1944 - <LOCATION>Brussels</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Antwerp</LOCATION> in <LOCATION>Belgium</LOCATION> were liberated by British and Canadian troops in World War Two .</S>
<S>1948 - <PERSON>Wilhelmina</PERSON> , Queen of the <LOCATION>Netherlands</LOCATION> from 1890 and throughout World Wars One and Two abdicated in favour of her daughter <PERSON>Juliana</PERSON> .</S>
<S>1963 - <PERSON>Robert Schuman</PERSON> , French statesman , Prime Minister 1947-48 and Foreign Minister 1948-52 , died .</S>
<S>He was responsible for the establishment of the <ORGANIZATION>European Coal and Steel Community</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>1964 - The <LOCATION>Forth Road Bridge</LOCATION> in <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> , measuring 6156 ft , and with a centre span of 3300 ft , was opened by Her Majesty the Queen .</S>
<S>1965 - <PERSON>Albert Schweitzer</PERSON> , theologian , philosopher and organist died in <LOCATION>Gabon</LOCATION> where he had set up a hospital in 1913 .</S>
<S>Acclaimed for his interpretations of <PERSON>J.S. Bach</PERSON>'s works , he also won the Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts on behalf of the " <ORGANIZATION>Brotherhood of Nations</ORGANIZATION> " in 1952 .</S>
<S>1972 - At the Olympic Games , <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> swimmer <PERSON>Mark Spitz</PERSON> won his seventh gold medal , a record for a single Olympiad .</S>
<S>1974 - <LOCATION>East Germany</LOCATION> and the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> established formal diplomatic relations for the first time .</S>
<S>1977 - <PERSON>E.F. ( Fritz ) Schumacher</PERSON> , economic guru and author of the best seller " Small is Beautiful " , died on his way to a conference in <LOCATION>Switzerland</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>1989 - <PERSON>Georges Simenon</PERSON> , writer of 84 books based on the detective character <PERSON>Inspector Maigret</PERSON> , died .</S>
<S>1992 - <LOCATION>Bulgaria</LOCATION>'s former Communist leader <PERSON>Todor Zhivkov</PERSON> , deposed in 1989 , was sentenced to seven years in prison after being found guilty of embezzling state funds .</S>
<S>1995 - Declaring " united <LOCATION>Jerusalem</LOCATION> is ours " , <LOCATION>Israel</LOCATION> launched a 15-month celebration of the 3,000th anniversary of King <PERSON>David</PERSON>'s proclamation of the city as the capital of the Jewish people .</S>
<S>1995 - The Fourth World Conference on Women , the biggest <ORGANIZATION>U.N.</ORGANIZATION> gathering in history , began in <LOCATION>China</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Great Hall of the People</LOCATION> with a <ORGANIZATION>U.N.</ORGANIZATION> declaration that sexual equality was the last great project of the 20th century .</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>UK</LOCATION> lowers noise limits for three <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> airports .</S>
<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>The British government on Wednesday lowered the noise limits for <LOCATION>London</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Heathrow</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Gatwick</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Stansted</LOCATION> airports and announced it would make a bigger effort in detecting and fining violators .</S>
<S>The limits , effective from January 1 , 1997 , are reduced as much as possible while still complying with international obligations , a spokesman for the <ORGANIZATION>Department of Transport</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>The maximum noise level during the day is trimmed by three decibels to 94 , while the night time level is reduced by two decibels to 87 .</S>
<S>" It is a smaller reduction in terms of loudness than was sought by local people .</S>
<S>Nevertheless I am satisfied that the overall benefits will be worthwile , " Lord <PERSON>Goschen</PERSON> , minister for aviation , said in a statement .</S>
<S>The ministry said it believed the new limits could be met with existing aircraft . "</S>
<S>They can be flown in quieter ways , " a spokesman said .</S>
<S>The reduction in noise levels is the same as proposed in a consultation paper which was published in October 1995 .</S>
<S>The present noise levels have applied at <LOCATION>Heathrow</LOCATION> , one of the world's busiest airports , since 1959 and at <LOCATION>Gatwick</LOCATION> since 1968 .</S>
<S>The number of monitors will be increased and some will be repositioned to detect noisy planes .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION> is fast-tracking immigration applications from Chinese dissidents in <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> before the British colony reverts to <LOCATION>China</LOCATION>'s control next year , the <ORGANIZATION>Vancouver Sun</ORGANIZATION> reported on Wednesday .</S>
<S>The applications are being " fast-tracked in the sense that we are processing them and the ones who have been referred to us have been interviewed , " the newspaper quoted <PERSON>Garrett Lambert</PERSON> , <LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s high commissioner in <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> , as saying .</S>
<S>" A small number already have preliminary indications as to what the disposition of their cases are and so I suppose in that sense , I guess we have given them some preferential treatment , " <PERSON>Lambert</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>He declined to say how many people were being considered for asylum .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s ministry of foreign affairs in <LOCATION>Ottawa</LOCATION> had no immediate comment on the report .</S>
<S>About 80 Chinese dissidents are believed to be living in exile in <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Their fate after the territory reverts to Chinese rule is unclear .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> hands <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> back to <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> at midnight on June 30 , 1997 , after 150 years of colonial rule .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION>'s Minister of Foreign Affairs <PERSON>Lloyd Axworthy</PERSON> said after meeting <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> Gov .</S>
<S><PERSON>Chris Patten</PERSON> last month that <LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION> may grant asylum to dissidents who have fled to <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> from <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>Chinese officials have said such dissidents may not become <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> permanent residents since they entered the territory illegally but have also said their status would be decided by the post-1997 local <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> administration .</S>

<S>He is being asked for the source of his information and who gave him this confidential document , " one colleague told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S>The <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> embassy in <LOCATION>Abidjan</LOCATION> and international press organisations denounced the sentences as excessive .</S>

<S><PERSON>Sewa</PERSON> said the rebels overran <LOCATION>Foindu</LOCATION> despite the presence of government troops in the village on the highway between <LOCATION>Mano Junction</LOCATION> and the diamond town of <LOCATION>Tongo Field</LOCATION> .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Guinea</LOCATION> launches war on fictitious civil servants .</S>
<S><LOCATION>CONAKRY</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Guinea</LOCATION> launched a drive on Wednesday to rid the civil service payroll of fictitious workers as part of new prime minister <PERSON>Sidia Toure</PERSON>'s campaign to cut government spending .</S>
<S>Deputy Minister for Finance <PERSON>Ousmane Kaba</PERSON> said teams of inspectors would check government offices in the capital and the provinces to root out civil servants who drew salaries but had left their jobs , were dead , or had never existed .</S>
<S>Some 50 million Guinean francs ( $ 50,000 ) has been pumped into the exercise to deter the inspectors from taking bribes .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kaba</PERSON> told reporters the annual wage bill of 171 billion Guinean francs represented 50 percent of current state expenditure , " whereas the acceptable proportion in countries similar to ours is one third " .</S>
<S><PERSON>Toure</PERSON> , who took office last month , has said he plans to cut public service spending by 30 percent by the end of the year as part of measures to revive the economy .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Guinea</LOCATION> is rich in minerals and has a vast potential for hydroelectric power generation but it faces stiff competition from its West African neighbours for foreign investment .</S>
<S>President <PERSON>Lansana Conte</PERSON> appointed <PERSON>Toure</PERSON> , a former senior civil servant in <LOCATION>Ivory Coast</LOCATION> , last month to clean up the administration and reform the economy following February's bloody army revolt .</S>
<S>( $ =1,000 Guinean francs )</S>

<S><PERSON>Rudolf Gajdos</PERSON> , head of Slovak <ORGANIZATION>Interpol</ORGANIZATION> , told a news conference <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> was also believed to have planned the kidnapping of at least one Slovak woman .</S>

<S>Slovak police , <ORGANIZATION>Interpol</ORGANIZATION> , and Belgian police have been following leads on <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON>'s activities in <LOCATION>Slovakia</LOCATION> and the neighbouring <LOCATION>Czech Republic</LOCATION> where he is known to have made frequent visits .</S>
<S><PERSON>Gajdos</PERSON> said the police sketch of the suspected murderer was " 60 percent identical with <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON>'s portrait " , and that <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> was known to have been in <LOCATION>Topolcany</LOCATION> around the time of the woman's murder .</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>Topolcany</LOCATION> and the area around this town were reported to have been the most visited places by <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> and his accomplices in <LOCATION>Slovakia</LOCATION> , " <PERSON>Gajdos</PERSON> said .</S>
<S><PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> , a convicted child rapist and unemployed father-of-three , led police 11 days ago to the bodies of eight-year-olds <PERSON>Julie Lejeune</PERSON> and <PERSON>Melissa Russo</PERSON> in the garden of another of the six houses he owns around the southern Belgian city of <LOCATION>Charleroi</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" The Belgian police also informed us that <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> , together with one other man , had ( also ) planned the kidnapping of at least one Slovak woman , " <PERSON>Gajdos</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" The plan apparently failed due to difficulties in crossing the border , " he added , but did not elaborate .</S>
<S>The Slovak police are also investigating visits by about 10 Slovak women , aged 17 to 22 , to <LOCATION>Belgium</LOCATION> , at the invitation of <PERSON>Dutroux</PERSON> .</S>

<S>But he added they had difficulty remembering what happened during their visits to <LOCATION>Belgium</LOCATION> , perhaps because of drugs , and were unsure whether they were filmed for pornography .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>Exiled Bosnians protest confusing voting rules .</S>
<S><PERSON>Duncan Shiels</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>NAGYATAD</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S>Bosnian refugees in <LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION> , the first to vote last weekend in their country's first post-war election , found the rules confusing and some had no idea who they voted for , refugees and officials said on Wednesday .</S>
<S>" For the most part they really didn't understand what was going on , " the director of the <LOCATION>Nagyatad</LOCATION> camp <PERSON>Lajos Horvath</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> on Wednesday .</S>
<S>" It was confusing , they had no experience of voting , many of the refugees are only semi-literate and none of them knew anything about the candidates , " he said .</S>
<S>" They just voted along ethnic lines where they could . "</S>
<S>The Bosnian election is set for September 14 and voting began on Wednesday for most of the 600,000 Bosnians living abroad .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe</ORGANIZATION> , which is running the election , allowed the ballot to be held on Sunday in four Hungarian refugee camps .</S>
<S>Some Moslem refugees among the 385 registered voters <LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION>'s largest camp <LOCATION>Nagyatad</LOCATION> have written to the <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> complaining that they were unable to vote in contests for the president or assembly of the <LOCATION>Bosnian-Croat Federation</LOCATION> , where most Moslems live .</S>
<S>This was because their pre-war homes are now in the Serb-controlled territory , so they were voting for the national assembly of the <LOCATION>Republika Srbska</LOCATION> , most of the candidates for which are Serbs .</S>
<S>For the foreign powers which back last year's <LOCATION>Dayton</LOCATION> peace agreement , the main point of the election rules is that by voting as though they were still in their pre-war homes , Bosnians should override the effects of ethnic cleansing and reassert the concept of a single multi-ethnic state .</S>
<S>But <PERSON>Adem Hodzic</PERSON> , one of the refugees who signed the letter of complaint , told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> :</S>
<S>" We only realised after voting that we were being denied the rights of other Bosnian Moslems to choose our president .</S>
<S>This vote seals the division of my country . "</S>
<S>Under the election rules citizens vote for a three-man presidency and <ORGANIZATION>House of Representatives</ORGANIZATION> for all <LOCATION>Bosnia-Hercegovina</LOCATION> and for assemblies and cantonal seats in either the <LOCATION>Moslem-Croat Federation</LOCATION> or the <LOCATION>Republika Srbska</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>On Sunday voters in <LOCATION>Hungary</LOCATION> also cast ballots for municipal councils but these will be invalidated following the cancellation of local elections by the <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> on Tuesday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Husein Micijevic</PERSON> , who also signed the letter , alleged that elderly voters were directed who to vote for by Hungarian translators who stood in the polling booth to help them .</S>
<S>" Probably 100 refugees were shown where to put their cross , " he said .</S>
<S>Seventy eight-year-old <PERSON>Mandolina Zelic</PERSON> , a Bosnian Croat who has spent the last five years in <LOCATION>Nagyatad</LOCATION> , told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> she had cast her ballot because she'd been told to by the camp authorities but had no idea who she voted for .</S>
<S>" At first the organisers wouldn't let anyone help me but when they saw I didn't understand a young translator ringed the names I had to mark , " she said . "</S>
<S>I don't know who I voted for . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Maria Szabo</PERSON> of the Hungarian office organising the elections on behalf of the <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> on Wednesday her office was studying the letter but said they had followed <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> instructions very carefully .</S>
<S>" The envelopes , each with the five different voting slips , were sealed until voting and had written instructions on how to vote , " she said . "</S>
<S>But of course those who could not read had to be shown . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>TALLINN</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>

<S>The outcome was a rebuff for <PERSON>Meri</PERSON> , failing three times to win backing in his bid for a second term as head of state of the former Soviet republic .</S>
<S>Parliament's press officer told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> that Speaker <PERSON>Toomas Savi</PERSON> will convene an electoral college involving 101 MPs and and 273 local government representatives on September 20 .</S>
<S>Both <PERSON>Meri</PERSON> , 67 , and <PERSON>Ruutel</PERSON> , 68 will automatically be listed as candidates but the election will also be open to new nominations with the backing of any 21 members of the college .</S>
<S>The winner has to secure a majority from the college within two rounds of voting otherwise the election will go back before the parliament .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Romania</LOCATION> state budget soars in June .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BUCHAREST</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Romania</LOCATION>'s state budget deficit jumped sharply in June to 1,242.9 billion lei for the January-June period from 596.5 billion lei in January-May , official data showed on Wednesday .</S>
<S>Six-month expenditures stood at 9.50 trillion lei , up from 7.56 trillion lei at end-May , with education and health spending accounting for 31.6 percent of state expenses and economic subsidies and support taking some 26 percent .</S>
<S>January-June revenues went up to 8.26 trillion lei from 6.96 trillion lei in the first five months this year .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Romania</LOCATION>'s government is expected to revise the 1996 budget on Wednesday to bring it into line with higher inflation , new wage and pension indexations and costs of energy imports that have pushed up the state deficit .</S>
<S>Under the revised version state spending is expected to rise by some 566 billion lei .</S>
<S>No new deficit forecast has been issued so far .</S>
<S>In July the government gave a 6.0-percent wage and pension indexation to cover energy , fuel and bread price increases , which quickened inflation to 7.5 percent last month .</S>
<S>In the original state budget , approved in March , revenues were envisaged at around 16.98 trillion lei and expenditures 20.17 trillion lei for 1996 .</S>
<S>The state budget deficit was originally forecast to be 3.19 trillion lei for the whole year .</S>
<S>On Wednesday , the leu's official rate was 3,161 to the dollar .</S>
<S>-- <ORGANIZATION>Bucharest Newsroom</ORGANIZATION> 40-1 3120264</S>
