<S><LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION> installs first election delegates .</S>
<S><LOCATION>KINSHASA</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>A total of 116 delegates to <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>National Election Commission</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>CNE</ORGANIZATION> ) were formally installed on Thursday , launching another phase of the Central African nation's much-delayed democratic transition .</S>
<S>The 116 , representing political parties in the capital <LOCATION>Kinshasa</LOCATION> , will help organise a voter census , a constitutional referendum planned for January and efforts to brief potential voters on what balloting involves .</S>
<S>A total of 9,446 delegates will be deployed throughout <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION>'s 11 provinces for the elections , which must be held by July 1997 under the transitional constitution .</S>
<S>Presidential , parliamentary and municipal elections are planned for May .</S>
<S>" We can meet the required deadlines for organising the elections .</S>
<S>All that is needed is for everyone to show goodwill , " <ORGANIZATION>Commission</ORGANIZATION> spokesman <PERSON>Yoka Lye Mudaba</PERSON> told reporters .</S>
<S>Delegates to the commission from the other 10 provinces will be installed progressively from next week with the provinces of <LOCATION>North</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>South Kivu</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Maniema</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Shaba</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Bandundu</LOCATION> having priority , he said .</S>
<S>The installation of delegates was initially scheduled for July .</S>
<S>Officials said lack of funding had delayed the process .</S>
<S>President <PERSON>Mobutu Sese Seko</PERSON> , who seized power in a 1965 coup , introduced a multi-party system in 1990 but <LOCATION>Zaire</LOCATION>'s transition has lagged well behind that of other states in the region .</S>
<S>In the past , <PERSON>Mobutu</PERSON> has been elected without opposition .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> would not refuse <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> officials .</S>

<S><PERSON>Ikimi</PERSON> reiterated his position that the <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> had no mandate to send a fact-finding mission .</S>
<S>" The request I have received is for their officials to come and talk to my officials .</S>
<S>We cannot object to people wanting to visit <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> , " <PERSON>Ikimi</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>Reuters</ORGANIZATION> by telephone from the capital <LOCATION>Abuja</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" The fundamental problem we have with the <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> is our unfair suspension .</S>
<S>Any discussions we have at ministerial level will be a continuation of what we began in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> on that .</S>
<S>Before that is accomplished we cannot address anything else . "</S>
<S><LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> was suspended from the <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> in November after the execution of <PERSON>Ken Saro-Wiwa</PERSON> and eight other minority rights activists in defiance of international pleas for clemency .</S>
<S>A meeting of <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> ministers in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> on Wednesday said it planned to send a team of senior officials to <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> as soon as possible to persuade <LOCATION>Abuja</LOCATION> to accept a fact-finding mission .</S>
<S>The timing of that mission has yet to be determined .</S>
<S>The latest diplomatic row between <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION>'s military government and the club of <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> and its former colonies erupted over the terms of a visit by <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> ministers to discuss <LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION>'s suspension .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Nigeria</LOCATION> said they would be restricted to a two-day meeting with government officials , but the <ORGANIZATION>Commonwealth</ORGANIZATION> said it wanted to hold meetings with people outside the government and called off the visit .</S>

<S>The electoral commission said the new 125-member national assembly would be installed on February 10 .</S>

<S>He won 69 percent of votes in the second round of presidential elections on July 3 , 1996 ..</S>
<S>His supporters will contest the parliamentary election in a coalition of 30 mainly small parties , the <ORGANIZATION>Republican Front</ORGANIZATION> , led by <PERSON>Deby</PERSON>'s <ORGANIZATION>Patriotic Salvation Movement</ORGANIZATION> .</S>

<S><PERSON>Kornblum</PERSON> , <PERSON>Milosevic</PERSON> discuss election crisis .</S>
<S><PERSON>Peter Greste</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>BELGRADE</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> envoy <PERSON>John Kornblum</PERSON> met Serbian President <PERSON>Slobodan Milosevic</PERSON> on Thursday in an effort to defuse a growing crisis surrounding <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION>'s post-war elections .</S>
<S>The American diplomat arrived in <LOCATION>Belgrade</LOCATION> two days after international organisers postponed municipal elections in <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> due to irregularities in the registration of Serb refugee voters .</S>
<S>" We discussed the decision to postpone the municipal elections and I made clear it was primarily the manipulation of voter registration by the <LOCATION>Republika Srpska</LOCATION> ( Bosnian Serb republic ) which led to this development , " <PERSON>Kornblum</PERSON> said after three hours of talks .</S>
<S>But he said the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> still believed it was important to go ahead with national elections in <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> as scheduled on September 14 to bolster the peace process .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kornblum</PERSON> gave no indication that he had won any specific commitment from <PERSON>Milosevic</PERSON> , the patron of the Bosnian Serbs , to rectify any abuses in the registration process .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION>'s Moslem political parties have urged their refugees to boycott the elections until irregularities with voter registration are resolved .</S>
<S>Human rights workers say Serbian and Bosnian Serb authorities coerced refugees to register only in Serb-held territory in <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> to solidify the results of wartime expulsions and military conquest .</S>
<S>Serbian officials have denied any abuses occurred during a 10-day registration period and the Bosnian Serbs , angry at the postponement of municipal elections , have threatened to hold local polls on their territory without the international community's blessing .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kornblum</PERSON> said only elections endorsed by the <ORGANIZATION>Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> ) would be legitimate .</S>
<S>" As we have said publicly before , if there is any effort to do so ( hold local elections ) these elections will not be valid , " he said . "</S>
<S>The elections which are valid are those conducted by the international community under the management of the <ORGANIZATION>OSCE</ORGANIZATION> . "</S>
<S>After meeting <PERSON>Milosevic</PERSON> , <PERSON>Kornblum</PERSON> flew to the Croatian capital <LOCATION>Zagreb</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>He was due to head to the Bosnian town of <LOCATION>Banja Luka</LOCATION> on Friday to meet Bosnian Serb acting president <PERSON>Biljana Plavsic</PERSON> and Bosnian Serb opposition leaders .</S>
<S>He also planned to travel to <LOCATION>Sarajevo</LOCATION> to oversee the formal dissolution of the separatist Croat mini-state in western <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>U.N.</ORGANIZATION> police , relief workers and <ORGANIZATION>NATO</ORGANIZATION> officers have reported a rise in political violence across <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> in the run-up to the September 14 elections .</S>
<S>Voters will be choosing a three-member presidency and a parliament to rule over a loose union of <LOCATION>Bosnia</LOCATION> , comprised of a Serb republic and a Moslem-Croat federation .</S>

<S><LOCATION>MOSCOW</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>A stake of 10 million shares in Russian gas monopoly <ORGANIZATION>RAO Gazprom</ORGANIZATION> was sold at auction on Thursday at an average 2,901.48 roubles a share , up from 2,891.00 roubles a week ago , the <ORGANIZATION>Federal Securities Corporation</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>FFK</ORGANIZATION> ) said .</S>
<S>Starting price at the auction was 2,746 roubles a share and the 40 lots sold for between 2,840 and 2,998 roubles a share , the <ORGANIZATION>FFK</ORGANIZATION> said in a statement .</S>
<S>The stake represented 0.042 percent of <ORGANIZATION>Gazprom</ORGANIZATION>'s capital .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>FFK</ORGANIZATION> said that since auctions began , 139.75 million shares , equivalent to 0.59 percent of <ORGANIZATION>Gazprom</ORGANIZATION> , have changed hands .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Gazprom</ORGANIZATION> , <LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION>'s biggest company by market capitalisation , has massive reserves and potentially huge earnings .</S>
<S>However , its 23.6 billion shares are highly illiquid and management permission is required to sell them .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Gazprom</ORGANIZATION> has recently tightened these rules , making it harder for shareholders to sell to whoever they want , when they want .</S>
<S>The company has organised regular auctions of its shares to create an orderly market in the paper .</S>
<S>At the first auction on March 6 , shares sold for an average 406.6 roubles each , and prices have been rising steadily since then , but the rise in price this week and last was much less than in previous auctions .</S>
<S>On the Russian Trading System , <ORGANIZATION>Gazprom</ORGANIZATION> shares rose 25 percent on Thursday to $ 0.375 from $ 0.300 , after falling by over a third earlier this week .</S>

<S>It affects the gastro-intestinal tract , causing high fever , headache and vomiting .</S>

<S>Co-ordinated guerrilla attacks in two southern states overnight that left at least 13 people dead have caused nervousness in <LOCATION>Mexico</LOCATION>'s financial markets .</S>
<S>Bank notes and acceptances , including pagares , rose 46 basis points to 25.10 percent .</S>
<S>Dealers said that the volume of longer-term government paper declined due to market nervousness .</S>

<S>Maturing credits are seen at 2.209 billion pesos , and there is an oversupply of 684 billion pesos from the primary auction .</S>
<S>Dealers estimate that the shortfall will increase due to the inflow of funds before the end of the month .</S>

<S>A Thai consular official has fled <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> after being questioned by anti-corruption police in connection with soliciting bribes to issue a passport , <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> government radio said on Thursday .</S>
<S>The unnamed suspect left the British colony after being detained and then freed by the <ORGANIZATION>Independent Commission Against Corruption</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> ) , the radio said .</S>
<S>The man was released after his arrest on Tuesday , pending further inquiries , the <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> said in a statement .</S>
<S>The anti-graft body was discussing the case with the Thai government , especially the suspect's status , it said .</S>

<S>The arrest came after the <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> received a complaint that the man had demanded a bribe of HK$ 100,000 ( US$ 12,940 ) to issue a Thai passport , the <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>At the time of his arrest , <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> officers seized HK$ 100,000 , it added .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>ICAC</ORGANIZATION> has kept a close eye on passport scams after a <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> official was jailed for trafficking fake Honduran passports as part of an immigration racket aimed at Chinese .</S>

<S>Thai poll shows military wants PM <PERSON>Banharn</PERSON> out .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BANGKOK</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><LOCATION>Thailand</LOCATION>'s powerful military thinks the government is dishonest and Prime Minister <PERSON>Banharn Silpa-archa</PERSON>'s resignation might solve the nation's political and economic woes , an opinion poll showed on Thursday .</S>
<S>Nearly half the 1,617 military personnel surveyed in the <ORGANIZATION>Rajapat Institute</ORGANIZATION> poll suggested that <PERSON>Banharn</PERSON> resign , while about 28 percent thought he should dissolve parliament and 24 percent thought a cabinet reshuffle could resolve the government's problems .</S>
<S><PERSON>Banharn</PERSON> , who leads a six-party , 13-month-old coalition government , faces a no-confidence debate in parliament next month .</S>
<S>The prime minister , who has already lost one coalition partner this month , is expected to have a tough battle in the debate because of infighting in his own party and warnings of more pullouts by other coalition partners .</S>
<S>The poll , conducted earlier this month after <PERSON>Banharn</PERSON>'s coalition completed one year in office , showed the military would prefer General <PERSON>Chatichai Choonhavan</PERSON> -- a former prime minister who was ousted in a military coup in February 1991 -- as prime minister .</S>
<S>Defence Minister <PERSON>Chavalit Yongchaiyudh</PERSON> , head of coalition member the <ORGANIZATION>New Aspiration Party</ORGANIZATION> , was the second choice for prime minister , the poll showed .</S>
<S><PERSON>Banharn</PERSON> came in last on the list of proposed leaders with less than one percent of the votes .</S>
<S>Nearly two-thirds of the people surveyed thought the government was dishonest and insincere , and 65 percent blamed the government's poor performance for the country's economic slowdown .</S>
<S>The opinion of the military in <LOCATION>Thailand</LOCATION> , which has seen 17 coups or attempted coups since the country switched to parliamentary democracy from absolute monarchy in 1932 , always carries weight in the political scene , despite officials ' vows to distance the military from politics .</S>

<S><PERSON>Michael Conlon</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>CHICAGO</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>President <PERSON>Bill Clinton</PERSON>'s triumphal appearance at the Democratic convention , a vital moment in his bid for a second term , was marred on Thursday by the resignation of a top adviser in a reported sex scandal .</S>
<S><PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> was at work on the nomination acceptance speech that will launch his 10-week re-election campaign when political strategist <PERSON>Dick Morris</PERSON> abruptly announced his resignation on Thursday .</S>
<S>The tabloid <ORGANIZATION>Star magazine</ORGANIZATION> reported the married <PERSON>Morris</PERSON> had a lengthy affair with a $ 200-an-hour prostitute who he allowed to eavesdrop on telephone conversations with <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> , and with whom he shared <LOCATION>White House</LOCATION> speeches before they were made .</S>

<S><PERSON>Morris</PERSON> declined to address the allegations directly in his resignation statement but said he was quitting to avoid becoming a campaign issue .</S>
<S>The surprise development captivated the thousands of reporters at the convention and clearly worried some Democrats , who had planned a triumphal celebration of <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON>'s lead over <PERSON>Dole</PERSON> in the opinion polls .</S>
<S>Senator <PERSON>Dianne Feinstein</PERSON> , a <LOCATION>California</LOCATION> Democrat , called it a " big bump " in the way of the <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> campaign .</S>
<S>" It comes at the worst possible time on one of the biggest days for the president , " <PERSON>Feinstein</PERSON> said .</S>

<S>The 50-year-old president has been dogged for years by allegations of financial wrongdoing , sexual misconduct and questionable judgment in selecting his advisers .</S>
<S>Republicans hope to seize on the " character " issue to bolster <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON>'s challenger <PERSON>Bob Dole</PERSON> in the final weeks of the campaign .</S>
<S>Speaking in <LOCATION>Santa Barbara</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>California</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Dole</PERSON> did not directly refer to the sexual scandal but said the departure of <PERSON>Morris</PERSON> , who had advised <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> to chart a more centrist political course , would make <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> drift back to the left .</S>
<S>" <PERSON>Morris</PERSON> has been trying to make President <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> a Republican , now maybe he'll revert to the liberal Democrat that he really is , " <PERSON>Dole</PERSON> told reporters .</S>
<S><PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> will hit the road on Friday for a bus tour across several states in his fight to become the first Democratic incumbent re-elected to a second term since the days of <PERSON>Franklin D. Roosevelt</PERSON> .</S>
<S>Aides said <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> planned to spend most of Thursday in his hotel room several miles ( km ) from the convention hall working on his speech .</S>
<S>It was apparently neglected on his long " whistle-stop " train trip to the convention , during which he revelled in contact with friendly crowds across the country's heartland .</S>
<S>He was also hoarse and was giving his voice a rest .</S>
<S>But first lady <PERSON>Hillary Rodham Clinton</PERSON> told <ORGANIZATION>ABC</ORGANIZATION> television , " He's really fired up . "</S>
<S>" He wants to outline to the American people what he thinks has been accomplished in the last four years , and what he would like to see done in the next four years , " she said .</S>

<S>He's excited about the campaign .</S>
<S>But more than that , he's very resolute about what he wants to do . "</S>

<S>I always expect elections to get close .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>Researchers report progress in muscular dystrophy .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PHILADELPHIA</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>University of Pennsylvania</ORGANIZATION> researchers on Thursday said a new gene-therapy technique for treating muscular dystrophy disease had shown progress in laboratory animals .</S>
<S>Word of the findings , to be published in the Oct. 1 issue of the journal " <ORGANIZATION>Human Gene Therapy</ORGANIZATION> , " came in advance of the annual Jerry Lewis Labour Day weekend telethon to raise money for muscular dystrophy research .</S>
<S>Several hurdles must be overcome before the method is used in human trials .</S>
<S>Nevertheless , " a treatment based on the new strategy .... may have the potential to benefit many patients , " the <ORGANIZATION>University of Pennsylvania</ORGANIZATION> Medical Centre said in a release .</S>
<S>Muscular dystrophy is a fatal illness in which the body's muscle tissue degenerates and is replaced by fat .</S>
<S>Death strikes in early adulthood .</S>
<S>Individuals with the disease have a non-working version of a gene responsible for producing a crucial muscle protein called dystrophin .</S>
<S>In the study at the University's <ORGANIZATION>Institute for Human Gene Therapy</ORGANIZATION> , researchers altered a common-cold virus to carry a version of the working dystrophin gene .</S>
<S>The virus , which also was altered to minimise its susceptibility to the immune system , was then injected into the muscle cells of mice bred to lack dystrophin genes .</S>
<S>In the experiment , between 30 to 40 percent of the muscle fibers in one group of mice produced dystrophin for two weeks before diminishing .</S>
<S>Similar results had been obtained previously in test-tube cell cultures , but not in live animals , the university said .</S>
<S>The university said methods are still needed to make enough of the altered virus to treat humans , to further decrease the immune-system response to the virus , and to deliver the virus to human muscle tissue .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>The help-wanted advertising index fell in July , the <ORGANIZATION>Conference Board</ORGANIZATION> said Thursday , reflecting the uneven nature of the nation's labour markets .</S>
<S>The monthly index fell to 83.0 in July against a reading of 85.0 in June , the private business research group said .</S>
<S>In July , the volume of help-wanted advertising fell in five of the nine <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> regions .</S>
<S>" The labour market has been expanding throughout 1996 , but in a very uneven pattern , " <ORGANIZATION>Conference Board</ORGANIZATION> economist <PERSON>Ken Goldstein</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Recent want-ad figures indicate that conservative hiring plans are keeping job growth below the rate of overall economic activity . "</S>
<S>With 2.5 percent gross domestic product growth expected for 1996 , new job growth should slowly lower the unemployment rate over the rest of the year .</S>
<S>" With the unemployment rate staying close to about 5.5 percent over the last two years , there is a good chance the rate will slowly drop to about 5.0 percent by the end of the year , " <PERSON>Goldstein</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>The July index matched the reading for July , 1995 .</S>
<S>The greatest declines in the volume of help-wanted advertising were in the <LOCATION>New England</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Mountain</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>West South Central</LOCATION> regions .</S>
<S>The greatest increase was in the <LOCATION>East North Central</LOCATION> region .</S>

<S>But he added without elaborating , " hopefully we will see some things come out in this next trial . "</S>
<S>The judge in the civil trial has imposed a sweeping gag order that prohibits lawyers , witnesses and parties to the case from discussing it with the media or elsewhere in public .</S>

<S>17 will be that he did not kill the victims .</S>

<S>He added that he has had job offers but more have come from abroad than at home .</S>

<S>I am not crying the blues .</S>
<S>I can get along just fine , " he said . "</S>
<S>Whatever you want to send me , I need . "</S>

<S>Contrary to news reports , <PERSON>Simpson</PERSON> said , he has received support from both blacks and whites .</S>

<S><LOCATION>CHARLESTON</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>S.C.</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>Health officials said on Thursday they were investigating the discovery of an amputated foot on a beach near <LOCATION>Charleston</LOCATION> to determine whether a local surgeon had improperly disposed of infectious waste .</S>
<S>The foot , which washed up on <LOCATION>Sullivan's Island</LOCATION> beach this month , was amputated three years ago from a child whose legs were deformed .</S>
<S>The foot had to be removed so the infant could be fitted with a prosthesis .</S>
<S>An orthopedic surgeon was given permission by the child's parents and the hospital to keep the foot for research and educational purposes .</S>
<S>Health officials said the surgeon told authorities he stored the foot in his freezer at home , but the freezer recently broke down and the contents spoiled .</S>
<S>The surgeon , who apologised for the incident , said he decided to put the foot in a crab trap to remove the flesh .</S>

<S><LOCATION>MIAMI</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>It was a bush that bagged the bad guys .</S>
<S>When four would-be robbers , armed and masked , showed up to rob a <ORGANIZATION>Checker's</ORGANIZATION> restaurant in the <LOCATION>Fort Lauderdale</LOCATION> suburb of <LOCATION>Pembroke Pines</LOCATION> on Tuesday , they had no idea the shrub near the drive-through window was toting a shotgun .</S>
<S>Detective <PERSON>Earl Feugill</PERSON> , camouflaged as a shaggy green bush , ordered them to freeze . "</S>
<S>They were quite surprised , " he told the <ORGANIZATION>Miami Herald</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><PERSON>Feugill</PERSON> said he made the hot , heavy suit , which he first used in the <ORGANIZATION>Marines</ORGANIZATION> , by attaching strips of burlap to a camouflage outfit .</S>
<S><PERSON>Green</PERSON> and black face paint completed his disguise .</S>
<S>He was staking out the restaurant after a series of robberies at local fast-food places .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Pembroke Pines</LOCATION> police said five people were arrested as a result of the 90-minute stakeout , including the four robbers and a restaurant employee who was allegedly prepared to let them in a back door .</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>EU</ORGANIZATION> barley sale worth $ 145 / T , for Saudi - sources .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PARIS</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>A <ORGANIZATION>European Union</ORGANIZATION> sale of 234,324 tonnes of German intervention barley is worth some $ 145 per tonne fob <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> and is mostly destined for <LOCATION>Saudi Arabia</LOCATION> , European grain sources said on Thursday .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>EU</ORGANIZATION>'s cereals management committee sold 234,324 tonnes of German intervention barley at a minimum price of 105.07 Ecus per tonne .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Saudi Arabia</LOCATION> provisionally bought 800,000 tonnes of optional-origin barley at an August 21 tender at prices between $ 160 and $ 162 including cost , insurance and freight , traders said last week .</S>
<S>But European grain traders and officials said the Saudis might reduce the purchase to 600,000 tonnes .</S>
<S>Traders have said a substantial part of the deal was likely to come from the <ORGANIZATION>European Union</ORGANIZATION> , which enjoys a supply and freight advantage over other producers .</S>
<S>But subtracting freight costs , the equivalent fob price of the deal is around $ 142 , well below the $ 149 per tonne floor price which the <ORGANIZATION>EU</ORGANIZATION> put on its barley as news of the deal emerged last week .</S>
<S>Last Thursday the <ORGANIZATION>EU</ORGANIZATION> sold 34,277 tonnes of German intervention barley at a minimum price of 109.36 Ecus per tonne , which was seen as worth $ 149 per tonne fob .</S>
<S>-- <LOCATION>Paris</LOCATION> newsroom +331 4221 5432</S>

<S>They said dozens of trucks began moving through the tunnel from both directions after the road reopened .</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>Salang</LOCATION> tunnel , the main supply route for Soviet troops when they were occupying <LOCATION>Afghanistan</LOCATION> in the 1980s , had been closed since 1994 when northern militia leader General <PERSON>Abdul Rashid Dostum</PERSON> rebelled against the <LOCATION>Kabul</LOCATION> government .</S>
<S>Witnesses said wrecked tanks and vehicles littered both sides of the heavily-mined road .</S>
<S>Mines had been removed from the road itself , but experts of the <LOCATION>Halo Trust</LOCATION> mine clearance agency said it would take a week to clear the roadsides .</S>
<S>Afghan Deputy Prime Minister <PERSON>Qotbuddin Hilal</PERSON> officiated at the reopening ceremony , which was delayed by several hours while the two sides argued about a mutual release of prisoners .</S>

<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Southern California Edison Co</ORGANIZATION> said it expected two 220 kilovolt ( KV ) power lines in southern <LOCATION>California</LOCATION> to resume service later today after being shut late Wednesday because of a wildfire raging north of <LOCATION>Los Angeles</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" They are expected to be placed in service later today , " said company spokesman <PERSON>Steve Conroy</PERSON> , adding repair crews have been removing smoke and other fire-related residues , which had settled on the two lines .</S>
<S>The shutdown of the 220 KV lines reduced by 500 megawatts ( MW ) the amount of power which the area received from <ORGANIZATION>SoCal Edison</ORGANIZATION>'s 1,200 MW <LOCATION>Sierra</LOCATION> hydroelectric facility , he said .</S>
<S><PERSON>Conroy</PERSON> noted two 500 KV and another 220 KV line running from the <LOCATION>Sierra</LOCATION> plant to <LOCATION>Los Angeles</LOCATION> remained in operation , and continued to carry some of the production from <LOCATION>Sierra</LOCATION> to the region .</S>
<S>On Monday , the two 500 KV transmission cables were taken out of service , also for cleaning , for about a day .</S>
<S>Containment of the fire has been difficult because of the hot , arid , windy weather in the region , <PERSON>Conroy</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" The fires keep moving back because of the winds , " he said , forcing the utility to shut those transmission lines for a second time this week .</S>
<S>Local authorities charged a teenager for starting the blaze .</S>
<S>In four days , the fire destroyed 20,000 acres of forest land .</S>

<S><ORGANIZATION>Sierra Semiconductor</ORGANIZATION> jumps on exit plan .</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin Wolk</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>SEATTLE</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Sierra Semiconductor Corp</ORGANIZATION> jumped 23 percent Thursday on the expectation the company would emerge as a smaller but more profitable operation after its planned exit from the computer modem business .</S>
<S>The <LOCATION>San Jose</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Calif.</LOCATION> , company was up 2-1/8 at 11-3/8 after its announcement Wednesday that it planned to pull out of the highly competitive modem-chip business and focus instead on the fast-growing market for computer networking equipment .</S>
<S>" Certainly the company will be a much smaller company now , but it will be a more profitable business , " said analyst <PERSON>Elias Moosa</PERSON> of <ORGANIZATION>Roberston Stephens & Co</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>But analysts noted that <ORGANIZATION>Sierra</ORGANIZATION> still has much painful work ahead of it , including cutting as many as 150 jobs from its workforce , which currently has 500 people , and building up the business of its <ORGANIZATION>PMC-Sierra</ORGANIZATION> unit , which makes routing devices and chipsets for high-speed computer networks .</S>
<S>The company has announced plans to take a charge against earnings of $ 50 million to $ 80 million to write down the value of assets and inventories and cover severance payments .</S>
<S><PERSON>Scott Randall</PERSON> of <ORGANIZATION>Soundview Financial Group</ORGANIZATION> said the company likely would have difficulty selling its modem-chip business .</S>
<S>" Once you announce your intention to exit a business , it becomes a complete buyer's market , " he said .</S>
<S>And he said that while the company is focusing on the fastest-growing part of its business , the market for networking chips has begun to attract the attention of much-larger players such as <ORGANIZATION>International Business Machines Corp</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" As the market develops the question is , are they able to make that transition to be a much larger company ? "</S>
<S><PERSON>Randall</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>Other analysts were more bullish , even though the company is expected to shrink to slightly more than half its current size in sales .</S>
<S>" It's a positive strategic move , " said <PERSON>Miles Kan</PERSON> of <ORGANIZATION>Hambrecht & Quist</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" The modem business is a low-margin , commodity business , " he said .</S>
<S>The company's <ORGANIZATION>PMC-Sierra</ORGANIZATION> unit generated $ 33 million of the company's $ 117 million in sales in the first half of the year , compared with $ 45 million in sales of modem chips , <PERSON>Kan</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>But the <ORGANIZATION>PMC</ORGANIZATION> unit is far more profitable , he said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Sierra</ORGANIZATION>'s stock has fallen from a high of nearly $ 25 this year as the computer chip sector has been battered by falling prices and concern about slowing demand .</S>
<S>-- <LOCATION>Seattle</LOCATION> bureau 206-386-4848</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>A strong set of interim results and an upbeat outlook from <ORGANIZATION>Slough Estates Plc</ORGANIZATION> helped to boost the property sector on Thursday .</S>
<S>Shares in <ORGANIZATION>Slough</ORGANIZATION> , which earlier announced a 14 percent rise in first-half pretax profit to 37.4 million stg , climbed nearly six percent , or 14p to 250 pence at 1009 GMT , while <ORGANIZATION>British Land</ORGANIZATION> added 12-1 / 2p to 468p , <ORGANIZATION>Land Securities</ORGANIZATION> rose 5-1 / 2p to 691p and <ORGANIZATION>Hammerson</ORGANIZATION> was 8p higher at 390 .</S>
<S>Traders said positive comment from investment banks <ORGANIZATION>Merrill Lynch</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION> also fueled the gains .</S>
<S>One dealer said positive stances from <ORGANIZATION>Merrill Lynch</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION> were the key factors behind the gains .</S>
<S>A spokesman for <ORGANIZATION>Merrill Lynch</ORGANIZATION> said the bank was preparing to issue a note on the sector . "</S>
<S>We have been very positive ( on property ) , " he said , adding : " On a technical basis it is our most favoured sector . "</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION> issued an update on the property sector on Thursday , saying that most of the predictions it made at the start of the year were being realised .</S>
<S>" In the property market it is a case of so far , so good , " a member of <ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION>'s property team said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION> said it is maintaining its forecast for five percent growth in rental incomes during 1996 , but it has shaved its forecast for capital growth to five percent from six .</S>
<S>The spokesman said <ORGANIZATION>SBC Warburg</ORGANIZATION> has also put an " add " recommendation on <ORGANIZATION>Slough Estates</ORGANIZATION> ' shares , but added that this " is a general move , not because of the results . "</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Slough</ORGANIZATION>'s chairman Sir <PERSON>Nigel Mobbs</PERSON> added to the bullish mood in the sector , saying in a statement that " with the prospect of a period of steady economic growth and low inflation ahead , there is good reason to believe that the property sector should continue its improvement . "</S>
<S>-- <PERSON>Jonathan Birt</PERSON> , <ORGANIZATION>London Newsroom</ORGANIZATION> +44 171 542 7717</S>

<S><LOCATION>Mideast Gulf</LOCATION> oil outlook - <LOCATION>India</LOCATION> holds the key .</S>
<S><LOCATION>DUBAI</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><LOCATION>India</LOCATION> will continue to hold the key to the middle distillates product market in the <LOCATION>Middle East Gulf</LOCATION> in the short term , traders in the region said on Thursday .</S>
<S>They said premiums on high quality jet kerosene have widened to around $ 1 , and are likely to remain strong in the near term .</S>
<S>" On the jet kerosene side we must be cautious about quality .</S>
<S>Some are commanding a very good premium of 95 cents to one dollar .</S>
<S>It's been 99 cents to <LOCATION>Korea</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>This will stay at this sort of price premium for a while , " one said .</S>
<S>" But for normal jet the weakened demand is quite noticeable , the premium is around 45-50 cents .</S>
<S>The differential is not normally as wide as this , " he added .</S>
<S>Another put the premium for jet kerosene at between 65 and 75 cents .</S>
<S>One trader said despite the fact that some kerosene was in storage at <LOCATION>Dubai</LOCATION> ports , demand looked to exceed supply in the near term .</S>
<S>Jet kerosene was assessed at $ 27.40 - $ 27.70 a barrel fob <LOCATION>Gulf</LOCATION> on Thursday , up from $ 27.22 last week .</S>
<S>Dealers expected premiums to stick around current levels for the next two or three weeks , before they get a boost in the second half of September from demand for October cargoes .</S>
<S>Gas oil , assessed at $ 24.00 - $ 24.20 a barrel fob <LOCATION>Gulf</LOCATION> , was little changed on Thursday from last week's $ 24.10 - $ 24.24 .</S>
<S>" On gas oil , in the near term demand and supply are balanced to a bit short , there are some enquiries into east <LOCATION>Africa</LOCATION> and short covering in <LOCATION>India</LOCATION> , " said one trader .</S>
<S>" The Indians have awarded three cargoes , but the question is whether they will come out for more , " he added .</S>
<S><LOCATION>India</LOCATION> has acquired 120,000 tonnes of diesel in three cargoes , bound for the west coast , in its October tender .</S>
<S>Traders said the award could be <LOCATION>India</LOCATION>'s lowest in recent years .</S>
<S>" After <ORGANIZATION>IOC</ORGANIZATION>'s very small purchase of 120,000 tonnes , I'm still suspicious that they will buy more in the second half of October , " another said .</S>
<S>But traders see the market remaining tight in the short-term , with some surplus arising closer to October .</S>
<S>" I see an overhang of gas oil further out , " one said .</S>
<S>" Gas oil will remain tight in the short term up to mid-September with the premium of around $ 1 for 0.5 percent ( sulphur material ) .</S>
<S>In the second half of September and October we see the premium coming off to 70-75 cents . "</S>
<S>Traders said there was not much demand for one percent sulphur material gas oil , with the premium at 40 to 45 cents .</S>

<S>Several other items have been reported found along the <LOCATION>New Jersey</LOCATION> shore , most of it such personal items as wallets , shoes and jewelry .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>FEATURE - Rich new detail on U.S. Civil War unearthed .</S>
<S><PERSON>Leila Corcoran</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>WASHINGTON</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>A freed black man writes to his still-enslaved wife , a mother pleads with <PERSON>Abraham Lincoln</PERSON> on behalf of her son and a maimed soldier poses for an official photograph in newly reopened records that bring the U.S. Civil War back to life .</S>
<S>Working in the basement of the <ORGANIZATION>National Archives</ORGANIZATION> , members of the <ORGANIZATION>Civil War Conservation Corps</ORGANIZATION> are organising the military records of volunteers who fought for the <LOCATION>North</LOCATION> so that they can be preserved on microfilm .</S>
<S>The faded documents have been stowed away in the <ORGANIZATION>Archives</ORGANIZATION> since it opened in 1935 and have rarely seen the light of day .</S>
<S>Each soldier's file is a gold mine of information : enlistment papers , muster rolls , medical records , discharge certificates , letters and photographs .</S>
<S>Since the project began almost two years ago , corps volunteers have focused on African American troops , preparing records in time for the unveiling in <LOCATION>Washington</LOCATION> this year of a special memorial to black soldiers who fought in the war .</S>
<S>More than 185,000 black soldiers fought and 37,000 died .</S>
<S>In one letter , a black soldier heading <LOCATION>South</LOCATION> wrote his wife , " though great is the present national difficulties yet I look forward to a brighter day when I shall have the oportunity of seeing you in the full enjoyment of freedom .</S>
<S>" I would like to no ( sic ) if you are still in slavery if you are , it will not be long before we shall have crushed the system that now oppreses you for in the course of three months you shall have your liberty .</S>
<S>Great is the outpouring of the coloured people that is now rallying with the heart of lions against the very curse that has separated you and me . "</S>
<S>In another letter dated January 1865 , a well-to-do <LOCATION>Washington</LOCATION> matron wrote to <PERSON>Lincoln</PERSON> to plead for her son , who faced a dishonourable discharge from the <ORGANIZATION>Army</ORGANIZATION> . "</S>
<S><PERSON>James</PERSON> is a prisoner for a thoughtless act of folly , while those who have done nothing for the cause are free , " she wrote .</S>
<S><PERSON>Lincoln</PERSON>'s notation on the letter read : " If his colonel will say in writing on this sheet he is willing to receive this man back to the regiment , I will pardon and send him . "</S>
<S>The soldier was subsequently pardoned .</S>
<S>While the letters speak to the anguish of separation , a photograph of a black amputee speaks to the terrible physical cost of the war .</S>
<S>In a picture required for his military discharge , Pvt .</S>
<S><PERSON>Lewis Martin</PERSON> , with haunted eyes , posed bare-chested to reveal his missing arm and leg , blown off during a battle at <LOCATION>Petersburg</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Virginia</LOCATION> , in July 1864 .</S>
<S>The work on black troops has provided new insight into the rhythms of plantation talk and culture , said <PERSON>John Simon</PERSON> , professor of history at <ORGANIZATION>Southern Illinois University at Carbondale</ORGANIZATION> and editor of Gen .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ulysses Grant</PERSON>'s papers .</S>
<S>" These ( writings ) are not only poetic but a linguistic treasure trove .</S>
<S>This is the first generation of African Americans that really can express itself without fear and punishment , " <PERSON>Simon</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" I think there's probably a whole lot of material that would expand our understanding of the sociology of the war , " said <PERSON>Edward Smith</PERSON> , director of <ORGANIZATION>American Studies</ORGANIZATION> at <ORGANIZATION>American University</ORGANIZATION> in <LOCATION>Washington</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The war between the <LOCATION>North</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>South</LOCATION> raged for nearly four years , claimed the lives of half a million Americans and forever seared the nation's consciousness .</S>
<S>Southern records have already been preserved .</S>
<S>They were put on microfilm about 30 years ago through a grant from the <ORGANIZATION>United Daughters of the Confederacy</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Civil War Conservation Corps</ORGANIZATION> is mostly retirees joined by students during the school year .</S>
<S>Director <PERSON>Budge Weidman</PERSON> , who has shepherded the project from the beginning , predicts it will take up to a decade to complete .</S>
<S>The work was inspired by a <ORGANIZATION>National Park Service</ORGANIZATION> plan to put computer databases at Civil War battlefields across the country so that Americans might research their ancestors .</S>
<S>The records also provide insight into medical thinking of the day .</S>
<S>One soldier was discharged because of " mental incapacity and inebetude ( sic ) of the brain , alleged by the Patient to be connected with a fall on the head but believed to arise from long continued and excessive masturbation . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>CHICAGO</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>

<S>New bomb attacks on <LOCATION>Corsica</LOCATION> despite crackdown vow .</S>
<S><PERSON>Sylvie Florence</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>AJACCIO</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Corsica</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>Separatist guerrillas planted two bombs overnight at government offices on the French Mediterranean island of <LOCATION>Corsica</LOCATION> despite fresh warnings of a crackdown by <LOCATION>Paris</LOCATION> , police said on Thursday .</S>
<S>In the latest in a wave of attacks , a two kg ( four lb ) bomb seriously damaged two floors of <ORGANIZATION>Agriculture Ministry</ORGANIZATION> offices located just 50 metres ( yards ) from a police station in the centre of the island capital <ORGANIZATION>Ajaccio</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>No one was hurt .</S>
<S>A second device , packed with five kg ( 10 lbs ) of explosive , was defused before it could go off , police said .</S>
<S>The new attacks followed by a day a warning of a new " get-tough " policy by <LOCATION>Paris</LOCATION> toward the separatists , who seek greater autonomy .</S>
<S>Interior Minister <PERSON>Jean-Louis Debre</PERSON> , under fire for staging secret talks with one of the largest of several rival underground nationalist groups , told the daily <ORGANIZATION>La Corse</ORGANIZATION> in a statement he had given " firm orders " to police to round up those responsible for the bombings and bring them to justice .</S>
<S>Judges on the island had accused <LOCATION>Paris</LOCATION> of taking a lax stance on guerrilla violence while conducting secret but widely-reported talks with separatists which have now failed .</S>
<S>The latest bombing , close on the heels of the new orders , brought charges that police were powerless .</S>
<S>" No searches , no arrests , no police reinforcements visible on the island , despite the ministry's promises , " the daily <ORGANIZATION>France-Soir</ORGANIZATION> lamented .</S>
<S>" On the island , as at the <LOCATION>Place Beauvau</LOCATION> ( the <ORGANIZATION>Interior Ministry</ORGANIZATION>'s <LOCATION>Paris</LOCATION> address ) , people are well aware who is who and who is doing what .</S>
<S>It is time to end this nightly farce , " said the pro-government daily <ORGANIZATION>Le Figaro</ORGANIZATION> in an editorial .</S>
<S>No one immediately claimed responsibility for Thursday's incidents , which brought to 23 the number of guerrilla attacks on the resort island since mid-August , when separatist guerrillas ended a shaky seven-month truce .</S>

<S><LOCATION>Sweden</LOCATION>'s <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> to open <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> forest products bourse .</S>
<S><LOCATION>STOCKHOLM</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>Swedish options and derivatives exchange <ORGANIZATION>OM Gruppen AB</ORGANIZATION> said on Thursday it would open an electronic bourse for forest industry products in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> in the first half of 1997 .</S>
<S>" Together with subsidiaries <ORGANIZATION>OMLX</ORGANIZATION> , the <ORGANIZATION>London Securities & Derivatives Exchange</ORGANIZATION> and <ORGANIZATION>OM Stockholm</ORGANIZATION> , <ORGANIZATION>OM Gruppen</ORGANIZATION> will open an international electronic bourse for forest products in the first half of 1997 , " <ORGANIZATION>OM Gruppen</ORGANIZATION> said in a statement .</S>
<S>The first commodity to be traded on the <ORGANIZATION>PULPEX</ORGANIZATION> bourse will be pulp , but <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> said trade would be extended to include products such as timber , recycled paper and other paper qualities .</S>
<S>" Through the establishment of <ORGANIZATION>PULPEX</ORGANIZATION> , <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> will have a commodities bourse for forest products which complements existing bourses for oil , metals and ' softs ' ( coffee , sugar and cocoa ) , " <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PULPEX</ORGANIZATION> was the result of a three-year project run in cooperation between <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> and representatives of the forest industry , the company said .</S>
<S>Huge swings in the price of pulp over the past few years have made pulp producers ' profitability unpredictable , and made investing in new production capacity a risky business .</S>
<S>" Without the ability to hedge prices , changes in the world market price for pulp has had an immediate impact on players ' profitability , " <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> said .</S>
<S>It said global production of pulp amounted to around 200 million tonnes per year , of which around 20 percent or 40 million tonnes was sold on the spot market .</S>
<S>At current prices , the value of this production was around $ 25 billion .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PULPEX</ORGANIZATION> will be both a marketplace and a clearing house , <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION> said , adding that the <ORGANIZATION>British Securities and Investments Board</ORGANIZATION> had been informed of <ORGANIZATION>OM</ORGANIZATION>'s plans .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>PULPEX</ORGANIZATION>'s clearing operation will be covered by the parent company guarantee issued by <ORGANIZATION>OM Gruppen</ORGANIZATION> to its wholly-owned bourses and clearing organisations .</S>

<S><LOCATION>LONDON</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>The chairman of British-based components and engineering group <ORGANIZATION>T&N Plc</ORGANIZATION> said on Thursday the firm remained confident about the general prospects for its operating margins despite pressure from unsettled markets .</S>
<S>In an interview following its first-half results , which included a less optimistic forecast for the second half of this year than it had made in the past , Sir <PERSON>Colin Hope</PERSON> said <ORGANIZATION>T&N</ORGANIZATION> had taken defensive action to protect it from patchy markets .</S>
<S>Looking at market prospects , he said : " I think our best judgment at this stage is that it will probably bumble along in the rather mixed way it's been in the first half . "</S>
<S>" It's very difficult to predict the market ( trend ) this year .</S>
<S>It could be better , or it could be worse , " <PERSON>Hope</PERSON> added , echoing the demand uncertainty across automotive industries .</S>
<S>" You can see anxieties in <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> , in particular , beginning to grow and develop .</S>
<S><LOCATION>America</LOCATION> , however , is looking a little better , " he said .</S>
<S>Compared with the end of last year , when <ORGANIZATION>T&N</ORGANIZATION> predicted a sluggish first half and a rebound later in 1996 , <PERSON>Hope</PERSON> said : " I think the difference ( now ) is the first half has not actually been as bad as some felt it was going to be , but equally we're certainly not predicting a recovery in the second half . "</S>
<S>Against this background , <PERSON>Hope</PERSON> said the group was glad it had rationalised and destocked even though this had pressed margins , which had slipped to 9.5 percent from 11.3 percent a year ago .</S>
<S>" I think the figure of 9.5 percent on the first half , when you consider the fact that we've been destocking , the fairly mixed customer demand , and the fact that we sold the ( southern African ) mines actually is not bad .</S>
<S>" It does show how easily we should be able to bounce back over 10 percent again , " he added , saying : " We continue to feel very relaxed about our general view that we would average 10 percent profit margins over the cycle . "</S>
<S>" We've always taken the view that we are the sort of company that's quite capable of working in difficult circumstances -- we're rather used to it .</S>
<S>And we feel very confident that we're doing all the right things , " <PERSON>Hope</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" When the ( profit ) figures will bounce back up again is just a function of markets recovering just a fraction , " he added .</S>
<S>Commenting on the continued struggle to get control of German piston maker <ORGANIZATION>Kolbenschmidt</ORGANIZATION> , which has been hampered by regulatory obstacles , <PERSON>Hope</PERSON> said <ORGANIZATION>T&N</ORGANIZATION>'s confidence " continues to improve " that it may eventually be able to proceed .</S>

<S><PERSON>Mark Trevelyan</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>WELLINGTON</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S><LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> Financial Secretary <PERSON>Donald Tsang</PERSON> said on Thursday he expected the territory's economy to keep growing at around five percent but with some fluctuations from year to year .</S>
<S><PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> , who made the remarks during a visit to <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> , also spoke strongly in favour of keeping the <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> dollar pegged to its <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> counterpart , and said negotiations with <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> on next year's budget were going smoothly .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION>'s economy grew by only 3.1 percent in the first quarter , down from 5.9 percent a year earlier , and some private sector economists have revised downwards their predictions for the 1996 year .</S>
<S>Second quarter growth estimates will be released when the <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> government issues its half-yearly economic report on Friday .</S>
<S>" Our trend growth rate of five percent in real terms is pretty solid , " <PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> told a news conference after meeting <LOCATION>New Zealand</LOCATION> Finance Minister <PERSON>Bill Birch</PERSON> .</S>
<S>" There will be fluctuations in individual years , but it won't be a big margin , " he said .</S>
<S>He said inflation was under control and the <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> dollar was " rock solid " .</S>
<S>Its link to the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> dollar had proved an engine of growth for the past 12 years .</S>
<S>" There's absolutely no economic or financial or political reason for us to change .</S>
<S>A lot of investment in <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> , some of which ( is ) by <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> , is predicated on the link continuing . "</S>
<S><LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> will hand over <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> to Chinese sovereignty at midnight on June 30 , 1997 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> said three sets of meetings with Chinese authorities on <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION>'s 1997-98 budget , which will span the transition period , had gone smoothly . "</S>
<S>None of our basic precepts have been challenged . "</S>
<S><LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> will retain its own currency after the handover , run its own financial and monetary policy and have control over its own foreign exchange reserves .</S>
<S>It will have no duty to contribute any taxes to <LOCATION>Beijing</LOCATION> , <PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>He described the condition of the property market as " very good indeed " .</S>
<S>" You know , we went through a little climb and a little trough over the last few years .</S>
<S>Because of speculation in the market we introduced certain measures , but they are not draconian measures , and we brought it down to earth . "</S>
<S><PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> said the market would continue to appreciate because property and land were scarce .</S>
<S>The government would put land on the market to stop rentals " going through the roof " , but this would mean reclamation , with possible environmental problems .</S>
<S>" There will be on the whole a slightly upward climb , consistent with our economic growth rate , " he said in reference to the property market .</S>
<S><PERSON>Tsang</PERSON> , the third senior figure in the government after the governor and chief secretary , said his stated aim was to serve as financial secretary for two years under British rule and three years under <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> .</S>

<S><LOCATION>HK</LOCATION> civil servants contest ban on <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> panel .</S>
<S><LOCATION>HONG KONG</LOCATION> 1996-08-29</S>
<S>Senior <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> civil servants were given the go-ahead on Thursday to challenge a government ban on them standing for the Beijing-backed panel to choose the territory's first post-handover leader and lawmakers .</S>
<S>The <ORGANIZATION>Supreme Court</ORGANIZATION> ruled that a judicial hearing contesting the ban would be heard on September 11 , three days before the nomination period for the <ORGANIZATION>Selection Committee</ORGANIZATION> closes .</S>
<S>The government maintains the ban , announced earlier this month , is necessary to avoid a possible conflict of interest because civil servants are involved in determining government policy .</S>
<S>Civil servants argue the ban stymies their political rights .</S>
<S>The 400-strong <ORGANIZATION>Selection Committee</ORGANIZATION> will select <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION>'s future chief executive to replace the British governor and a provisional legislature to take over from the elected chamber which <LOCATION>Beijing</LOCATION> plans to dissolve .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION> , a British colony for more than 150 years , will be handed back to <LOCATION>China</LOCATION> at midnight on June 30 next year .</S>
<S><LOCATION>China</LOCATION> intends to dismantle the territory's first fully-elected legislature because it opposes <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION>'s recent electoral reforms and install an interim appointed chamber , a decision that has generated considerable controversy .</S>
<S>The judicial review sought by directorate-grade bureaucrats will apply to only about 1,000 of the approximately 33,000 civil servants affected .</S>
<S>Police unions are not contesting the ban , which affects all 27,000 officers , and nor are the very top tier of <LOCATION>Hong Kong</LOCATION>'s mandarin class , the policy secretaries .</S>
<S>More than 16,000 application forms for places on the <ORGANIZATION>Selection Committee</ORGANIZATION> have been handed out since the nomination period opened .</S>
<S>It closes on September 14 .</S>

<S>" A preview of the second half of 1996 does not reveal any signs of a significant improvement in market conditions , " <ORGANIZATION>Lenzing</ORGANIZATION> said in a statement released ahead of its earnings conference .</S>
<S>For the first six months of the year , <ORGANIZATION>Lenzing</ORGANIZATION> said it posted a group pre-tax loss of 84.5 million schillings from a profit of 160 million in the year-ago period .</S>
<S>The group attributed the first-half losses to weak demand and falling prices of viscose fibres , as well as sluggish economies in the <LOCATION>West</LOCATION> .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> faults <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> over Islamists gathering .</S>
<S><LOCATION>PARIS</LOCATION> 1996-08-28</S>
<S><LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> , fighting a vicious war against Moslem fundamentalist guerrillas , attacked <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> on Wednesday for allowing Islamist groups to meet in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>The Islamist gathering , due to be held in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> on September 8 , has triggered concern and anger in several other Arab countries like <LOCATION>Egypt</LOCATION> which is also fighting armed Moslem fundamentalists .</S>
<S>British Jewish groups have also voiced protest because they said Palestinian Islamist <ORGANIZATION>Hamas</ORGANIZATION> as well as the banned Algerian <ORGANIZATION>Islamic Salvation Front</ORGANIZATION> ( <ORGANIZATION>FIS</ORGANIZATION> ) are among those radical Islamists attending the conference .</S>
<S>A foreign ministry spokesman said in a statement read on Algerian television that <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> " has received with concern the information over a meeting of terrorist groups working against the interests of the Arab and Islamic world . "</S>
<S>" <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> expresses its sharp rejection of a meeting putting together masterminds and ideologists and financers of terrorism , " the spokesman said , adding the Algerian government has asked the British embassy in <LOCATION>Algiers</LOCATION> for clarifications .</S>
<S>The Algerian ambassador in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> has also asked for clarification from the <ORGANIZATION>Foreign Office</ORGANIZATION> over the meeting of Islamist groups .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> said " they are clearly working to undermine the stability " of Arab countries .</S>
<S>British Foreign Secretary <PERSON>Malcolm Rifkind</PERSON> said on Tuesday from <LOCATION>Pakistan</LOCATION> his government would only take action against the planned Islamists gathering in <LOCATION>London</LOCATION> if British law was broken .</S>
<S>" People who wish to hold conferences of course don't need to seek permission from the government in <LOCATION>Britain</LOCATION> , " he said .</S>
<S>An estimated 50,000 people , including more than 110 foreigners , have been killed in <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION>'s violence pitting Moslem rebels against government forces since early 1992 when authorities in <LOCATION>Algeria</LOCATION> cancelled a general election in which <ORGANIZATION>FIS</ORGANIZATION> had taken a commanding lead .</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S><LOCATION>Wall Street</LOCATION> ponders <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON>'s role if <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> wins .</S>
<S><PERSON>Donna Sells</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>NEW YORK</LOCATION></S>
<S>The outcome of the November elections emerged as a hot topic on <LOCATION>Wall Street</LOCATION> this week as financial pundits debated whether <PERSON>Robert Rubin</PERSON> might forgo a second term as <ORGANIZATION>Treasury</ORGANIZATION> secretary if President <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> is re-elected .</S>
<S>Concern centred on the currency markets since <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON>'s tour de force has been his unflagging support of the dollar .</S>
<S>Speculation that <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> might not stay in his post grew after he sidestepped questions about any future <ORGANIZATION>Cabinet</ORGANIZATION> post during television interviews at the Democratic convention in <LOCATION>Chicago</LOCATION> this week .</S>
<S>Should <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> leave , <LOCATION>Wall Street</LOCATION> would worry that he might take his strong-dollar policy with him .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rubin</PERSON>'s predecessor at the <ORGANIZATION>Treasury</ORGANIZATION> , <PERSON>Lloyd Bentsen</PERSON> , was viewed with suspicion by some in the financial markets who thought he had tried to push down the dollar to gain an edge in trade negotiations with <LOCATION>Japan</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" Obviously , under the <PERSON>Clinton</PERSON> administration , we've seen two distinctively different dollar policies , " said <PERSON>Chris Widness</PERSON> , an international economist at <ORGANIZATION>Chase Securities Inc.</ORGANIZATION> " Under <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> , the <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> has certainly looked for a strong dollar . "</S>
<S>That strategy , backed up by timely instances of joint central bank intervention , helped the dollar battle back from post-Second World War lows of 1.3438 German marks on March 8 , 1995 , and 79.75 Japanese yen on April 19 , 1995 .</S>
<S>Currently , the dollar stands at about 1.48 marks and 109 yen .</S>
<S><PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> was widely hailed as the architect of the dollar's comeback , using skills and expertise gained in 26 years on <LOCATION>Wall Street</LOCATION> , part of which were spent as co-chairman of <ORGANIZATION>Goldman , Sachs and Co .</ORGANIZATION></S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Inc</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> has done a fine job in that position , " said <PERSON>Michael Faust</PERSON> , a portfolio manager at <ORGANIZATION>Bailard , Biehl and Kaiser</ORGANIZATION> , which manages just under $ 1 billion in global stocks and bonds .</S>
<S>" Anyone who would come in there to replace him would have awfully big shoes to fill . "</S>
<S>Fear that a new <ORGANIZATION>Treasury</ORGANIZATION> secretary might favour a return to Bentsen-era policy could spell trouble for financial markets .</S>
<S>Some overseas investors might shy away from buying <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> stocks and bonds or even sell them when the dollar is weakening .</S>
<S>As for <ORGANIZATION>U.S. Treasury</ORGANIZATION> securities , <PERSON>Widness</PERSON> explained that <PERSON>Alan Greenspan</PERSON>'s reappointment as chairman of the <ORGANIZATION>Federal Reserve</ORGANIZATION> and the outlook for the federal budget were more important than whether <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> continues at the <ORGANIZATION>Treasury</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" Although , if we did get someone that was seen as looking for a dollar depreciation , it would probably hurt capital flows to the <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> , " said <PERSON>Widness</PERSON> , adding that could hurt <LOCATION>U.S.</LOCATION> stocks and , to a lesser degree , bonds .</S>
<S>Still , markets may have little to fear from any <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> successor because the firm dollar policy has yielded positive results .</S>
<S>If that is true , then any new <ORGANIZATION>Treasury</ORGANIZATION> chief would need to be as effective as <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> in convincing markets that the <LOCATION>White House</LOCATION> does indeed want a strong currency .</S>
<S>" If he left , the first question people would ask the next guy is , ' What's your view on the dollar ? '</S>
<S>" said <PERSON>Michael Perelstein</PERSON> , portfolio manager of <ORGANIZATION>MainStay International Funds</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S>" And all I can say as a piece of advice is that they'd better say exactly the same thing ( as <PERSON>Rubin</PERSON> ) , if not stronger , " <PERSON>Perelstein</PERSON> said . "</S>
<S>Otherwise , you get selling out of <LOCATION>Tokyo</LOCATION> and <LOCATION>Frankfurt</LOCATION> again . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S><LOCATION>AMSTETTEN</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Austria</LOCATION> 1996-08-30</S>

<DOCUMENT>
<S>SOCCER - <LOCATION>WALES</LOCATION> BEAT <LOCATION>SAN MARINO</LOCATION> 4-0 IN UNDER-21 MATCH .</S>
<S><LOCATION>BARRY</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Wales</LOCATION> 1996-08-30</S>
<S><LOCATION>Wales</LOCATION> beat <LOCATION>San Marino</LOCATION> 4-0 ( halftime 2-0 ) in a European under-21 soccer match on Friday .</S>

<S>CYCLING - <PERSON>BALLANGER</PERSON> KEEPS SPRINT TITLE IN STYLE .</S>
<S><PERSON>Martin Ayres</PERSON></S>
<S><LOCATION>MANCHESTER</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>England</LOCATION> 1996-08-30</S>
<S><PERSON>Felicia Ballanger</PERSON> of <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> confirmed her status as the world's number one woman sprinter when she retained her title at the world cycling championships on Friday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ballanger</PERSON> beat <LOCATION>Germany</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Annett Neumann</PERSON> 2-0 in the best-of-three matches final to add the world title to the Olympic gold medal she won in July .</S>
<S><LOCATION>France</LOCATION> also took third place in the sprint , <PERSON>Magali Faure</PERSON> defeating ex-world champion <PERSON>Tanya Dubnicoff</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Canada</LOCATION> 2-0 .</S>
<S><PERSON>Ballanger</PERSON> , 25 , will be aiming to complete a track double when she defends her 500 metres time trial title on Saturday .</S>
<S>The other final of the night , the women's 24-kms points race , also ended in success for the reigning champion .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION>'s <PERSON>Svetlana Samokhalova</PERSON> fought off a spirited challenge from American <PERSON>Jane Quigley</PERSON> to take the title for a second year .</S>
<S><LOCATION>Russia</LOCATION> , the only nation to have two riders in the field , made full use of their numerical superiority .</S>
<S><PERSON>Goulnara Fatkoullina</PERSON> helped <PERSON>Samokhalova</PERSON> to build an unbeatable points lead before snatching the bronze medal .</S>
<S><PERSON>Quigley</PERSON> , a former medallist in the points event , led the race at half distance . "</S>
<S>I went so close this time , but having two riders certainly gave the Russians an advantage , " she said .</S>
<S>The first six riders lapped the field , which left former world champion <PERSON>Ingrid Haringa</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>Netherlands</LOCATION> down in seventh place despite having the second highest points score .</S>
<S>Olympic champion <PERSON>Nathalie Lancien</PERSON> of <LOCATION>France</LOCATION> also missed the winning attack and finished a disappointing 10th .</S>
</DOCUMENT>

<S>SOCCER - FRENCH DEFENDER <PERSON>KOMBOUARE</PERSON> JOINS <ORGANIZATION>ABERDEEN</ORGANIZATION> .</S>
<S><LOCATION>ABDERDEEN</LOCATION> , <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> 1996-08-30</S>
<S>French central defender <PERSON>Antoine Kombouare</PERSON> has completed a 300,000 pounds sterling ( $ 467,000 ) move to <ORGANIZATION>Aberdeen</ORGANIZATION> from Swiss club <ORGANIZATION>Sion</ORGANIZATION> , the Scottish premier division club said on Friday .</S>
<S><PERSON>Kombouare</PERSON> has signed a two-year contract and will make his debut against <PERSON>Morton</PERSON> in the Scottish League Cup on Tuesday .</S>
<S>But he will be ineligible for the rest of <ORGANIZATION>Aberdeen</ORGANIZATION>'s UEFA Cup campaign as he has already played for <ORGANIZATION>Sion</ORGANIZATION> in this season's Cup Winners ' Cup .</S>
<S><ORGANIZATION>Aberdeen</ORGANIZATION> manager <PERSON>Roy Aitken</PERSON> said : " It's unfortunate for us that <PERSON>Antoine</PERSON> cannot play in <LOCATION>Europe</LOCATION> but he will help us achieve things in domestic competition .</S>
<S>" I have been watching him for several weeks now and have no doubts he brings real quality to the side .</S>
<S>He has a great deal of experience and I'm sure he will quickly establish himself in both the team and the affection of our fans . "</S>
<S>The 32-year-old defender played seven seasons with <ORGANIZATION>Nantes</ORGANIZATION> and was with <ORGANIZATION>Paris St Germain</ORGANIZATION> for five seasons .</S>
<S>He said former <ORGANIZATION>PSG</ORGANIZATION> team mate <PERSON>David Ginola</PERSON> , who now plays for English premier league <ORGANIZATION>Newcastle</ORGANIZATION> , was influential in his move to <LOCATION>Scotland</LOCATION> .</S>
<S>" I'm a very good friend of <PERSON>David</PERSON> and spoke to him recently about coming to <ORGANIZATION>Aberdeen</ORGANIZATION> and he was very positive about it , " <PERSON>Kombouare</PERSON> said .</S>
<S>" He said I would really enjoy life there and that I would settle in in terms of football as well .</S>
<S>That , and the fact he is only a few hours drive away , influenced my decision to come to <ORGANIZATION>Aberdeen</ORGANIZATION> . "</S>
</DOCUMENT>
